MASSACHUSETTS 



SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 



REVOLUTIONARY WAR 



A COMPILATION FROM THE ARCHIVES, 

PREPARED AND PVHLISHED HY THE 

SECRETARY OF THE COMMONWEALTH 

IN ACCORDANCE "WITH CHAPTER 100, RESOLVES 
OF 1891. 



BOSTON : 

WRIGHT & POTTER PRINTING CO., STATE PRINTERS, 

18 POST OFFICE SQUARE. 

1906.

MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 

IN THE 

WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 



NOTE. All names are given exactly as they appear on the original records. The order of 
arrangement of the facts of service in each individual record given is the same, as nearly as pos 
sible, as the original entries, and is as follows : The name; the place of residence, if given; the 
rank; the kind of document whereon the record appears; the enlistment and discharge, if 
given; the time of service; remarks. 

A discrepancy will sometimes be noted between the service given and the actual service as 
figured between the dates of enlistment and discharge. The difference is accounted for by the 
practice of including, with service performed, a time allowance for travel on the basis of one 
day for every 20 miles out or home. As the same name may appear under various forms, each 
carrying some portion of a record of service, it is necessary in order to obtain the complete 
record, as far as preserved, of any given individual, to examine all the forms under which 
a name is stated to appear in the Record Index. 



OHA, JOHX, Chesterfield. Private, Capt. Robert Webster s (8th) co., Col. John 
^ Fellows s (8th) regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted April 27, 1775; 
service, 3 mos. 12 days; also, company return dated Dorchester, Oct. 8, 1775.

SHACKELFOKD, HENRY. Matross, Capt. William Pierce s co., Col. John Crane s 
(Artillery) regt. ; muster rolls for Sept. and Nov., 1778, dated Camp at Provi 
dence ; enlisted Dec. 28, 1776; enlistment, 3 years ; also, Capt. Pierce s co., Col. 
Crane s (also given Col. Harrison s) regt.; muster roll for Dec., 1778, dated 
Providence; also, Capt. Pierce s co., Col. Crane s regt. ; muster rolls for Jan. 
and Feb., 1779, dated Providence ; also, same co. and regt. ; pay roll for March, 
1779. 

SHACKELFORD, " MAGG." Matross, Capt. William Pierce s co., Col. John Crane s 
(Artillery) regt. ; muster rolls for Sept. and Nov., 1778, dated Camp at Provi 
dence; enlisted Dec. 28. 177(5; enlistment, 3 years ; also, Capt. Pierce s co., Col. 
Crane s (also given Col. Harrison s) regt.; muster roll for Dec., 1778, dated 
Providence; also, Capt. Pierce s co., Col. Crane s regt. ; muster rolls for Jan. 
and Feb., 1779, dated Providence ; also, same co. and regt. ; payroll for March, 
1779. 

SHACKFIELD, . [This name also appears under the form of Schacrield.] 

SHACKFIELD, EDWARD. Seaman, brigantine "Tyrannicide," commanded by Capt. 
Allen Hallet ; engaged Jan. 29, 1779 ; roll made up for advance pay for 1 month, 
dated Boston ; also, Seaman, brigantine " Active," commanded by Capt. Allen 
Hallet; engaged June 4, 1779; discharged Aug. 31, 1779; service, 2 mos. 28 
days; roll sworn to in Suffolk Co.; also, Seaman, ship "Protector," com 
manded by Capt. John Foster Williams ; engaged March 7, 1780 ; discharged 
Aug. 17, 1780 ; service, 5 mos. 10 days.

SHACKFOUD, JOHX, Newburyport. Private, Capt. Ezra Lunt s co., Col. Moses 
Littlt- s (17th) regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted July 17, 1775;

word " Quebeck " appears after name. 

SHACKFOKD, PATL. Private, Capt. Tobias Lord s co. : marched Jan. 29, 1776: ser 
vice to Nov. 25, 1776, 9 mos. 28 days; company stationed at Falmouth, Cum 
berland Co., for defence of seacoast. 

SHArKFoKD, SAMI-KL, Wells. Return of men mustered by Nathaniel Wells, Muster 
Master for York Co., certified in York Co., June 6, 1780; said Shackford 
appears among men mustered to serve for 8 months in defence of eastern 
Massachusetts, agreeable to resolve of March 25, 1780; residence, Wells: also, 
Private. Capt. Daniel Clark s co., Col. Joseph Prime s regt. ; joined May 9, 
17.SO; discharged Dec. 8, 1780: service, 7 mos. ; enlistment, 8 months ; regiment 
raised in York Co. for defence of eastern Massachusetts. 

SHACKFORD, WILLIAM, Newburyport. Private, Capt. Moses Nowell s co., which 
marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 4 days; also, Capt. Ezra 
Lunt s co.. Col. Moses Little s (17th) regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; 
enlisted May 2, 1775: service, 13 weeks; also, company return [probably Oct., 
1775] ; age, 22 yrs. ; the word " Quebec k " appears after name: also, Corporal, 
Capt. Moses Nowell s co. ; list of seacoast men stationed at Plum Island near 
Newburyport : company reported as having passed muster in a return made by 
Jonathan Titcomb, Muster Master, dated Newburyport, July 20, 1776; also, 
Capt. Moses Nowell s (Newburyport) co. ; enlisted July 9, 1776; service to 
Nov. 19, 1776, 4 mos. 14 days; company stationed at Plum Island for defence 
of seacoast.

SHAD, JONATHAN. Company receipt dated Chelmsford, April 19, 1776, for wages

son s (Robinson s) regt. 

SHAD, LEMUEL. Private, Capt. John Drury s co., Col. Ezra "Wood s regt. ; service, 
8 mos. 1 day ; company entered service June 6, 1778, and was discharged Feb. 
10, 1779; regiment raised for 8 months and stationed at North river, N. Y. ; 
roll sworn to in "Worcester Co. ; also, same co. and regt. ; pay roll for part of 
May and the month of June, 1778 ; said Shad credited with 26 days service, 
being 3 days to prepare for camp, 13 days in camp, and 10 days (200 miles) 
travel ; also, same co. and regt. ; pay rolls for Aug., Sept., Oct., and Dec., 1778. 

SHAD, SAMUEL. Private, Capt. Caleb Champney s co. of guards ; enlisted Oct. 6, 
1780; discharged Nov. 1, 1780; service, 26 days; company detached from 
militia for service at and about Boston. 

SHADDACH, EZEKIEL. Capt. Peter "Woodbury s co., Col. Jacob Gerrish s regt. of 
guards; enlisted Oct. 22, 1778; discharged Nov. 9, 1778; service, 19 days, at 
Cambridge. Roll certified at Lancaster. 

SHADDEL, DAVLD. Private, Capt. Anthony Post s co. of artificers annexed to the

1 mo.

regt., at Springfield, July 2, 1780 ; age, 17 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 9 in. ; complexion, 
ruddy; engaged for town of Andover; marched to camp July 2, 1780, under 
command of Capt. Phineas Parker. [See Abel Shallock and Abiel Shattuck.]

agents of the captured privateers affixed to said return.

[year not given, probably 1779].

time under 21 years of age and unmarried ; Jeremiah Shattuck, the father, 
served at the same time and in the same company and regiment and was also 
known as Jeremiah Shattuck, Jr.

Sears; engaged July 17, 1781 ; discharged Nov. 8, 1781 ; service, 3 mos. 28 days,

Co. militia to serve for 3 months. Roll dated Deerfield.

cott s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, from Grotoii and 
Pepperell; service, 11 days.

30 MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 

SHATTUCK, THOMAS. Descriptive list of men raised in Hampshire Co. in 1779 to 
serve in the Continental Army; age, 2(5 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 6 in. ; complexion, 
dark; engaged for town of West Springfield (also given Granby) ; delivered to 
Ensign John Hubble ; also, list of men returned as received of Noah Goodman, 
Superintendent for Hampshire Co., by Justin Ely, Commissioner, dated 
Springfield; also, Private, Capt. Samuel Flower s co., Col. John Greaton s 
(3d) regt. ; muster roll for Aug., 1779, dated Camp Highlands; enlistment, 
9 months; also, same co. and regt. ; muster roll for Nov. and Dec., 1779, dated 
Continental Village ; enlisted July 23, 1779. 

SHATTUCK, TIMOTHY (also given TIMOTHY, Jr.), Townsend. Descriptive list of 
men raised in Middlesex Co. to serve in the Continental Army, agreeable to 
resolve of June 9, 1779, as returned by Brig. Gen. Eleazer Brooks to Maj. 
Hosmer, dated Lincoln, Aug. 8, 1779; 10th co., Col. Head s regt. ; age, 17 yrs. ; 
stature, 5 ft. 7 (also given 5 ft. 8) in. ; complexion, light; residence, Townsend; 
reported delivered to Capt. L. Bailey ; said Shattuck, with others in Col. Read s 
regt., reported as " being already marched ; " also, list of 6 months men raised 
agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as received of Maj. Joseph Hos 
mer, Superintendent for Middlesex Co., by Justin Ely, Commissioner, dated 
Springfield : also, descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental 
Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned 
as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Spring 
field, July 9, 1780 ; age, 17 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 9 in. ; complexion, light ; engaged 
for town of Townsend ; marched to camp July 9, 1780, under command of Lieut. 
Jackson, of the artillery ; also, pay roll for months men raised by the town 
of Townsend for service in the Continental Army during 1780; marched July 
6, 17SO; discharged Dec. 16, 1780; service, 5 mos. 21 days, travel (220 miles) 
included ; also, receipt signed by said Shattuck and others, for bounties paid 
them by the town of Townsend to serve in the Continental Army for the term 
of 3 years, agreeable to resolve of Dec. 2, 1780; also, descriptive list of men 
raised in Middlesex Co., agreeable to resolve of Dec. 2, 1780, as returned by 
Joseph Hosmer, Superintendent for said county; age, 18 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 10 
in.; complexion, light; hair, dark; eyes, blue; occupation, farmer; engaged 
for town of Townsend ; engaged March 12, 1781 ; term, 3 years. 

SHATTUCK, TIMOTHY. Private, Capt. Abel Dinsmore s co., Col. David Field s 
regt. ; enlisted Aug. 17, 1777; discharged Aug. 19, 1777; service, 4 days; com 
pany inarched to the Northward at recmest of Gen. Gates and was dismissed by 
order of Gen. Lincoln; also, Capt. Thomas French s co., in a regiment com 
manded by Col. David Wells ; service between Sept. 23, 1777, and Oct. 18, 1777, 
11 days, in Northern department. 

SHATTITCK, TIMOTHY. Private, Capt. Edmund Longley s co., Col. Cogswell s regt. ; 
enlisted Sept. 22, 1778; discharged Dec. 31, 1778; service, 3 mos. 12 days ; com 
pany detached to guard and fortify posts at and about Boston. 

SHATTUCK, TIMOTHY. Private, Capt. David Moore s co., Lieut. Col. Enoch Hallet s 
regt. ; entered service Aug. 20, 1780; discharged Oct. 31, 1780; service, 2 mos. 
16 days, at Rhode Island, including 4 days (75 miles) travel home; regiment 
detached to reinforce Continental Army for 3 months.

(Hampshire Co.) regt.; engaged July 10, 1777; discharged July 19, 1777; ser

West Point ; reported on furlough by leave of Gen. McDougall from Jan. 28, 
1779, to April 1, 1779; also, Col. Tupper s (llth) regt.; return of officers for 
clothing, dated "West Point, Aug. 10, 1779; also, Lieutenant, same regt.; Con 
tinental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to Dec. 31, 1780; re 
ported as serving as Aide-de-Camp to Gen. Patterson from Dec. 23, 1779, to Dec. 
31, 1780; also, Lieutenant, same regt.; list of officers promoted in the Conti 
nental Army and for whom warrants were made out ; warrant issued July 28, 
1780; also, same regt.; return of officers for clothing, dated Boston, Dec. 15, 
1780; also, Lieutenant, Capt. Porter s (1st) co., Col. Tupper s (llth) regt.; 
muster roll of field, staff, and commissioned officers for Oct.-Dec., 1780, dated 
Hutts near West Point; appointed March 18, 1780; also, Col. Tupper s (10th) 
regt., commanded by Col. Thomas Marshall prior to Jan. 1, 1781 ; pay roll 
made up for wages and subsistence to Jan. 1, 1782; wages and subsistence 
allowed said Shaw from Jan. 1, 1781, 4 rnos. 1 day; reported resigned May 2, 
1781.

Lieut. William Tomson s (probably Capt. Joshua s Benson s) co., Col. The

Roxbury, Nov. 14, 1775.

Army from Capt. Perez Churchell s co., Col. Sprout s regt. ; residence, Middle- 
borough; enlisted for town of Middleborough; joined Capt. Benson s co., Col. 
Putnam s regt. ; enlistment, 3 years ; also, list of men mustered between May

regt. ; return dated Albany, Feb. -, 1778; mustered by Capt. Hatch.

pany detached from militia to serve at Rhode Island for 1 month in a regiment 
under Samuel Fisher, Commandant. 

SHAW, ISAAC. Private, Capt. Stephen Jenkins s co., Col. Jacob Gerrish s regt. ; en 
tered service Oct. 14, 1779; discharged Nov. 22, 1779; service, 1 mo. 20 days, 
at Claverack, including travel (240 miles) home ; regiment detached from mili 
tia of Suffolk and Essex counties to reinforce army under Gen. Washington. 

SHAW, ISAAC. Private, Capt. Perez Churchill s co., Col. Ebenezer White s regt.;

Middleborough.

3 months and stationed at Springfield.

expedition ; roll sworn to in Bristol Co. ; also, Private, Capt. Ebenezer Dean s 
co., Col. Thomas Carpenter s regt. ; service, 1 mo. 4 days ; company marched 
from Taunton toRehoboth, thence to Bristol, thence to Providence, R. I., and 
thence home ; roll dated Nov. 5, 1777 ; also, Private, Capt. Josiah Crocker s co., 
Col. Thomas Carpenter s regt. ; service, 1 mo. 11 days ; company marched from 
Taunton to Rhode Island by order of Council of July -, 1778, to serve for 

weeks; also, Private, Capt. Noah Hall s co., Col. Mitchel s regt. commanded 
by Lieut. Col. James Williams, Brig. Godfry s brigade ; service, 9 days ; com 
pany marched to Tiverton on the alarm at Rhode Island of Aug. 1, 17X0 ; mileage 
((50 miles) out and home allowed; also, Sergeant, Capt. John Shaw s co., Col. 
Abiel Mitchell s regt.; service, 8 days; company marched to Rhode Island 
March 0, 1781, by order of His Excellency John Hancock on a 40 days expe 
dition ; mileage for 60 miles allowed said Shaw.

Berwick raised for service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; marched

including travel (325 miles) home.

Col. John IFathaway s (Bristol Co.) regt.; service, 24 days; company raised

request of Gen. Spencer; mileage (12 miles) allowed from Swanzey to How- 
land s Ferry; also, Captain, 2d co., 1st Bristol Co. regt. of Mass, militia- list 
of officers ; commissioned June 17, 1778.

Forts George and Ann were taken by the enemy.

SHED, JOSEPH, continued. 

of Pepperell, stating that they marched to Rhode Island, joined army under 
Gen. Sulivan in the expedition against Newport in Aug., 1778, and continued 
in service at Rhode Island for the term of 6 weeks under Capt. John Nutting, 
and asking that said Capt. Nutting be directed to make up a roll for their 
State pay which they had not received ; petition granted and resolve passed 
thereon Nov. 26, 1779.

John Flint, as certified by Timothy Rusel, Clerk.

Col. Elisha Porter s regt.; engaged July 10, 1777; discharged Aug. 12, 1777; 
service, 1 mo. 8 days, on expedition to Northern department, including travel

Council, dated Bernardston, Dec. 9, 1778, signed by said Sheldon, stating that 
he had been commissioned Captain of 4th (Bernardston) co., 5th regt., in 1776, 
and that by reason of being very hard of hearing he was disqualified for the 
duties of that office, and asking permission to resign his commission ; certificate 
attached, signed by Lieut. Col. David Wells, certifies that said Sheldon was 
unfit for service in the office he then sustained by reason of bis being very hard 
of hearing; ordered in Council April 25, 1780, that the resignation be accepted.

21 days ; company marched from Raynham, Taunton, and Easton, in Sept., 1777,

ter s regt. ; service, 1 mo. 4 days ; company marched from Taunton to Reho- 
both, thence to Bristol, thence to Providence, R. I., and thence home; roll

SHENLEY, PATRICK. Council order dated March 20, 1781, directing Joseph Hender 
son, Sheriff of Suffolk Co., to liberate said Shenley, a soldier in the Continen 
tal Army, from jail, and to deliver him to bis commanding officer, said Shenley 
having been confined for stealing a piece of cloth from Thomas Gibbs, and said 
Gibbs having acknowledged satisfaction as shown by his certificate dated 
Boston, March 20, 1781.

SHEPARD, DAVID, Murrayfield (also given Ludlow and Westfield) . Captain of a

reported appointed Surgeon April 28, 1775 ; also, Surgeon : general return of 
Col. Timothy Danielson s regt. in camp at Roxbury May 27, 1775; ordered in 
Provincial Congress May 27, 1775, that officers of said regiment be commissioned ; 
also, Surgeon, same regt.: engaged April 28, 1775: service, 3 mos., 2 weeks, 
4 days; also, certificate dated Oct. 9, 1775, signed by Col. Timothy Danielson, 
testifying to the satisfactory service of certain officers in his regiment and 
stating that said officers had not received their warrants ; ordered in Council 
Oct. 9, 1775, that the president be directed to send a letter to Gen. Washington

SHEPARD, ELIJAH. Private, Capt. Levi Ely s co., Col. John Brown s regt. ; entered

SHEPARD, ENOCH, Murrayfield. Captain, Col. John Moseley s regt. ; marched from 
home Oct. 21, 1776; service to Nov. 17, 1776, 28 days; company marched to 
Mt. Independence (also given Ticonderoga) under command of Lieut. Col. 
Timothy Roberson (Robinson) by order of Gen. Schuyler on the alarm of Oct. 
21 ; 1776; also, Col. John Moseley s (Hampshire Co.) regt.; engaged Aug. 17, 
1777 ; discharged Aug. 23, 1777 ; service, 7 days ; company marched to Benning- 
ton on an alarm ; also, same regt. ; engaged Sept. 21, 1777 ; discharged Oct. 17, 
1777 ; service, 1 mo. 3 days, on expedition to Saratoga, including travel (100 
miles) home ; company marched from Murrayfield to reinforce army under 
Gen. Gates; also, petition addressed to the Council, dated Murrayfield, April 
6, 1778, signed by said Shepard, stating that he held a commission as Captain, 
13th co., Col. John Mosley s (3d Hampshire Co.) regt., although he had viewed 
himself as not equal to the discharge of the office when chosen, but having 
made the experiment and finding himself unable to discharge the duties of his 
office with credit to himself or benefit to the country, asking to be permitted 
to resign his commission ; ordered in Council April 24, 1778, that the resigna 
tion be accepted.

Smith s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 8 days.

son s regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 4, 1775; service, 3 
mos. 4 days.

Danielson s regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; engaged April 28, 1775:

SHEPARD, JOHN, Westlield. Return of men raised to serve in the Continental Army 
from Capt. John Kellogg s (Westfield) co. ; residence, Westiield ; engaged for

arrival at Fishkill, agreeable to resolve of April 20, 1778, returned as received 
of Jonathan Warner, Commissioner, July 20, 1778; arrived at Fishkill June 
16, 1778. 

SHEPARD, JOHN, Wrentham. Private, Capt. Samuel Cowell s co., Col. John 
Smith s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 6 days.

enlistment, during war; deserted April 18, 1777.

dition to Saratoga, including travel (120 miles) home.

at Peekskill, N. Y., including 11 days (220 miles) travel home.

eral Court of June 22, 1780, returned as mustered by 1st Maj. John Chester 
Williams; Col. Porter s (4th Hampshire Co.) regt. ; age, 28 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 
11 in.; complexion, dark; engaged for town of Pelliam ; also, Private, Capt. 
Job Alvord s co., Col. S. Murray s regt.; enlisted July 16, 1780; discharged 
Oct. 10, 1780; service, 3 mos. 3 days, including 7 days (140 miles) travel home; 
regiment raised in Hampshire Co. to reinforce Continental Army for 3 months. 

SHERMAN, CORNELIUS. Corporal, Capt. Charles Church s co., 4th Plymouth Co. regt. 
commanded by Lieut. Col. White; entered service July 30, 1780; discharged 
Aug. 8, 1780; service, 9 days, at Rhode Island on an alarm. Roll certified at 
Rochester.

charged Aug. 8, 1780; service, 6 days, on an alarm at Rhode Island.

turns dated Sewall s Point, Sept. 1, and Sept. 22, 1775; also, same regt. ; com 
pany return dated Camp at Sewall s Point, Sept. 2(5, 1775 ; also, Captain, 4th 
co. ; return of casualties of the several companies in the 38th regt. made by 
Lieut. Col. Baldwin, dated Chelsea, Sept. -, 1775; also, same co. and regt.; 
pay abstract for Sept., 1775, dated Sewall s Point; also, same regt.; return 
dated Camp at Sewall s Point, Oct. 5, 1775; also, petition addressed to the 
Council, dated "Watertown, Oct. 18, 1775, signed by Lieut. Col. Baldwin and 
Maj. James Wesson, asking that said Sherman and other officers belonging to 
Lieut. Col. Baldwin s (38th) regt. be recommended to the Commander-in-Chief 
for commissions; ordered in Council Oct. 24, 1775, that said officers be recom 
mended to Gen. Washington for commissions ; also, Captain, Lieut. Col. Bald 
win s regt. ; returns between Oct. 20, 1775, and Dec. 29, 1775, dated Camp at 
Sewall s Point ; also, account of rations allowed officers of the 38th regt. com 
manded by Lieut. Col. Baldwin from July 1, 1775, to Dec. 31, 1775, dated 
Chelsea ; said Sherman credited with 184 days allowance ; also, return dated 
Cambridge Camp, Jan. 8, 1776, made by Col. Baldwin, of.cominissioned officers 
in the 26th regt. ; also, returns of Col. Baldwin s regt. stationed at Chelsea, 
Medford, and Fort No. 1, dated Fort No. 1, Cambridge, Feb. 16, 1776, Chelsea, 
Feb. 23, 1776, and Fort No. 1, March 2, 1776; also, receipt given to Col. Bald 
win for ration allowance from Jan. 1, 1776, to April 1, 1776, dated New York; 
also, same regt. ; returns of effectives between April 12, 1776, and May 10, 
1776, dated New York; also, same regt.; return of arms and accoutrements 
and of ammunition wanting, dated New York, May 22, 1776, May 24, 1776, 
and June 11, 1776; also, list of officers recommended by Col. Baldwin to fill 
vacancies in the 26th regt., dated Camp at New York, July 2, 1776 ; said Sher 
man, Captain, reported promoted to Major March 29 [1776], by order of His 
Excellency, but "not yet Commisson d ; " also, letter dated Camp at North 
River, N. Y., Aug. 12, 1776, signed by said Sherman, Major, 26th regt., asking 
Col. Baldwin to send some scarlet broadcloth to himself and Col. Shepherd; 
also, Major: return of officers and men belonging to Col. Baldwin s regt. who 
marched on an expedition to Trenton Dec. 26, 1776, dated Mixfield, Dec. 29, 
1776.

sioned; reported commissioned Feb. 1, 1776.

16, 1781; service, 8 mos., under Brig. Gen. P. Wadsworth at the Eastward; 
roll sworn to at Brunswick and certified at Thomaston.

SHERMAX, PELEG. Official record of a ballot by the House of Representatives, 
dated Feb. 8, 1779; said Sherman chosen 2d Major, Col. Thomas Carpenter s 
(1st Bristol Co.) regt. of Mass, militia; appointment concurred in by Council 
Feb. 8, 1779; reported commissioned Feb. 8, 1779. 

SHERMAX, PELEG. Account rendered against the United States by Col. Abiel 
Mitchel, for reimbursement for keeping his horse at his own expense from 
July 13 to Oct. 31 [1780] ; certificate appended dated Portsmouth, Oct. 30, 
1780, signed by said Sherman certifies that Col. Mitchel had received no forage 
on the above account. 

SHERMAX, PETER, Douglas. Private, Capt. Jonathan Camel s co., Col. Josiah 
Whitney s regt. ; service from Aug. 1, 1776, to Nov. 1, 1776, 3 mos. ; roll dated 
Camp at Hull ; also, same co. and regt. ; pay roll for Nov., 1776 ; service, 1 mo. 
4 days, including travel (75 miles) home; also, Capt. Job Knap s co., Col. 
Cushen sregt. ; enlisted Aug. 17, 1777; joined company Aug. 23, 1777; marched 
Aug. 25, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 30 (also given Nov. 29) , 1777 ; service, 3 mos. 
18 (also given 3 mos. 15) days, with Northern army, including travel (10 days) 
home; also, Capt. Joseph McNall s co., in a regiment commanded by Lieut. 
Col. Samuel Peirce; enlisted May 17, 1779; service, 1 mo. 18 days, at Tiverton, 
R. I. ; reported 60 miles from home. 

SHKRMAX, PHILIP. Private, Capt. Avery Parker s (1st) co., Col. John Hathaway s 
(2d Bristol Co.) regt. ; entered service Aug. 3, 1780 ; discharged Aug. 8, 1780 ; 
service, 6 days, on an alarm at Rhode Island. 

SHERMAX, PHIXEAS, Brimfield (probably). Lieutenant, Capt. James Sherman s 
co., Col. Pyncheon s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; ser 
vice, 10^ days. 

SHERMAX, PRINCE. Private, Capt. Joseph Foster s co., Col. Ruggles Woodbridge s 
regt., which marched in response to the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; said Sherman 
marched April 20, 1775 ; left place of rendezvous April 28, 1775 ; roll sworn to 
at Ware ; also, list of men raised to serve in the Continental Army for the 
term of 9 months, agreeable to resolve of June 9, 1779, returned as received of 
Noah Goodman, Superintendent for Hampshire Co., by Justin Ely, Commis 
sioner, dated Springfield ; engaged for town of Ware ; also, Private, Capt. John 
Holden s co., Col. Thomas Nixon s regt. ; pay rolls for Aug. and Sept., 1779; 
enlisted Aug. 1, 1779; also, (late) Capt. Holden s co., Col. Nixon s (6th) regt. ; 
payroll for Jan.-June, 1780; reported discharged May 2, 1780. 

SHERMAX, REUBEX, Ware. List of men raised to serve in the Continental Army 
from Capt. William Brakridge s (Breckenridge s) co., 4th Hampshire Co. 
regt., as returned by Lieut. Col. Ruggles Woodbridge; residence, Ware; en 
listed for town of Ware ; enlistment, 3 years ; also, Private, Capt. John Spurr s 
co., Col. Thomas Nixon s 6th (also given 5th) regt. ; Continental Army pay 
accounts for service from March 1, 1777, to March 19, 1780 ; reported discharged 
March 19, 1780 ; also, same co. and regt. ; return of men who were in camp on 
or before Aug. 15, 1777, and who had not been absent subsequently except on 
furlough, etc., certified at Camp near Peekskill, Feb. 16, 1779; also, same co. 
and regt. ; muster roll for May, 1779, dated Highlands ; enlisted March 1, 1777 ; 
reported on command with Surveyor General; also, Capt. Spurr s (1st) co., 
6th Mass. regt. ; return for clothing delivered for the year 1780 ; receipt for said 
clothing, dated Peekskill, Dec. -, 1779.

nental soldiers for the town of Pittsfield ; under date Feb. 6, 1781, said Sherman 
was sworn in and reported transferred from Esq. Goodrich s class to Samuel 
Warner s class of the town of Washington ; also, descriptive list dated Lenox,

Sloan s co., Col. Rossiter s regt. ; age, 42 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 4 in. ; complexion, 
dark ; hair, gray ; occupation, laborer ; residence, Pittsfield ; engaged for town

oth (1st Townsend) co., 6th Middlesex Co. regt. of Mass, militia ; list of officers

not given] ; mileage for 67 miles allowed said Shirtliff . 

SHIRTLIFF, JONAS. Private, Capt. John Oliver s co., Col. Nathan Sparhawk s regt. ; 
service, 104 days, including travel home ; company served in the Jerseys ; war 
rant for pay allowed in Council Aug. 12, 1777. 

SHIRTLIFF, JONATHAN. 2d Lieutenant, Capt. Benjamin Lapham s co., Col. Reed s 
regt. ; muster roll dated May 9, 1778 ; commissioned March 27, 1778 ; term, 
3 months from April 2, 1778 ; also, Lieutenant, same co. and regt. ; service from 
April 1, 1778, to July 3, 1778, at Cambridge. 

SHIRTLIFF, ROBERT. Petition signed by Deborah Gannett, presented in Jan., 1792, 
stating that the petitioner under the name of Robert Shirtliff enlisted May 20, 
1782, into the Continental Army for the term of 3 years and was mustered into 
the service by Capt. Eliphalet Thorp, at Worcester, May 23, 1782, and served 
in Capt. George Webb s co., Col. Shepard s (later Col. Jackson s) 4th regt., 
xmtil discharged by Gen. Knox at West Point Oct. 25, 1783; that the petitioner 
had performed her duty faithfully as a soldier and was wounded in an engage 
ment at Tarrytown, N. Y., and had never received any payment for her ser 
vice in the army, and requesting that compensation might be allowed her; 
petition granted and the sum of 34 with interest from Oct. 23, 1783, allow r ed 
said Deborah Gannett (Robert Shirtliff) by resolve of Jan. 20, 1792. 

SHIRTLIFF, SAMUEL. Private, Capt. William Weston s co. ; service from July 1, 
1776, to date of discharge, Sept. 28, 1776 ; reported entered service June 19, 1776 ; 
company stationed at the Gurnet for defence of Plymouth harbor. 

SHIRTLIFF, SILAS. Capt. Lawrance Kemp s co. of Hampshire Co. militia; entered 
service May 10, 1777 ; discharged July 17, 1777 ; service, 2 mos. 9 days, under

SHORES, EDMUND, Taunton. Private, 4th co., Col. Gamaliel Bradford s regt. ; Con 
tinental Army pay accounts for service from Feb. 19, 1777, to March 3, 1779 ;

regt. ; subsistence allowed from date of enlistment, Feb. 19, 1777, to April 
30, 1777 ; credited with 70 days allowance ; also, return of men who were in 
camp on or before Aug. 15, 1777; reported joined May 1, 1777; also reported 
"Absent Ever Sence Feb y " [year not given]; also, return dated Feb. 1, 
1778 ; residence, Taunton ; enlisted for town of Taunton ; musterer , by County 
and Continental Muster Masters; term, 3 years; also, descriptive list of men 
raised to reinforce the Continental Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable 
to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, 
by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Springfield, July 25, 1780; age, 33 yrs. ; stature, 
5 ft. 6 in. ; complexion, dark ; engaged for town of Taunton ; marched to camp 
July 25, 1780, under command of Capt. Park; also, pay roll for 6 months men 
raised by the town of Taunton for service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; 
marched to camp July 25, 1780 ; discharged Aug. 30, 1780 ; service, 1 mo. 15 
days, including 10 days (200 miles) travel home.

at Claverack, including 6 days (120 miles) travel home; regiment raised to 
reinforce Continental Army for 3 months.

SHUMWAY, ASA. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental Army

ceived of Justin Ely, Commissioner, hy Maj. Peter Harwood, of 6th Mass, 
regt., at Springfield, July 5, 1780 ; age, 18 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 8 in. ; complexion, 
light ; engaged for town of Belchertown ; arrived at Springfield July 5, 1780 ; 
marched to camp July 6, 1780, under command of Lieut. Taylor, of 2d Mass, 
regt. ; also, pay roll for 6 months men detached from militia of the town of 
Belchertown for service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; marched from 
home July 4, 1780; discharged Dec. 3, 1780; service, 5 mos. 7 days, including 
8 days (150 miles) travel home.

hawk s regt.; enlisted Aug. 21, 1777; discharged Aug. 25, 1777; service, 10

Gill s (3d Suffolk Co.) regt. of Mass, militia; list of officers; commissioned 
Jan. 31, 1778. 

SHURTLEFF, JOSEPH. Quarter Master, Col. Marshall s regt. ; returns of officers for 
rations between June 22, 1776, and July 13, 1776, signed by said Shurtleff ; also, 
order on Paymaster General, payable to said Shurtleff, Quarter Master, endorsed 
" Hull July 15. 1776," signed by soldiers belonging to Capt. Andrew HaskelPs 
co., Col. T. Marshall s regt., for advance pay for 1 month, travel allowance, 
etc.; also, Col. Marshall s regt.; returns of officers for rations between July 
17, 1776, and Nov. 30, 1776, signed by said Shurtleff; also, same regt. ; entered 
service May 8, 1776; service to Dec. 1, 1776, 6 mos. 24 days ; roll sworn to at 
Boston; also, recommendation addressed to the Council, dated Dec. 24, 1776, 
signed by Col. Thomas Marshall, certifying that he had appointed said Shurt 
leff a Quarter Master, he having served in that capacity, " the last Campaign," 
and recommending that he be commissioned ; ordered in Council Dec. 28, 1776, 
that a commission be issued; also, Quarter Master, Col. Thomas Marshall s 
regt. ; list of officers of the Continental Army; commissioned Jan. 30, 1777. 

SHURTLEFF, LEVI, Plymouth. Capt. Thomas Mayhew s co., Col. Cotton s regt. ; 
order for bounty coat dated Roxbury, Nov. 8, 1775 ; also, return of men raised 
to serve in the Continental Army from Capt. Nathaniel Goodwin s co., 1st 
Plymouth Co. regt. ; residence, Plymouth ; engaged for town of Plymouth ; 
term, 3 years; also, list of men mustered by Nathaniel Barber, Muster Master 
for Suffolk Co., dated Boston, April 27, 1777; Col. Crane s regt.; reported 
received State bounty.

Dec. 11, 1776. 

SHURTLEFF, SIMEON. 2d Lieutenant; list of officers appointed to command men 
detached from militia to reinforce the Continental Army for the term of 3 
months, agreeable to resolve of June 22, 1780; reported detached from Col.

Boston, Nov. 30, 1780, signed by said Shurtleff, Lieutenant, and others, officers 
in Col. Ebenezer Thayer s regt., asking that wages be allowed them for 3 mos. 
service as a reinforcement to the Continental Army during 1780.

SHUTE, DANIEL. Surgeon s Mate in hospital department ; Continental Army pay

given, probably 1782 or 1783], showing dates of commissions; commissioned 
April 14, 1782; also, list of officers accompanying a recommendation addressed 
to Gov. Hancock, dated Fair Forest, near West Point, April 20, 1782, signed 
by N. Rice, Major Commandant, 4th Mass, regt., asking that certain officers 
be commissioned to fill vacancies in said regiment ; said Shute, Mate in gen 
eral hospital, to be promoted to Surgeon, vice Dr. Mann, resigned April 14, 
1782 ; advised in Council May 16, 1782, that said officers be commissioned with 
the exception of Ensign Edward Phelon ; also, Doctor, Col. Henry Jackson s 
(4th) regt. ; returns of effectives, dated Feb. 14, and Feb. 21, 1783 ; reported 
on duty at the Lines.

regt.: enlisted Aug. 18, 1777; enlistment, 6 months from July 1, 1777; roll

Dec. 3, 1777; also, same co. and regt.; service from Dec. 1, 1777, to Jan. 2, 
1778, 1 mo. 2 days ; roll dated Providence ; also, Private, Capt. Samuel Healy s 
co., Col. John Jacobs s (Light Infantry) regt.; enlisted Sept. 21, 1779; dis 
charged Nov. 21 (also given Nov. 20) , 1779 ; service, 2 mos. 5 (also given 2 mos. 
6) days, at Rhode Island, including travel to camp and home ; mileage allowed 
to Providence (30 miles) and from place of discharge home ; company raised 
for 2 months; also, Capt. Jonathan Woodbury s co., Col. Jacob Davis s regt. ; 
marched July 30, 1780 ; discharged Aug. 8, 1780 ; service, 13 days, at Rhode 
Island on an alarm, including 4 days (72 miles) travel home ; roll dated Sutton. 

SIBLEY, ASA, Sutton. Private, Capt. Benjamin Allton s co., Col. John Rand s 
regt. ; entered service July 9, 1780, 3 days preceding march ; discharged Oct. 
10, 1780 ; service, 3 mos. 12 days, including travel (190 miles) home ; regiment 
raised for 3 months service at West Point ; also, Capt. Reuben Davis s co., Col. 
Luke Drury s regt. ; detached July 17, 1781 : marched to join regiment July 
19, 1781; arrived at West Point Aug. 1, 1781; discharged Nov. 1, 1781; ser 
vice, 3 mos. 21 days, including 8 days (160 miles) travel home; residence, 
Sutton ; engaged for town of Sutton ; regiment raised for 3 months. 

SIBLEY, DANIEL, Sutton. Private, Capt. John Putnam s (Sutton) co. of Minute- 
men, Col. Ebenezer Larned s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 
1775; service, 1 week 5 days; also, Capt. Arthur Dagget s co., Col. Ebenezer

SIBLEY, HENRY, Barre. Return of men raised to serve in the Continental Army

William Henry ; residence, Barre ; engaged for town of Barre ; joined Col. 
Crafts s regt.; also, list endorsed "June 22, 1777," of men employed at the 
Laboratory making small arms and cartridges after Col. Crafts s regt. was dis 
banded, as certified by Thomas Crafts, Colonel of the Artillery; said Sibley 
employed 1 mo.; also, Sergeant, Capt. John Gill s (4th) co., Col. Crafts s 
(Artillery) regt. ; service to Aug. 1, 1777, 84 days ; also, statement dated Boston, 
Sept. 22, 1777, signed by said Sibley and others belonging to Col. Crafts s regt., 
declaring their refusal to leave Boston unless their bounty or wages, or both, 
were made equivalent to those allowed the soldiers of the Continental train of

artillery; also, petition addressed to Col. Thomas Crafts, dated Camp at Bos 
ton, Sept. 25, 1777, signed by said Sibley and others, requesting that the 
objectionable part of their former petition, which was considered mutinous, be 
stricken out, and asking that the sergeants of the regiment confined on account 
of the petition be released ; also, petition addressed to the Council, endorsed 
" Sept. 26, 1777," signed by said Sibley and other sergeants in Col. Crafts s 
regt., confined in Boston jail, asking mitigation of punishment inflicted for 
signing a mutinous representation concerning their wages, etc., addressed Sept.

SIBLY, LITTLEFIELD. Petition dated Salem, Oct. 27, 1777, signed by William Green 
wood, stating that at the request of said Sibly and his crew, whose vessel (a 
privateer) had been driven on shore by an English cutter and who after burn 
ing their vessel had taken shelter at Barrington, N. S., the petitioner s home, 
he had undertaken to bring them to Salem in his schooner, " The Sally," with 
certain supplies that he desired to sell for the benefit of his townsmen, and 
asking that he have permission to so dispose of said supplies and return to his 
home ; accompanying paper, signed by said Sibly, testifies to the assistance 
rendered him and his crew by Capt. Greenwood; ordered in Council Oct. 31, 
1777, that Capt. Greenwood be allowed the privilege of selling his supplies and 
that all armed vessels of the L^nited States should not molest him while on his 
return journey to Barrington, N. S. 

SICATY, . Lieutenant, Col. Armand s (Independent) corps ; return of officers en 
titled to clothing, agreeable to resolve of Aug. 23, 1779.

water, by order of Gen. Lincoln, joined Col. John Ashley s (Berkshire Co.) 
regt., and marched to Bolton s Rills [ ? ] and there served until regularly dis

in Suffolk Co. for Continental service, as returned by Maj. Metcalf, of Col. 
Wheelock s regt.; also, Corporal, Capt. Cook s co., Col. John Crane s (Artil 
lery) regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from March 13, 1777, 
to March 23, 1778; reported died March 23, 1778; also, Capt. Jotham Drury s 
co., Col. Crane s regt.; pay rolls for Sept.-Dec., 1777; reported sick out of 
camp in Sept., 1777, on command at Fort Mifflin in Oct., 1777, sick out of camp 
in Nov., 1777, sick at Burlington in Dec., 1777.

1775, signed by Ebenezer Bridge, Colonel, 27th regt., stating that said Silver, 
Ensign, and other officers of said regiment had been in service from May [1775], 
but had not received commissions, and asking that they be recommended to 
Gen. Washington for commissions in the Continental Army ; ordered in Council 
Oct. 26, 1775, that said officers be recommended accordingly ; said Silver recom 
mended as 2d Lieutenant; also, 1st Lieutenant, Capt. John Kettell s co., Maj. 
Nathaniel Heath s detachment of guards; entered service Aug. 3, 1779; dis 
charged Sept. 30, 1779- service, 2 mos. 1 day (also given 2 mos.) ; company

pire Oct. 1, 1779 ; also, Lieutenant, Capt. Caleb Champney s co., Maj. Nathaniel

for service from Feb. 11, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; also, Capt. George Dunham s 
(8th) co., Col. Bailey s regt. ; return of men who joined before Aug. 15, 1777.

31, 1780; residence, Plymouth.

ance home, etc., dated Boston, Nov. -, 1776, and endorsed " Regiment at Do-

and who were paid bounty and mileage by said Selectmen.

IN THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 229 

SIMMONS, ISAIAH. Petition signed by said Simmons, 2d Lieutenant, and other offi 
cers of the ship "Mars," commanded by Capt. Simeon Samson, intended to 
call at a port in France during her cruise, complaining of the rating of prize 
shares as established by the Council, and requesting that the same be altered 
in order that the vessel might be manned effectively ; referred to a committee 
in Council July 6, 1780, and their report allowing to the seamen of the " Mars " 
one-half of all prizes captured was accepted July 7, 1780. 

SIMMONS, ISAIAH. Petition dated Boston, June 25, 1778, signed by William Shattuck, 
of Boston, asking that said Simmons be commissioned as commander of the 
schooner " General Heath " (privateer) ; ordered in Council June 25, 1778, that 
a commission be issued ; also, petition dated Boston, Nov. 2, 1779, signed by 
Thomas Harris, in behalf of himself and others, of Boston, asking that said 
Simmons be commissioned as commander of the brigantine " America " (pri 
vateer) ; ordered in Council Nov. 2, 1779, that a commission be issued ; also, 
petition dated Boston, Sept. 25, 1780, signed by William and John Shattuck, 
in behalf of themselves and others, of Boston, asking that said Simmons be 
commissioned as commander of the sloop " Providence " (privateer) ; ordered 
in Council Sept. 25, 1780, that a commission be issued ; also, petition dated 
Boston, Oct. 11, 1781, signed by William Shattuck, in behalf of himself and 
others, of Boston, asking that said Simmons be commissioned as commander 
of the sloop "General Green" (privateer) ; advised in Council Oct. 11, 1781, 
that a commission be issued.

SIMMONS, KENT. Boy, brigantine "Independence," commanded by C apt. Simeon

order of Capt. Samson ; when last paid Sept. 22, 1776 ; discharged Jan. 20, 1777.

Feb. 3, 1778, to April 3, 1778, 2 mos., at Cambridge, guarding troops of 
convention. 

SIMMONS, KENT. Capt. Jeremiah Putnam s co., Col. Nathaniel Wade s regt.; de 
tached July 23, 1778; service to Dec. 31, 1778, 5 mos. 13 days, at Rhode Island,

muster roll dated North Kingston, Nov. 6, 1778; reported on command as 
shoemaker; also, same co. and regt.; muster rolls dated East Greenwich, 
Sept. 17, Sept. 24, Oct. 14, and Nov. 14, 1778; enlistment to expire Jan. 1, 
1779; reported on command making shoes on roll dated Oct. 14, 1778. 

SIMMONS, LEBBEUS, Middleborough. Private, Capt. Abiel Peirce s (2d Middle- 
borough) co. of militia, which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to 
Marshfield; service, 2 days; also, Capt. Levi Rounsevel s co., Col. David 
Brewer s (9th) regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 5, 1775;

as commander of the brigantine "Ranger" (privateer) ; advised in Council 
Oct. 9, 1781, that a commission be issued.

the Continental Army from 3d Hampshire Co. regt., as returned by Capt. Wil 
liam Cooley, sworn to Jan. 10, 1778; residence, Granville; engaged for town 
of Granville ; joined Capt. Lebbeus Ball s co., Col. William Sliepard s regt. ; 
term, 3 years ; also, return dated Blandford, March 29, 1779, of men in Conti 
nental service comprising one-seventh part of the male inhabitants of Bland- 
ford, including the alarm list, who belonged to (late) Capt. William Knox s 
(6th) co., 3d Hampshire Co. regt., as attested by Lieut. David McConoughey, 
Jr. ; residence, Blandford ; engaged for town of Blandford : joined Capt. Ball s 
co., Col. Sliepard s regt.; term to expire April -, 1780. {Name crossed out 
on return.] 

SIMONDS, ASA. Private, Capt. James Shaw s co. ; entered service Sept. 24, 1777 ; 
discharged Oct. 18, 1777 ; service, 32 days, with Northern army, including 
travel (140 miles) home; company detached from Col. Charles Pynchion s 
regt. and ordered to join army under Gen. Gates to serve for 30 days, unless 
sooner discharged. 

SIMOXDS, ASAEL, Woburn. Private, Capt. Samuel Belknap s co., which marched 
on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Concord, thence to Cambridge ; service, 9 
days ; company served until formation of army. [See Hazel Simonds.] 

SIMONDS, BENJAMIN, Williamstown. Certificate signed by said Simonds, Colonel, 
certifying that Mr. Eliel Tode had been chosen Adjutant by the field officers 
of 2d (Berkshire Co.) regt. of Mass, militia, and recommending that he be 
commissioned ; ordered in Council May 4, 1776, that he be commissioned ; also, 
Colonel of a detachment of Berkshire Co. militia ; muster roll dated Camp at 
Ticonderoga, Feb. 25, 1777 ; appointed Dec. 16, 1776 ; also, official record of a 
ballot by the House of Representatives, dated April 4, 1777 ; said Simonds 
chosen Colonel, 2d Berkshire Co. regt. of Mass, militia; appointment con 
curred in by Council April 4, 1777 ; reported commissioned April 4, 1777 ; also, 
return dated Sheffield, May 1, 1777, signed by Brig. Gen. John Fellows, of a 
detachment commanded by said Simonds, made from said Fellows s (Berk 
shire Co.) brigade to reinforce the Continental Army, agreeable to resolve of 
General Court, and which marched the beginning of Jan. [1777] ; residence, 
Williamstown; also, Colonel, 3d Berkshire Co. regt., Brig. Gen. John Fel 
lows s brigade ; general return of Mass, militia made by Adj. Gen. Peleg Wads- 
worth, dated July 5, 1779; also, Colonel, Berkshire Co. regt. ; engaged Oct. 12, 
1780; discharged Oct. 19, 1780; service, 11 days, including 4 days (80 miles) 
travel home ; regiment marched to Northern frontiers by order of Gen. Fellows 
on an alarm ; also, same regt. ; engaged Oct. 26, 1780 ; discharged Oct. 30, 1780 ; 
service, 8 days, including 4 days (80 miles) travel home ; regiment marched to 
Northern frontiers by order of Gen. Fellows on an alarm ; also, Colonel, 7th 
Essex Co. [ ? ] regt. of Mass, militia ; list of officers [year not given].

ordered in Council Aug. 17, 1778, that a commission be issued.

general orders.

manded by Lieut. Col. Samuel Peirce; entered service May 17, 1779; dis 
charged July 1, 1779; service, 1 mo. 18 days; company ordered to serve at 
Tiverton, R. I., until July 1, 1779. 

SIMONDS, WILLIAM. Account rendered by said Simonds, Quarter Master, Lieut. 
Col. Samuel Peirce s regt., for wages for service from May 6, 1779, to July 5, 
1779, 2 mos. ; regiment detached from militia in May, 1779, to serve at Tiver 
ton, R. I.

ster; joined Capt. Oaks s co., Col. Pollard s regt. ; term, 1 year.

SIMPSON, BENJAMIX, York. Private, Capt. Edward Grow s co. ; enlisted July 10,

SIMPSON, EBENEZER. Captain, 10th (York) co., Col. Ebenezer Sayer s (1st York 
Co.) regt. of Mass, militia ; list of officers of said regiment, dated \Yells, June

SIMPSON, EBENEZER. Receipt dated York, May 8, 1781, signed by said Simpson and 
others, for bounties paid them by the town of York, in consideration of their 
having enlisted to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 3 years, unless 
sooner discharged. 

SIMPSON, EBENEZER. Return signed by Tho. Chase, D. Q. M. G, [year not given], 
of wagoners, artificers, etc., serving in his department; said Simpson appears 
among " Blacksmiths inlisted " stationed at Boston ; also, letter from Samuel 
Dow to James Perkins, dated Boston, Jan. 15, 1786, in behalf of himself, said 
Simpson, and others, stating that they had been employed as blacksmiths in 
the Quarter Master s department at Boston from early in 1776 to Jan. 1, 1778, 
when owing to depreciation of money their wages were insufficient, where 
upon they applied to Col. Chase, Deputy Quartermaster General, for 9 specie 
per month, or its equivalent, as wages, but as they failed to receive any in 
creased allowance, they applied to Gen. Heath, who promised to write to Gen. 
Pickering and secure the advance requested ; they remained continuously in 
service until Sept., 1780, their pay remaining unchanged uutil March 1, 1780, 
when they were allowed 9 per month in specie notes ; the claim for the extra 
allowance asked for was apparently not granted, as the foregoing letter was 
read in Continental Congress and retunied to said Dow without action, and two 
endorsements bearing dates Boston, Oct. 15, 1788, and Sept. 27, 1790, show that 
the grievance of the claimants was not redressed at the respective dates. 

SIMPSON, EDWARD, Portsmouth. Descriptive list of officers and crew of the ship 
"America," commanded by Capt. John Somes, sworn to in Suffolk Co., 
June 9, 1780; age, 23 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 5 in.; complexion, light; residence, 
Portsmouth.

vice, 3 days ; company called out by Col. Thomas Gardner and served as guards 
until Saturday, the fourth day after the fight at Concord. 

SIMS, JOSEPH. List of officers and crew of the brigantine "Griffin," commanded 
by Capt. Gideon Henfield, sworn to May 23, 1780; said Sims rated 1 share. 

SIMS, STEPHEN, Billerica. Corporal, Capt. Samuel Tay s co., Lieut. Col. Webb s 
regt. ; enlisted Aug. 18, 1781 ; discharged Nov. 29, 1781 ; service, 3 mos. 22 
days, including 11 days (212 miles) travel home ; regiment raised in Suffolk and 
Middlesex counties to reinforce Continental Army for 3 months. 

SIMS [ ? ], THOMAS, Sudbury. Capt. Amasa Cranston s co. ; company return endorsed 
" 1776 ; " said Sims reported as at White Plains and fit for duty ; also reported 
as having lost articles in battle ; company probably belonged to Col. Eleazer 
Brooks s regt.

Baldwin, dated Trenton, Jan. 1, 1777.

co., Col. Hanley s (Henley s) regt.; term, 3 years.

treated by the residents of Cape Fourchu, N. S., and particularly by Waitstill 
Lewis, who had conveyed them to Massachusetts without charge, and request 
ing that this service be properly recognized.

tinental Army for the term of 6 months from the time of their arrival at place

mileage due them of said Col. Procter; Capt. Wise s co. ; age, 36 yrs. ; stature, 
5 ft. 6 in. ; complexion, brown. 

SLAK, JOHN. List dated Reading, May 15, 1775, of men belonging to 3d Reading co.

SLATOR, BENJAMIN. Master s Mate, hrigantine " Tyrannicide," commanded by 
Capt. John Cathcart; engaged May 4, 1779; discharged June 23, 1779; service, 
1 mo. 19 days ; roll sworn to in Suffolk Co. ; also, Master, same vessel and com 
mander; engaged June 24, 1779; discharged Sept. 6, 1779; service, 2 mos. 14 
days ; roll sworn to at Boston ; also, petition dated Boston, Sept. -, 1779, signed 
by said Slator, Master, brigantine " Tyrannicide," and others, asking compen 
sation for losses sustained while serving on Penobscot expedition ; also, petition 
signed by said Slator, Master, and other officers of the ship " Mars," com 
manded by Capt. Simeon Samson, intended to call at a port in France during 
her cruise, complaining of the rating of prize shares as established by the 
Council, and requesting that the same be altered in order that the vessel might 
be manned effectively ; referred to a committee in Council July 6, 1780, and 
their report allowing to the seamen of the " Mars " one-half of all prizes cap 
tured was accepted July 7, 1780; also, Lieutenant, sloop "Defence," com 
manded by Capt. James Xivens ; engaged June 18, 1781 ; discharged Sept. 26, 
1781 ; service, 3 mos. 8 days ; roll dated Boston.

25, 1775: service, 3 mos. 14 days; also, company return [probably Oct., 1775] ; 
also, Captain, Col. Sheppard s (4th) regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts 
for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to April 1, 1779; reported resigned April 1, 1779; 
also, letter dated Camp Valley Forge, May 1, 1778, signed by said Slayton, 
Captain, and other officers of Col. William Shepard s regt., requesting that 
application be made to the President of the Board of War for clothing granted 
them by resolve of March 13, 1778 ; also, Col. Shepard s (3d) regt. ; muster rolls 
for July, Aug., Oct., and Nov., 1778, March and April, 1779, dated Head 
quarters Providence ; appointed Jan. 1, 1777 ; reported resigned March 20 [1779].

credited to them, respectively, as returned by the committee chosen to make an 
average of the service rendered to the credit of the 3d Precinct of Brookfield ; 
total amount of service rendered made to average 5^ months for each single 
poll in said precinct ; said Slayton credited with 6rs mos. service.

34 days, including 2 days preceding march and 2 days travel home from North

SLEAD, EDWARD, Swanzey. Private, Capt. Peleg Peck s co., Col. Thomas Car 
penter s regt. ; entered service Aug. 3, 1780; discharged Aug. 9, 1780; service, 
7 days; company marched to Tiverton, R. I., on an alarm; by order of Col. 
Slead all the men in Swanzey were joined in one company under Capt. Peck, 
the other officers refusing to serve. 

SLEAD, JOB. Captain, 8th co., 1st Bristol Co. regt. of Mass, militia; list of officers 
chosen in said regiment, as returned by Col. Thomas Carpenter; ordered in 
Council March 28, 1776, that said officers be commissioned ; reported commis 
sioned March 27 [ ? ], 1776; also, petition addressed to the Council, signed by 
said Slead, stating that he had held for some time a commission as Captain in 
Col. Thomas Carpenter s regt. of Mass, militia and had endeavored to perform 
his duty faithfully, but as the position was attended with considerable expense 
and the whole burden of duty in connection with the company laid upon him, 
owing to the fact that all his officers had left him, and he was not well able to 
undergo longer the fatigues attendant upon the office, asking permission to re 
sign his commission ; ordered in Council Jan. 8, 1778, that the resignation be 
accepted. 

SLEAD, JOHN, Swanzey. Private, Capt. Peleg Shearman s co., Col. Thomas Car 
penter s (Bristol Co.) regt. ; service from July 23, 1777, to Aug. 25, 1777, 34 
days, including 2 days preceding march and 2 days travel home from North 
Kingston ; mileage (16 miles) also allowed from Providence.

ordered, and have them later conveyed under guard to Rhode Island and there 
deliver them to the commanding officer of the detachment raised in Massa 
chusetts for a secret expedition.

Nov. 29) , 1777 ; service, 3 mos. 27 (also given 3 mos. 15) days, under Gen. Gates 
in Northern department, including 8 days (154 miles) travel home ; order for 
payment of amount of roll dated at Springfield and signed by Capt. Chapin ; 
also, Capt. Nathan Rowle s co., Col. John Jacobs s regt. ; enlisted July 1, 1778 ; 
service, 6 mos. 4 days, at Rhode Island, including travel (80 miles) home ; en 
listment to expire Jan. 1, 1779. 

SLOAN, WILLIAM. Private, Capt. Stephen Smith s co., Col. Benjamin Foster s 
(Lincoln Co.) regt. ; service, 1 mo. ; company served at Machias from July 16 
[1777], to Oct. 10 [1777], when British ships lay in the harbor ; also, Lieut. John 
Scott s detachment from 6th Lincoln Co. regt. ; service between Aug. 31, 1779, 
and Nov. 20, 1779, 14 days, at Machias ; roll sworn to at Machias and endorsed 
" Service at Penobscot." 

SLOAN, WILLIAM. Sergeant, Lieut. Jabez Cornish s co., Col. John Brown s regt. ; 
entered service Aug. 14, 1777 ; discharged Aug. 17, 1777 ; service, 4 days, at 
Bennington ; roll sworn to in Berkshire Co.; also, Capt. John Strong s co., 
Col. John Brown s (Berkshire Co.) regt.; entered service Sept. 6, 1777; dis 
charged Sept. 26, 1777 ; service, 20 days, in Northern department ; also, Capt. 
Isaac Marsh s co., Col. Sears s regt. ; mustered July 21, 1781 ; discharged Nov.

SLOPER, SAMUEL, Glasgow. 1st Lieutenant, Capt. William Cannon s (12th) co., 
Col. John Mosely s (3d Hampshire Co.) regt. of Mass, militia ; list of officers 
chosen by the several companies in said regiment, endorsed " April 26 1776; " 
reported commissioned April 26, 1776 ; also, 1st Lieutenant, Capt. Aaron Coe s 
co., Lieut. Col. Timothy Kobinson s detachment of Hampshire Co. militia; 
muster roll dated Garrison at Ticonderoga, Feb. 24, 1777 ; entered service Dec. 
25, 1776 ; term to expire March 25, 1777 ; also, petition addressed to the Council, 
dated Blandford, Sept. 30, 1778, signed by William Cannon, asking permission 
to resign his commission as Captain of a Blandford co. on account of his 
advanced years, and recommending said Sloper and others as suitable persons 
from whom a choice might be made to fill his place ; ordered in Council Oct. 
6, 1778, that Col. Mosley, of 3d Hampshire Co. regt., direct the 12th co. in said 
regiment to meet and make choice of a Captain in room of said Cannon who 
was given leave to resign his commission ; also, return dated Blandford, March 
29, 1779, of men in Continental service, being one-seventh part of the male 
inhabitants of the town of Blandford, including the alarm list, belonging to 
the 12th co., 3d Hampshire Co. regt., attested by said Sloper as Lieutenant, 
and sworn to by said Sloper as Captain April 6, 1779; also, Captain, 12th co., 
Col. John Mosely s (3d Hampshire Co.) regt. of Mass, militia; list of officers; 
commissioned May 31, 1779; also, Captain, Col. Israel Chapin s (3d) regt.; 
engaged Oct. 15, 1779; discharged Nov. 21, 1779; service, 1 mo. 13 days, at 
Claverack, including 5 days (100 miles) travel home; regiment raised to rein 
force Continental Army for 3 months; also, Captain, 12th co., Col. David Mos- 
ley s (3d Hampshire Co.) regt. ; entered service June 12, 1782 ; discharged June 
17, 1782; service, 6 days; company marched to Northampton June 12, 1782, in 
support of the government and was allowed horse rations.

service from Sept. 29, 1780, to Dec. 30, 1780, in corps of invalids ; also, return

ing to Col. Lee s, Col. Henley s, and Col. Jackson s regts., and men belonging 
to Massachusetts in Col. Henry Sherburne s regt., who were incorporated into 
a regiment under the command of Col. Henry Jackson, agreeable to the arrange 
ment of April 9, 1779; Capt. North s co. ; rank, Sergeant; residence, Scar 
borough ; engaged June 10, 1778 ; term, 3 years ; reported deserted Jan. 15, 1780 ; 
also, Sergeant, Capt. Moses McFarland s corps of invalids ; Continental Army 
pay accounts for service from Sept. 29, 1780, to Dec. 31, 1780 ; term, during war ; 
reported a deserter in Col. Jackson s return, but " Capt McFarlin says he was 
not a Deserter."

defence of seacoast.

SMALL, JONATHAN. Return of sentences by a general court-martial appearing in a 
general order dated Headquarters, Ticonderoga, Aug. 24, 1770, taken from Col. 
Ephraim Wheelock s Orderly Book; said Small, of Col. Reed s regt., tried on 
charge of selling liquor against the orders of the commanding officer, pleaded 
guilty, sentenced to receive 39 lashes on the bare back, and ordered to return 
to duty. 

SMALL, JOSEPH, Narraguagus. Private, Lieut. "William Nickels s co., Col. Benja 
min Foster s (Lincoln Co.) regt.; marched Sept. 1(3, 1777; discharged Oct. 8,

at No. 4 and certified at Headquarters, Eastern Indian Department, Machias.

regt., who were incorporated into a regiment under the command of Col. Henry

dence, Boston ; engaged July 7, 1777 ; term, 3 years; said Smart appears among 
men belonging to Col. Henry Jackson s regt. who had been discharged from 
the rolls prior to above arrangement ; reported deserted July 11, 1777.

SMART, JOHN, Winchendon. Descriptive list of men in Continental service; Capt. 
King s co., Lieut. Col. John Brooks s (7th) regt. ; age, 17 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 
2|in. ; complexion, dark ; hair, dark ; occupation, farmer; residence, Winchen-

of Capt. King s co., Lieut. Col. J. Brooks s (7th) regt., tried Dec. 24, 1782, by 
regimental court-martial, Capt. Turner, President, on charge of disposing of 
his hat ; sentenced to be reprimanded ; sentence reported omitted ; also, tried 
May 24 [year not given, probably 1783], by regimental court-martial, Capt. 
Hastings, President, on charge of being absent from roll call ; reported ac 
quitted ; also, list of men who died or were discharged subsequent to Jan. 1, 
1781 ; said Smart discharged June 8, 1783, by Gen. Washington, term of enlist 
ment having expired.

SMELEG, SAMUEL. Account dated Bristol, July 28, 1777, rendered against the state 
of Massachusetts Bay by Henry Alexander, formerly Lieutenant in the service 
of Rhode Island, for bounties, etc., paid said Smeleg and others for engaging 
in Dec., 177(5, to serve to the credit of Rhode Island for the term of 15 months, 
the said men having been permitted by the General Assembly of Rhode Island 
to enlist in Col. Sherburne s regt. in the Continental Army to the credit of 
Massachusetts without having performed the service for which they had pre 
viously engaged.

his company, Col. Whitcomb s regt., were in need of cartridge boxes, for which 
said Hastings promised to be accountable.

Rosseter Reg t." 

SMITH, AMOS. Private, Capt. Samuel Low s co., Col. Benjamin Simonds s (Berk 
shire Co.) regt.; entered service Oct. 13, 1780; discharged Oct. 21, 1780; ser 
vice, 9 days, at the Northward by order of Gen. Fellows on an alarm. 

SMITH, AMOS. Private, Capt. Simon Adams s co., Col. John Coller s regt., Gen.

SMITH, AMOS. Private, Capt. Levi Brown s co., of Adams, Col. Asa Barnes s (Berk

SMITH, AMOS. Private, Capt. William Wells s detachment of militia, 3d Berkshire 
Co. regt. ; entered service Oct. 30, 1781 ; discharged Nov. 7, 1781 ; service, 
8 days; detachment marched on the alarm at Saratoga of Oct. 29, 1781.

tion to Rhode Island under Maj. Gen. Lincoln; also, Private, Capt. Samuel

1778 ; arrived at Fishkill June 7, 1778 ; also, list of men returned as mustered by 
Henry Rutgers, Jr., Deputy Muster Master, dated Fishkill, Aug. 1, 1778; also, 
Private, Capt. William Warner s co., Col. Thomas Marshall s regt. ; muster roll 
for Jan., 1779, dated West Point ; enlisted June 7, 1778 ; enlistment, 9 months ; 
also, descriptive list of men raised to serve in the Continental Army for the term 
of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as received of Justin 
Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Springfield, July 9, 1780; 
age, 20 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 11 in.; complexion, ruddy; engaged for town of 
Shrewsbury ; arrived at Springfield July 8, 1780 ; marched to camp July 9, 1780, 
under command of Lieut. Jackson, of the artillery ; also, list of men raised for the 
6 months service and retunied by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in 
a return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780 ; also, pay roll for 6 months men 
raised by the town of Shrewsbury for service in the Continental Army during 
1780; marched to camp July 5, 1780; discharged Dec. 14, 1780; service, 5 mos. 
18 days, including travel (180 miles) home. 

SMITH, ASHER. Private, Capt. Isaac Martin s co., Col. Joseph (Josiah) Whitney s 
regt. ; service from May 4, 1777, to July 4, 1777, 2 mos. 8 days, under Maj. Gen. 
Spencer at Rhode Island, including travel (115 miles) from home to place of 
destination and from place of discharge home. 



348 MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 

SMITH, ASHER. Private, Capt. John Maynard s co., Col. Job Cushing s regt. ; 
marched Aug. 21, 1777; discharged Aug. 23, 1777; service, 6 days, including 
3 days ((30 miles) travel home ; company marched to Hadley by order of Col. 
Denney on an alarm at Bennington. Roll dated Shrewsbury. 

SMITH, ASHER. Private, Capt. Ebenezer Ingalsbe s co., Col. Job Cushing s regt.; 
enlisted Sept. 12, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 29, 1777 ; service, 2 mos. 28 days, in 
Northern department, including 10 days (200 miles) travel home. Roll sworn, 
to in Worcester Co. 

SMITH, ASHER. Private, Capt. Daniel Bowker s co., Col. Webb s regt.; enlisted 
Aug. 30, 1781 ; discharged Dec. 4, 1781 ; service, 3 mos. 14 days, including 10 
days (192 miles) travel home ; regiment raised to reinforce Continental Army 
for 3 months. 

SMITH, " AZADIAH." Capt. Jonathan Procter s c,o., Col. Jacob Gerrish s regt. of

SMITH, AZOR. Private, Capt. Josiah Smith s co., Col. Josiah Whitney s regt. ; en 
listed May 25, 1776, 4 days preceding march ; service, 1 mo. 9 days; reported 
died July 3, 1776; company raised for defence of town and harbor of Boston. 

SMITH, BARAK (also given BARUCH), Dedham. Private, Capt. Ebenezer Battle s 
co. of 4th Parish in Dedham ; service, 2 days, probably on the alarm of April 
19, 1775; also, Capt. Battle s co., Col. Mclntosh s regt. ; service, 5 days, at the 
time of taking and fortifying Dorchester Heights in March, 1776; also, enlist 
ment agreement dated June -, 1776, signed by said Smith and others, engaging 
themselves to serve until Dec. 1, 1776, unless sooner discharged, and to march 
with despatch to Charlestown, N. H. ; also, Private, Capt. Timothy Stow s 
co., Col. Ephraim Wheelock s regt.; pay abstract for wages, mileage, etc. ; 
company stationed at Ticonderoga in 1776; also, Capt. Ebenezer Battle s co., 
Col. William Mclntosh s regt. ; entered service March 23, 1778 ; discharged 
April 9, 1778 ; service, 18 days ; company marched to Roxbury March 23, 1778 ; 
also, Capt. Ebenezer Battelle s co. ; enlisted July 6, 1778 ; discharged July 17, 
1778 ; service, 11 days, guarding Continental stores at and about Watertown ; 
also, Capt. Ebenezer Everet s co., Col. Mclntosh s regt., Gen. Lovell s brigade ; 
enlisted Aug. 1, 1778 ; discharged Sept. 14, 1778 ; service, 1 mo. 15 days, on 
expedition to Rhode Island; also, Capt. Thomas Vinson s co., Col. Garrish s 
(Gerrish s) regt.; enlisted Oct. 25, 1779; discharged Nov. 23, 1779; service, 
1 mo. 10 days, at North river, including 11 days (220 miles) travel ; regiment 
raised in Suffolk and Essex counties; also, Capt. Moses Bullard s co., Col. 
Ebenezer Thayer s regt. ; enlisted July 26, 1780; discharged Oct. 30, 1780; ser 
vice, 3 mos. 8 days, including 3 days (60 miles) travel home ; regiment raised 
in Suffolk Co. to reinforce Continental Army for 3 months and stationed at 
Rhode Island. 

SMITH, BARNABAS. Private, Capt. Joseph Smith s co. : enlisted Feb. 7, 1776: ser 
vice to Feb. 29, 1776, in defence of seacoast ; roll dated Truro and sworn to at 
Eastham ; also, same co. ; service from May 31, 1776 r 5 mos. 22 days ; company 
stationed at Truro for defence of seacoast. 

SMITH, BARNABY. Seaman, ship " Protector," commanded by Capt- John Foster 
Williams; engaged Feb. 17,1781; service, 2 mos. 18 days ; reported captured 
May 5, 1781. 

SMITH, BARNEY. Private, Capt. James Macomber s (3d) co., Col. Mitchel s (Bris

SMITH, BARZILLAI. Petition dated Boston, Oct. 15, 1776, signed by Elijah Freeman 
Payne, of Boston, asking that said Smith be commissioned as commander of 
the schooner " Eagle" (privateer) ; ordered in Council Oct. 16, 1776, that a 
commission be issued. 

SMITH, BARZILLAI. Petition dated Boston, Jan. 1, 1781, signed by Isaac Smith, of 
Boston, asking that said Barzillai Smith be commissioned as commander of the 
brigantine " Betsy" (privateer) ; advised in Council Jan. 1, 1781, that a com 
mission be issued and that the naval officer of the port of Boston be directed to 
clear said vessel with a lading of fish for the West Indies, the same being unfit 
for home consumption. 

SMITH, "BELEZER." Descriptive list dated Northampton, Sept. 14, 1780, of men

to the brig " Samuel." 

SMITH, BENJAMIN, Barnstable. Lieutenant, Capt. Micah Hamilton s co., which 
marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Marshfield under command of Col.

co. ; enlisted July 1, 1775; service to Dec. 31, 1775, in defence of seacoast ; also,

days, on four alarms ; company served subsequent to April 5, 1779, on four 
alarms at Falmouth, two in April, one in May, and one in Sept., 1779.

ter, June 15, 1770, signed by the Selectmen, certifying that Capt. William 
Ellery, of Gloucester, was entitled to the wages of said Smith, a soldier in 
Capt. Nathaniel Warner s co., an apprentice to said Ellery, who was killed 
in battle at Bunker Hill, and who had no estate or relatives in this country, 
having been born in England.

plexion, ruddy ; engaged for town of Needham ; marched to camp July 16, 1780, 
under command of Capt. Zebulon King ; also, list of men raised for the 6 months 
service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a re 
turn dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780; also, Private, Capt. Abrarn Watson s 
co., Col. John Greaton s (3d) regt.; muster roll for Oct., 1780; enlisted July 
15, 1780 ; enlistment, 6 months ; also, pay roll for 6 months men belonging to 
the town of Needham raised for service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; 
entered service July 12, 1780; discharged Dec. 4, 1780; service, 5 mos. 3 days, 
including travel (220 miles) home.

residence, Middleborough; also, descriptive list made up from Nov. 6, 1776, 
to Feb. 1, 1780, dated West Point; Major s co., 10th Mass. regt. ; age, 18 yrs. ; 
stature, 4 ft. 10 in. ; complexion, light and freckled ; hair, red ; residence, Free 
town; enlistment, during war; also, descriptive list endorsed " W Point Jan y 
llth 1781;" Capt. Samuel King s co., Col. Benjamin Tupper s (10th) regt.; 
age, 18 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. ; complexion, light ; hair, red ; engaged Oct. 28, 1779, 
by Lieut. Smith; term, during war; also, Drummer, Col. Tupper s regt.; ser 
vice from Jan. 1, 1781, 24 mos. ; reported appointed Drummer June 1, 1781.

SMITH, DAVID, Rehoboth. Receipt dated Rehoboth, Feb. 20, 1781, for bounty paid 
said Smith by John Brown, on behalf of the town of Rehoboth, to serve in

Co. to serve in the Continental Army, agreeable to resolve of Dec. 2, 1780, as 
attested by James Williams, Superintendent for said county, dated Taunton ; 
also, descriptive list of men returned as received of James Williams, Superin 
tendent for Bristol Co., by Joshua Wilbore, at Taunton, March 21, 1781, to be 
conducted to Springfield and delivered to Col. Shepard ; Capt. Willmarth s 
co., 1st regt. ; age, 20 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 10 in. ; complexion, dark; eyes, gray; 
hair, brown; occupation, tailor; residence, Rehoboth; term, 3 years; also, 
Private, Capt. Seth Banister s co., Col. William Shepard s (4th) regt. ; muster 
rolls for May and July, 1781, dated Phillipsburgh ; enlisted Feb. 9, 1781 ; enlist 
ment, 3 years ; reported on duty at the Lines ; also, muster roll for Aug., 1781, 
dated Camp at Peekskill; reported on command with Col. Scammell ; also, 
muster roll for Sept., 1781, dated Continental Village ; reported on command 
at the Southward; also, muster rolls for Oct., 1781-Jan., 1782, dated York 
Hutts; reported on command at the Southward in Oct. and Nov., 1781, sick at 
the Southward in Dec., 1781, died Jan. 1, 1782.

regt.; pay abstract for travel allowance, etc., home from place of discharge, 
Fort Edward, dated Boston, Jan. 15, 1777 ; 412 miles travel allowed said Smith. 

SMITH, EBENEZER, Buxton. List of men mustered by Nathaniel Wells, Muster 
Master for York Co. ; said Smith, with others, mustered July 3, 1779, for the 
term of 9 months from the time of their arrival at Springfield ; also, descriptive 
list of men raised to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 9 months,

missioner, by Capt. James Tisdale, at Springfield, Aug. 23, 1779; 1st co.,

dall, dated Springfield, Aug. 22, 1779; also, Major s co. ; entered service July 
12, 1779 ; discharged April 12, 1780 ; term, 9 months.

20 days. Roll dated Boston. 

SMITH, EDWARD, Egg Harbor. Private, Capt. Nathaniel Winslow s co., Gen. John 
Thomas s regt. ; company return dated Oct. 0, 1775 ; enlisted Sept. 1-4, 1775. 

SMITH, EDWARD, Pembroke (probably). Private, Capt. Freedom Chamberlain s 
co., Col. Bailey s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 
2 weeks. 

SMITH, EDWARD, Pembroke. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Conti 
nental Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, re 
turned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, 
at Springfield, July 9, 1780 ; age, 25 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 11 in ; complexion, light ; 
engaged for town of Pembroke ; arrived at Springfield July 8, 1780 ; inarched 
to camp July 9, 1780, under command of Lieut. Jackson, of the artillery ; also, 
list of men raised for the 6 months service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson 
as having passed muster in a return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780; also, 
pay roll for 6 months men raised by the town of Pembroke for service in the 
Continental Army during 1780; marched July 4, 1780; discharged Dec. 12, 
1780; service, 5 mos. 19 days, including travel (200 miles) home. 

SMITH, EDWARD, Shirley. List of men raised in Middlesex Co. for Continental ser 
vice, agreeable to resolve of June 9, 1779, as returned by Joseph Hosmer, Super 
intendent for said county, Nov. 24, 1779; also, descriptive list of men raised in 
Middlesex Co. in 1779 to serve in the Continental Army ; age, 16 yrs. ; stature, 

5 ft. 7 in. ; complexion, light ; engaged for town of Shirley ; delivered to 
Ensign J. Hubbel ; also, list of 6 months men raised agreeable to resolve of

ley ; inarched to camp July 12, 1780, under command of Ensign Gilbert; also, 
list of men raised for the months service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson 
as having passed muster in a return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780 ; also,

Private, Capt. Daniel Bowker s co., Col. Webb s regt. ; enlisted Aug. 18, 1781 ;

SMITH, ELEAZER. Capt. Daniels s co., Col. Wheelock s regt.; report of guard 
detail and prisoners under confinement, dated Ticonderoga, Sept. 26, 1776, 
made to Gen. Gates, taken from Col. Wheelock s Orderly Book ; said Smith 
confined by Francis Johnson, President of the court-martial, for passing coun 
terfeit money; also, return of sentences by a general court-martial, Lieut. Col. 
Johnson, President, appearing in a general order dated Headquarters, Ticon 
deroga, Oct 3, 1776, taken from Col. Ephraim Wheelock s Orderly Book ; said 
Smith tried on charge of counterfeiting Massachusetts currency, found guilty, 
and sentenced to receive 39 lashes on his bare back. 

SMITH, ELEAZER. Capt. Sabin Mann s co. of Medfield militia; list of men raised

agreeable to resolves of June 25, 1776, and July 11, 1776; reported enlisted to

Ezekiel Plimpton s co., Col. Benjamin Hawes s regt. ; enlisted Sept. 25, 1777; 
service, 29 days, at Rhode Island; reported deserted Oct. 23, 1777; roll dated 
Medfield.

SMITH, ELIAS. Petition signed by John Dyson, of Beverly, in behalf of himself and 
others, of Beverly and Boston, asking that said Smith be commissioned as 
commander of the brigantine " Washington" (privateer) ; ordered in Council 
Oct. 3, 1776, that a commission be issued; also, petition dated Boston, May 2, 
1777, signed by said Smith, in behalf of himself and others, owners of the 
brigantine " Washington," stating that he had been commissioned to command 
said brigantine Oct. 3, 1776, bound on a cruise under Capt. Manly ; that during 
stress of weather the vessel had shipped a sea that destroyed his commission 
and other things ; and asking that a new commission might be issued ; ordered 
in Council May 2, 1777, that a commission be issued ; also, petition dated 
Salem, June 2, 1778, signed by William Pickman and William Orne, in behalf 
of themselves and others, of Salem, asking that said Smith be commissioned 
as commander of the ship "Black Prince" (privateer) ; ordered in Council 
June 17, 1778, that a commission be issued ; also, petition dated Boston, Aug.

officers and crew, sworn to at Beverly, Sept. 14, 1780; age, 37 yrs. ; stature, 5

Leach and others, of Beverly, asking that said Smith be commissioned as com 
mander of the ship " Mohawk " (privateer) : advised in Council Nov. 20, 1781, 
that a commission be issued.

SMITH, ELIJAH. Private, Col. Benjamin Tupper s (10th) regt. ; service from March 
10, 1781, 21 mos. 21 days; reported appointed Corporal April 1, 1782. 

SMITH, ELIJAH. Captain of Marines, Continental frigate " Deane," commanded by 
Capt. Samuel Nicholson ; engaged Dec. 6, 1781 ; service to May 31, 1782, 5 mos. 
25 days ; term, 5 months. 

SMITH, ELIJAH. Receipt dated May 16, 1783, for wages for service to May 10, 1783, 
on board the frigate " Hague," commanded by Capt. John Manley. 

SMITH, ELIPHALET, Grafton. Private, Capt. Aaron Kimball s co. of militia, Gen. 
Artemas Ward s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 
7 days ; reported enlisted into the army April 26, 1775 ; also, Capt. Luke Drury s 
co., Col. Jonathan "Ward s regt. ; order for advance pay, signed by said Smith 
and others, dated June 10, 1775 ; also, receipt for blanket, given to Capt. Drury, 
dated Cambridge Camp, June 10, 1775 ; also, Private, same co. and regt. ; mus 
ter roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted April 26, 1775 ; service, 3 mos. 13 days ; 
also, company return [probably Oct., 1775] ; also, receipt for bounty coat dated 
Nov. 3, 1775. 

SMITH, ELIPHALET, Grafton. List of men raised to serve in the Continental Army 
from 6th Worcester Co. regt., as returned by Capt. Joseph Warrin; residence,

regt. ; term, 3 years; also, Private, (6th) co., Col. James Wesson s regt. ; Con

Col. Wesson s (9th) regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from 
Jan. 1, 1780, to April 12, 1780; reported discharged. 

SMITH, ELIPHALET, Sandisfield (also given Grafton) . Private, Capt. Noah Allen s 
(late Capt. Moses Soul s) co., Col. Asa Whitcomb s regt.; muster roll dated 
Camp at Ticonderoga, Nov. 27, 1776 ; enlisted Dec. 11, 1775 ; also, list of men 
raised for Continental service ; residence, Sandisfield ; engaged for town of 
Sandisfield; joined Capt. Allin s co., Col. Wigglesworth s regt.; term, 3 
years ; also, list of men mustered between Jan. 20, 1777, and June 1, 1778, by

tive list of deserters from 13th Mass. regt. commanded by Lieut. Col. Calvin 
Smith, endorsed " July 13th 1780; " Capt. Allen s co. ; rank, Private; age, 20 
yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 8 in.; complexion, light; hair, dark; occupation, yeoman; 
birthplace, Suffield, Hartford Co.; residence, Sandisfield; reported deserted 
in March, 1778. 

SMITH, ELIPHALET, Walpole. Private, Capt. Oliver Clap s co., Col. Ephraim 
Wheelock s regt. commanded by Maj. James Metcalf ; service, 21 days; said 
Smith, with others, drafted to remain 3 weeks at Warwick ; company marched 
on the alarm at Warwick, R. I., of Dec. 8, 1776; also, Capt. Sabin Mann s 
co., Col. Wheelock s regt. ; marched April 22, 1777; discharged May 10, 1777; 
service, 20 days ; company marched to Rhode Island. [See Liffe Smith.] 

SMITH, ELIPHALET. Private, Capt. John Boyd s co., Col. John Dagget s regt.; 
entered service Aug. 24, 1778; discharged Sept. 3, 1778; service, 11 days, at 
Rhode Island, including travel (3 days) home.

engaged for town of Belchertown ; arrived at Springfield July 4, 1780 ; marched 
to camp July 5, 1780, under command of Capt. Frothingham, of the artillery; 
also, list of men raised for the months service and returned by Brig. Gen. 
Paterson as having passed muster in a return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25,

4th Hampshire Co. regt. ; service, 3 days ; company marched to Northampton 
in June, 1782, to suppress the mob. 



IN THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 395 

SMITH, ENDS, Hartley. Private, Capt. Eliakim Smith s co., which marched April 

20, 1775, in response to the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; returned April 22, 1775 ; 
service, 7 days; also, petition addressed to the General Court, at Watertown, 
May 29, 1776, signed by said Smith, stating that he had marched to Cambridge 
on the alarm in April, 1775, and when he returned home left his gun for the 
use of the government; that said gun, valued at 2 4s, was used by David 
Patch, of Capt. Eliakim Smith s co., Col. Jonathan Ward s regt., who went 
to Canada in Col. Arnold s detachment and was there killed or captured: and 
asking recompense for the loss of his gun ; petition endorsed " ordered to lye." 

SMITH, ENDS. Private, Capt. Benjamin Phillips s co., Col. Elisha Porter s (Hamp 
shire Co.) regt.; enlisted July 10, 1777; discharged Aug. 12, 1777; service, 38 
days, in Northern department, including travel (100 miles) home.

SMITH, EPHRAIM, Bedford. Private, Lieut. Moses Abbott s (Bedford) co. of

Camp, June 6, 1775; also, Private, same co. and regt. ; company return [prob

from Jan. 1, 1780, to March 27, 1780. 

SMITH, FRANCIS. Corporal, Capt. Thomas Lord s co., Col. Job Cushing s regt.; 
enlisted Sept. 1, 1777; discharged Nov. 30, 1777; service, 3 mos. 9 days, in 
Northern department at the time of taking Gen. Burgoyne, including 10 days 
(200 miles) travel home; company allowed travel from Tarrytown, N. Y., to 
Athol. 

SMITH, FRANCIS, Jr., Lynn. Private, Capt. David Parker s (1st Lynn) co. which 
marched probably on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Concord ; service, 2 days. 

SMITH, FREEMAN. Sergeant, Capt. Thomas Hamilton s co. ; enlisted July 7, 1775;

for defence of seacoast; also, 2d Lieutenant, Capt. Benjamin Godfrey s (1st) 
co. (co. of East District in Chatham) , Col. Joseph Doane s (2d Barnstable Co.) 
regt. of Mass, militia; list of officers chosen by said company; said Smith 
chosen in room of David Buck, who declined the appointment ; ordered in 
Council June 27, 1776, that said officers be commissioned ; reported commis 
sioned June 27, 1776.
