22 days ; company stationed at Truro for defence of seacoast. 

SMITH, HEMAN. Seaman, brigantine " Freedom," commanded by Capt. John Clous-

SMITH, HENRY, continued. 

to Jan. 1, 1781; said Smith tried Jan. 27, 1782, by general court-martial,

Jan. 1, 1781; said Smith deserted Nov. -, 1782, from Windsor.

SMITH, HENRY. Captain, 4th co., 2d Lincoln Co. regt. of Mass, militia; list of 
officers chosen by the several companies in said regiment, as returned by Joseph 
North, field officer; ordered in Council Aug. 23, 1776, that said officers be com 
missioned ; also, letter from said Smith to Joseph North, at Gardnerstown, 
dated June 24, 1777, stating that he had served the town for one year as an 
officer, that he was unable to continue longer in the performance of his duties, 
and requesting that his resignation be accepted ; the aforesaid letter was trans 
mitted to the President of the Council as shown by a communication signed by 
Joseph North, dated Gardnerstown, July 28, 1777, and the Council order was 
passed confirming the choice of one Samuel Oakman in the room of said Capt. 
Henry Smith.

discharged Dec. 15, 1780, 150 miles from home ; service, 5 mos. 15 days.

recommended for commissions ; also, Lieutenant Colonel, Col. Moses Little s 
(17th) regt. ; engaged May 19, 1775 ; service, 2 mos. 18 days ; roll dated Camp 
Prospect Hill ; also, Lieutenant Colonel, same regt. ; return of officers, dated 
June 26, 1775; said officers recommended for commissions in Committee of 
Safety June 26, 1775 ; ordered in Provincial Congress June 27, 1775, that com 
missions be delivered said officers ; also, official record of a ballot by the House 
of Representatives, dated Jan. 23, 1776, for officers to command the six regiments 
to be raised to serve before Boston until April 1, 1776 ; said Smith chosen Colonel 
of the regiment to be raised in Essex Co. ; appointment concurred in by Council 
Jan. 23, 1776; also, Colonel; list of officers of a regiment raised to serve until 
April 1 [year not given], as a temporary re-enforcement to the army ; ordered 
in Council March 13, 1776, that said officers be commissioned ; reported com 
missioned March 13, 1776.

19, 1775; said Smith marched April 19, 1775; service, 10 days.

SMITH, JAMES. Private, Capt. Theophilus Lyon s co. ; entered service March 1, 
1778 ; discharged April 5, 1778 ; service, 36 days ; company marched to Castle 
Island March 1, 1778, under command of Lieut. Col. Samuel Pierce. 

SMITH, JAMES. Seaman, schooner "Active," commanded by Capt. Andrew Gard 
ner ; pay roll for wages for 1 month due under contract with the government, 
dated Boston, Oct. 6, 1778. 

SMITH, JAMES. Corporal, Capt. Jotham Houghton s co. ; service from Nov. 3 to

SMITH, JAMES. Private, Capt. Solomon Brown s co., Col. Elisha Porter s (Hamp

SMITH, JAMES. Private, Capt. Thomas Cummiugs s co., Col. Jacob Gerrish s regt. ;

SMITH, JAMES, alias ISAAC WALLIS. Receipt dated Boston, July 11, 1782, for bounty 
paid said Smith by the town of Salem to serve in the Continental Army for the

Boston subsequent to June 24, 1782, as returned by Lieut. Col. John Popkin, 
of the Artillery ; mustered July 11, 1782, to the credit of the town of Salem ; 
deserted July 11, 1782; acknowledgment was made by said Smith, alias 
Wallis, subsequent to his desertion that he had been induced to enlist under 
the fictitious name of Smith, by one Chandler, alias Tucker, of Townsend.

for bounty coat dated Nov. 1, 1775.

SMITH, JOHN, Brimfield. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental

for July, Aug., and Sept., 1780 ; joined July 11, 1780 ; also, same co. ; pay roll for 
Oct., 1780 ; also, same co. ; pay roll for Nov. and Dec., 1780, dated West Point ; 
also, pay roll for 6 months men raised by the town of Brimfield for service in 
the Continental Army during 1780; marched July 10, 1780; discharged Jan. 
10, 1781 ; service, 6 mos. 7 days, including travel (7 days) home.

SMITH, JOHN, Brookfield (also given Ware). List of men raised to serve in the

nental Army pay accounts for service from April 29, 1777, to Dec. 17, 1778 ;

Nixon s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from June 8, 1780, 
to Dec. 31, 1780; term, during war; reported joined from desertion Juno 8, 
1780; also, certificate dated Boston, July 7, 1780, signed by Capt. Matthew 
Chambers, certifying that said Smith, a Private in Capt. Toogood s co., Col. 
Nixon s regt., had deserted in Dec., 1778, and, in consequence of Gen. Wash 
ington s proclamation, had returned to duty and was under the particular care 
of said Capt. Chambers, and stating that inasmuch as his gratuity had been 
deducted from his depreciation note, said Smith desired that $100 might be 
allowed him. 

SMITH, JOHN, Brookfield. Private, Capt. Benjamin Heywood s co., Lieut. Col. 
Calvin Smith s (6th) regt. ; muster rolls for Jan.-May, 1781, dated West Point ; 
enlistment, 3 years (also given during war) ; reported absent by leave of Gen. 
Heath in Jan., 1781, absent with recruiting officer Feb.-May, 1781; also, 
muster rolls for June and July, 1781; also, muster roll for Aug., 1781, sworn 
to at Camp Peekskill ; also, muster roll for Sept., 1781, sworn to at Camp

Highlands; also, muster roll for Dec., 1781, dated New Boston and sworn to 
in Quarters Highlands ; also, descriptive list of men in Continental service : 
Capt. Benjamin Heywood s co., 6th Mass. regt. ; age, 30 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 8 
in.; complexion, light; hair, brown ; occupation, yeoman ; birthplace, Brook- 
field ; residence, Brookfield; engaged April 26, 1777; term, during war; also, 
Capt. Heywood s co., Lieut. Col. Calvin Smith s (6th) regt. ; muster rolls for 
Jan., Feb., and March, 1782, dated Hutts New Boston and sworn to in Quarters 
Highlands ; reported on duty at the Lines in Jan. and Feb., 1782; also, muster 
rolls for April-Oct., 1782; also, Capt. Heywood s co., 6th Mass. regt. : muster 
roll for Nov., 1782; also, Capt. Heywood s (4th) co., Col. Benjamin Tupper s 
(6th) regt.; muster roll for Dec., 1782; reported on command with Maj. 
Spurr at Providence from Nov. 18, 1782; also, muster rolls for Jan., March, 
and April, 1783; also, register of contingencies in Capt. Heywood s co., 6th 
Mass. regt. ; said Smith furloughed June 10, 1783, until the declaration of 
peace: also, order on the Agent of 6th Mass, regt., payable to Calvin Smith, 
dated West Point, Sept. 24, 1783, signed by said Smith, for the $80 gratuity 
granted to soldiers by resolve of Congress for serving during the war.

armed vessels appearing to be coming into Winter Harbor ; roll dated Buxton,

SMITH, JOHN, Newbury (also given Wells and Sheepscot). List of men raised to 
serve in the Continental Army, as returned by, Moses Noyes, Chairman of 
Selectmen and Committee cf Newbury : residence, Newbury ; enlisted for 
town of Newbury; joined Capt. Moses Greenleaf s co., Col. Francis s regt.; 
enlistment, 3 years; also, list of men mustered subsequent to Feb. 16, 1778, 
by Nathaniel Wells, Muster Master, to serve in the Continental Army for 3 
years or during the war, dated Wells, April 9, 1778; Capt. Daniel Wheel 
wright s co., Col. Benjamin Tupper s regt.; residence, Wells; also, Private, 
Capt. Moses Greenleaf s co., Col. Benjamin Tupper s (10th) regt. ; Continental 
Army pay accounts for service from Feb. 21, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; reported 
as a deserter in 1780; also, same co. and regt.; return dated Jan. 25, 1778; 
mustered by County and Continental Muster Masters ; reported taken prisoner 
at " Hubelton : " also, descriptive list dated Jan. 10, 1780[81] ; Capt. Nehemiah 
Emerson s co., 10th Mass. regt. : age, 19 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 6 in. ; complexion, 
dark; hair, dark; residence, Sheepscot; engaged Jan. 1, 1780, by Capt. Green- 
leaf ; term, during war; reported deserted to the enemy April 1, 1780. 

SMITH, JOHN, Newbury. Return certified at Camp near Morristown, April 30, 1780, 
of officers and men belonging to Col. Lee s, Col. Henley s, and Col. Jackson s 
regts., and men belonging to Massachusetts in Col. Henry Sherburne s regt., 
who were incorporated into a regiment under the command of Col. Henry 
Jackson, agreeable to the arrangement of April 9, 1779; rank, Private; resi 
dence, Newbury ; engaged July 3, 1777 ; term, 3 years ; said Smith appears 
among men belonging to Col. Henry Jackson s regt. who had been discharged 
from the rolls prior to above arrangement; reported deserted; also reported 
never joined. 

SMITH, JOHN, Newburyport. Private, Capt. Ezra Lunt s co., Col. Moses Little s 
(17th) regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 2, 1775; service, 13 
weeks; also, company return [probably Oct., 1775]; age, 20 yrs.; also, order 
for bounty coat dated Prospect Hill, Nov. 14, 1775. 

SMITH. JOHN, Newburyport. Private, Capt. Timothy Barnard s co., Col. Moses

Stockbridge for service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; marched from 
home July 1, 1780; discharged Dec. 25, 1780; service, 5 mos. 29 days, at West 
Point, including travel (90 miles) home.

plexion, light; hair, light; occupation, laborer; residence, Stockbridge; en

intendent, stating that he had received said Smith to serve in the Continental

alarm to reinforce army at that place. Roll dated Chesterfield.

shire Co.) regt. ; service, 4 days ; company marched to quell the mob at North 
ampton June 12, and June 16, 1782, and was allowed horse rations. 

SMITH, JOHN. Private, Col. Benjamin Tupper s (10th) regt. ; service from April 
1, 1782, 3 mos. 3 days ; reported deserted July 4, 1782. 

SMITH, JOHN. Seaman, sloop "Winthrop," commanded by Capt. George Little; 
engaged Oct. 4, 1782; discharged Oct. 6, 1782; reported "Ran away." Roll 
sworn to at Boston. 

SMITH, JOHN. Private, Capt. Amos Lincoln s co. of Matrosses; enlisted Sept. 1,

detailed for garrison duty. 

SMITH, JOHN. Quarter Master. State ship "Tartar," commanded by Capt. John

field militia, both train band and alarm list, to reinforce the Continental Army,

Medfield militia drafted to complete the quota for the Continental Army, in 
accordance with a warrant issued by Lieut. John Baxter May 8, 1777, but who 
paid money in lieu of service ; said Smith reported as having paid 7 10s.

return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780.

7 mos. 23 days as Ensign, 2 mos. 13 days as Quartermaster, 24 mos. 24 days 
as Lieutenant ; also, 2d Lieutenant, same regt. ; return of officers for clothing; 
receipt for said clothing, dated Boston, June 17, 1778; also, Lieutenant, 
same regt.; list of officers in need of clothing, dated Boston, Nov. 24, 1778; 
also, Adjutant and Lieutenant, Col. Putnam s regt. ; Continental Army pay 
accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to Dec. 31, 1780; reported as serving 
1 mo. as Adjutant and Lieutenant, 11 mos. as Lieutenant ; also, Lieutenant, 
same regt. ; returns of effectives between Jan. 5, and Jan. 26, 1781, dated 
Garrison "West Point ; reported acting as Adjutant ; also, Adjutant, same 
regt.; muster roll of field, staff, and commissioned officers for Jan., 1781, 
dated Garrison West Point; appointed Jan. 1, 1781; also, Lieutenant, Capt. 
Joshua Benson s (Light Infantry) co., Col. Putnam s regt. ; muster rolls of 
field, staff, and commissioned officers for Feb., March, and April, 1781, dated 
Garrison West Point; reported on command with Marquis de Lafayette in 
April, 1781; also, returns of effectives between May 4, 1781, and June 15, 
1781, dated Garrison West Point ; reported on command with Light Infantry.

1st Lieutenant, Capt. Andrew Sampson s co. stationed at the Gurnet ; appoint 
ment concurred in by Council Jan. 10, 1777 ; reported commissioned Jan. 10, 
1777 ; also, Lieutenant, Capt. Andrew Samson s co. ; return dated May 20, 
1777; reported mustered by G. Partridge, Muster Master ; company stationed 
at the fort at the Guniet; also, communication addressed to Hon. Jeremiah 
Powel, dated Plymouth, May 14, 1777, signed by J. Warren, stating that Mr. 
Carver, 2d Lieutenant of the company at the Gurnet, had left the service and 
gone to sea, and that said Smith, 1st Lieutenant in the same co., wished to 
resign, and recommending John Washburne, of Plymouth, as 1st Lieutenant, 
and Sergt. Ebenezer Barker, of Pembroke, as 2d Lieutenant, to fill the vacan 
cies; also, official record of a ballot by the House of Representatives, dated 
June 20, 1777 ; John Washburn chosen 1st Lieutenant of the company stationed 
at the Gurnet at Plymouth, vice said Smith, resigned ; appointment concurred 
in by Council June 21, 1777. 

SMITH, JOSIAH, Pomfret, Conn. Return of men raised to serve in the Continental 
Army from Capt. Reuben Munn s 9th (1st Monson) co., Col. John Bliss s 
(1st Hampshire Co.) regt., dated April 6, 1778; residence, Pomfret, Conn.; 
engaged for town of Monson; joined Capt. Toogood s co., Col. Nixon s regt. ; 
engaged March 1, 1778; term, 8 months; a similar list is attested by Capt. 
Caleb Keep. 

SMITH, JOSIAH, South Hadley. Private, Capt. Noah Goodman s (South Hadley) 
co., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 3 days.

company to the last of Dec., 1775, although their names were omitted from the 
roll ; wages are allowed under the name Seth Owen for 1 mo. 5 days from July 
10, 1775.

given by Maj. James Metcalf Dec. 8, and Dec. 9, 1776; service, 4 days; also, 
Capt. Mann s co. ; marched Dec. 8, 1776; discharged Dec. 11, 1776; service, 4 
days, under Maj. James Metcalf ; company marched to Rhode Island on the 
alarm of Dec. 8, 1776; reported drafted for York; also, list of men drafted 
from Capt. Sabin Mann s co. of Medfield militia, both train band and alarm 
list, to reinforce Continental Army at or near New York, agreeable to warrant 
dated Nov. 21, 1776 ; said Smith and others reported Dec. 20, 1776, as hired by

were drafted in accordance with an order from Col. Ephraim \Vheelock, dated

turned June [May] 12, 1777; service, 20 days, in a company made up from 
Medfield, Medway, Bellingham, and Walpole, and placed under command of 
Capt. Mann, ordered to march to Providence, R. I., and there serve under Gen. 
Spencer until discharged; also, Private, Capt. Mann s co., Col. Wheelock s 
regt. ; marched April 22, 1777 ; discharged May 10, 1777 ; service, 20 clays ;

sons belonging to Capt. Mann s co. of Medfield militia who had been drafted 
to march to Rhode Island and there serve for one calendar month at or near 
Bristol, in accordance with a warrant from Lieut. Col. Benjamin Hawes, dated 
Wrentham, July 14, 1777, and by order of Brig. Lovell; said Smith, with 
Jabez Fuller, reported as having been hired by Eleazer Wheelock, Town 
Clerk ; service, 36 days ; also, list of men belonging to Capt. Mann s co. who 
marched on a secret expedition to Rhode Island the last of Sept., 1777, to serve 
for 30 days from Oct. 1, 1777, said men having been drafted in accordance with 
a warrant from Col. Hawes, dated Sept. 25, 1777 ; said Smith probably sick 
and unable to march.

regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to Dec.

as Corporal ; also, descriptive list dated West Point, Jan. 28, 1781 ; Capt. 
A. Williams s co., 2d Mass. regt. ; stature, 5 ft. 8 in. ; complexion, light ; hair, 
dark; residence, Kittery; enlisted March 1, 1777, by Lieut. Frost, at Kittery; 
enlistment, during war. 

SMITH, LEMUEL, Needham. Private, Capt. Nathaniel Belcher s co. ; marched 
Sept. 5, 1779; discharged Oct. 2, 1779; service, 29 days, under Maj. Gen. Han 
cock at Castle Island. 

SMITH, LEMUEL, Stoughton. Private, Capt. Robert Swan s co., Col. Benjamin 
Gill s regt. ; service, 3 days ; company marched from Stoughton to Squantum 
(The Moon) June 13, 1776, when the British fleet left Boston harbor. 

SMITH, LEMUEL, Stoughton. List of men raised by the town of Stoughton to rein 
force the Continental Army, agreeable to resolve of April 20, 1778, as returned 
by Capt. Robert Swan and Capt. James Endicott ; also, descriptive list of men 
raised in Suffolk Co. for the term of 9 months from the time of their arrival 
at Fishkill, as returned by Stephen Badlam, Superintendent for said county; 
Capt. Swan s co., Col. Gill s regt.; age, 19 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 8 in.; com 
plexion, light ; hair, light; eyes, light; occupation, husbandman ; nationality, 
American ; residence, Stoughton ; engaged for town of Stoughton ; conducted 
to camp by Elkanah Hixson; also, list of men returned as received of Maj. 
Stephen Badlam, Superintendent for Suffolk Co., by Sergt. Elkanah Hixson, 
of Col. Alden s regt., at Dorchester May 27, 1778, to be delivered to Brig. 
Gen. Jonathan Warner, at Fishkill ; also, list of men returned as received of 
Jonathan Warner, Commissioner, by Col. R. Putnam, July 20, 1778; also, 
list of men returned as mustered by Henry Rutgers, Jr., Deputy Muster 
Master, dated Fishkill, Aug. 1, 1778; arrived at Fishkill June 14, 1778; also, 
Private, Maj. William Lithgow s co., Col. Benjamin Tupper s regt.; muster 
roll for March, 1779, dated West Point; enlisted June 14, 1778; discharged 
March 14, 1779; enlistment, 9 months; also, descriptive list of men raised in 
Suffolk Co. to reinforce the Continental Army, agreeable to resolve of June 9, 
1779; Capt. Talbut s co., Col. Gill s regt.; age, 20 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 8 in.; 
hair, sandy; eyes, light; occupation, husbandman; nationality, American; 
residence, Stoughton; engaged for town of Stoughton; reported delivered to 
Capt. L. Bailey; also, list of men returned as received of Maj. Stephen Bad 
lam, Superintendent for Suffolk Co., by Justin Ely, Commissioner, certified 
at Springfield; also, Capt. Webb s co., Col. Shepard s (4th) regt. ; entered 
service July 25, 1779; term, 9 months; reported taken prisoner Feb. 3, 1780. 

SMITH, LEMUEL, Williamstown. List of men raised to serve in the Continental Army 
from Capt. Judah Williams s (Williamstown) co. [year not given] ; residence, 
Williamstown; engaged for town of Williamstown ; joined Capt. Warren s co., 
Col. Bayley s regt. ; term, 3 years. 

SMITH, LEMUEL. Private, Capt. Lemuel Stewart s co. ; enlisted July 19 [1775] ;

service July 12 [1775] ; credited with 40 days billeting allowance; amount of 
billeting for company paid on a warrant from Maj. Gen. Schuyler, and receipted 
for by Capt. Stewart, at Albany, Jan. 27, 1776. 

SMITH, LEMUEL. Private, Capt. Benjamin Hooper s co. ; marched Jan. 22, 1776 ; 
service to Nov. 24, 1776, 10 mos. 3 days; company reported as mustered by 
Peter Noyes, Muster Master, at Falmouth, Cumberland Co., Feb. 29, 1776, and 
stationed there for defence of seacoast.

SMITH, MARTIN, Jr., Westfield. Receipt dated Westfield, July 11, 1780, signed by

from the town of Westfield for service to be performed in the Continental 
Army for the term of 6 months " next ensuing," the wages to become due from

Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780. [See Matthew Smith.] 

SMITH, MATTHEW, Sandisfield. Private, Capt. Jacob Brown s co. of Minute-men, 
Col. John Fellows s regt., which marched in response to the alarm of April 19, 
1775 ; roll made up from April 21, 1775, to May 7, 1775 ; service, 1 mo. 18 days ; 
mileage (140 miles) allowed said Smith; also, Capt. Moses Soul s co., Col. 
John Fellows s (8th) regt. ; company return dated Oct. 7, 1775 ; reported enlisted 
April 21, 1775 ; also reported enlisted into the tram June 25, 1775 ; also, peti 
tion addressed to the Provincial Congress, dated Roxbury, June 21, 1775, 
signed by said Smith and others who had enlisted to form an Artillery co., 
stating their unwillingness to serve under John Wiley as Captain, owing to 
their belief in his incompetence ; also, Capt. Ezra Badlam s co. of the train of 
artillery ; return dated Roxbury Camp, June 23, 1775 ; also, 2d Corporal, Capt. 
Ezra Badlam s co., Col. Richard Gridley s (Artillery) regt. : muster roll dated

return of men in service probably between Jan. 1, 1776, and April -, 1776, as 
per certificate dated Dec. 14, 1839.

ance for articles lost in battle at Bunker Hill June 17, 1775 ; said Smith claimed

SMITH, NATHAN. Private, Capt. Lemuel Stewart s co. ; enlisted May 10, 1775 ; re

Private, Capt. Hancock s co., Col. Joseph Vose s regt. ; Continental Army pay 
accounts for service from March 1, 1777, to June 4, 1779; reported deserted; 
also, Capt. Robert Davis s co., Col. Vose s regt.; muster roll for Dec., 1777, 
sworn to at Camp Valley Forge ; enlisted March 1, 1777 ; enlistment, 3 years ; 
reported on furlough; also, same co. and regt.; pay roll for Nov., 1778; also, 
same co. and regt. ; muster roll for Dec., 1778, sworn to at Providence; also, 
same co. and regt.; pay roll for Jan., 1779; also, same co. and regt.; order 
for gratuity, dated Providence, Feb. 13,1779; also, (late) Capt. Davis s co., 
Col. Vose s regt. ; muster roll for March and April, 1779, dated Providence ; 
also, list of deserters from Col. Vose s (1st) regt., dated Camp Highlands, 
N. Y., July 13, 1780 ; age, 30 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 6 in. ; complexion, light ; hair, 
brown ; birthplace, Biddeford ; residence, Biddeford. 

SMITH, NOAH. Private, Capt. Nathaniel Snow s co., Col. George Williams s regt. ; 
enlisted June 22, 1778 ; service, 23 days ; company marched from Taunton and 
Raynham June 22, 1778, and served under Gen. Sullivan in Col. Wade s regt. 
at Providence, R. I. Roll dated Raynham and sworn to at Taunton. 

SMITH, NOAH. Private, Capt. Isaac Hodges s co., Col. Hathaway s regt.: entered 
service March 24, 1779; discharged April 17, 1779; service, 25 days, at Rhode 
Island : roll sworn to at Taunton ; also, same co. and regt. ; return dated Little 
Compton, April 10, 1779; statement affixed, dated April 30, 1842, acknowledg 
ing receipt of the return from Israel Fisher, of Warw-ick, who served in above 
company, also states that said Fisher claimed the service was for 5 or 6 mos. 
at Rhode Island. 

SMITH, NOAH. Private, Capt. Pelatiah Eddy s co., Col. Abiel Mitchel s regt. com 
manded by Lieut. Col. James Williams, Brig. Gen. Godfrey s (Bristol Co.) 
brigade: service, 8 days; company marched from Taunton to Tiverton, R. I., 
on the alarm of Aug. 1, 1780.

Clayes, Col. Nixon sregt. ; pay roll for Jan. -June, 1780; also, (late) Capt. John

Peter Clayes s co.), Lieut. Col. Calvin Smith s (6th) regt.; return for wages

to Drummer Aug. 1, 1781 ; also, Drummer, same co. and regt. ; return for wages

regt. ; return [year not given, probably 1783] of men entitled to .$80 gratuity, 
agreeable to act of Congress of May 15, 1778, for serving during the war ; also, 
power of attorney, dated Aug. 11, 1783, signed by said Smith, making over to 
Eli Parsons, of Adams, his depreciation for the first three years and wages for 
the last four years of the war, together with what might be coming to him in 
any other way on account of his service as a Drummer in 6th Mass. regt. com 
manded by Col. Tupper, and constituting said Parsons his lawful attorney for 
the collection of his depreciation and wages ; also, order on Capt. Haywood, 
Agent, or Lieut. Emery, Paymaster, 6th Mass, regt., payable to Eli Parsons, 
dated Adams, Sept. 2, 1783, signed by said Smith, for the whole of his wages 
as a Drummer in 6th Mass, regt., together with gratuity for 1 year ; also, letter 
from William Lusk to Capt. Benjamin Howard (Heywoocl), of Worcester, 
dated Boston, Feb. 23, 1791, stating that he had received an order from said 
Smith for his wages as a Drummer in Capt. Smith s co., Col. Tupper s regt., 
together with a discharge from Gen. Washington, dated Jan. 4, 1783, given on 
account of a "strained ankle," and requesting to be informed whether or not 
any wages were due on said order, having been informed to the contrary.

Sudbury and joined Col. Joseph Read s regt. at Roxbury [year not given, 
probably 1775-6]. 

SMITH, PETER. Private, Capt. Isaac Parsons s co., Col. Prime s regt. ; enlisted May 
4, 1780; discharged Dec. 21, 1780; service, 7 mos. 18 days, under Brig. Gen. 
Wadsworth at the Eastward. Roll sworn to at North Yarmouth and certified 
at Thomaston. 

SMITH, PETER. Seaman, Continental frigate "Deane," commanded by Capt. 
Samuel Nicholson; engaged Feb. 24, 1782; service to May 31, 1782, 3 mos. 

7 days. 

SMITH, PHILANDER, Falmouth. Return of men raised to serve in the Continental

cis s regt.; term, 3 years; also, Private, Capt. Clark s co., Col. Benjamin 
Tuppers regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 20, 1777, 
to Oct. 20, 1777 ; reported taken prisoner July 7, 1777, died Oct. 20, 1777 ; also, 
Capt. John Skillin s co., Col. Ebenezer Francis s regt. ; subsistence allowed

ited with 60 days subsistence, including allowance for 336 miles travel ; also, 
Capt. Samuel Thomes s co., Col. Benjamin Tupper s (10th) regt. ; return dated 
Jan. 26, 1778 ; mustered by Maj. Ilsley, County Muster Master, and by Col. Var- 
rick, Continental Muster Master ; reported taken prisoner July 7, 1777. 

SMITH, PHILEMON, Ipswich. Private, Capt. Jonathan Cogswell, Jr. s co., which 
marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 3 days ; also, Capt. David 
Low s co. of volunteers, 3d Essex Co. regt.; enlisted Sept. 30, 1777; marched 
Oct. 2, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 7, 1777 : service, 40 days, in a regiment com 
manded by Maj. Charles Smith under Gen. Gates in Northern department and 
in guarding Gen. Burgoyne s army to Prospect Hill ; company discharged at 
Cambridge; also, Capt. David Low s (3d) co., Col. Jonathan Cogswell s (3d 
Essex Co.) regt. ; return of train band and alarm list, dated April 30, 1778 ; 
reported as belonging to train band ; also, same co. and regt. ; pay abstract for 
equipments, dated Aug. 21, 1778 : also, Capt. Benjamin Gould s co., Col. Wade s 
regt.; entered service July 6, 1780; discharged Oct. 10. 1780; service, 3 mos. 
17 days, including 12 days (240 miles) travel home ; regiment raised in Essex 
Co. to reinforce Continental Army for 3 months.

SMITH, PHIXEAS, Granby (probably) . Captain of a company in Col. Porter s regt., 
which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 2 days; also, Captain 
of a Granby co., 4th Hampshire Co. regt. of Mass, militia; list of officers 
chosen in said regiment, as returned by Lieut. Col. R. Woodbridge and Maj. 
Josiah White to Col. Samuel Howe, dated South Hadley, March 16, 177(5 ; 
ordered in Council April 1, 1776, that said officers be commissioned ; reported 
commissioned April 1, 1776; also, Captain, Col. Ruggles Woodbridge s regt.: 
service, 4 days; company marched on the alarm at Bennington of Aug. 17, 
1777; also, communication dated Granby, Oct. 6, 1777, signed by said Smith, 
resigning his commission on account of his advanced age, which was upwards 
of threescore years, and his inability to properly perform the duties of his office : 
the communication appears on reverse of his original commission as Captain of 
8th co., Col. Samuel How s (4th Hampshire Co.) regt., dated Watertown, April 
1, 1776: ordered in Council Oct. 8, 1777, that the resignation be accepted, and 
on same date Col. Elisha Porter was directed to notify the 8th co. in his regi 
ment to make choice of a captain in the room of said Smith. 

SMITH, PHIXEAS (also given PHIXEAS, Jr.), Granby. Return of men raised to serve 
in the Continental Army from Capt. Smith s co., 4th Hampshire Co. regt., as 
returned by Lieut. Col. R. Woodbridge, dated South Hadley, May 28, 1777; 
enlisted for town of Granby ; joined Capt. Smith s co., Col. Marshall s regt.; 
also, list of men raised to serve in the Continental Army, as returned by Capt. 
Eleazer Warner, sworn to in Hampshire Co., April 6, 1779 ; residence, Granby ; 
engaged for town of Granby; joined Capt. Smith s co., Col. Marshall s regt. : 
term, 3 years; said Smith reported as having hired George Church to serve in 
his place. 

SMITH, PHINEAS, Lexington. Private, in a detachment from Lexington militia co. 
commanded by Capt. John Parker: service, 5 days ; detachment reported on 
command at Cambridge from May 6 to May 10, 1775, by order of Committee of 
Safety ; also, list of men who guarded the cannon at Lexington and thence to 
Cambridge ; warrant for pay allowed in Council April 26, 1776.

manded by Maj . Seth Bullard ; marched July 28, 1780 ; discharged Aug. 7, 1780 ;

SMITH, "ROAL." Private, Capt. Seth Murray s co., in a regiment commanded by 
Maj. Jonathan Clap; enlisted July 9, 1777; discharged Aug. 12, 1777; service, 
1 mo. 10 days, including travel (112 miles) home ; company marched on expe 
dition to Fort Edward and Mosses Creek. Roll sworn to in Hampshire Co.

coat dated Charlestown, Camp No. 3, Oct. 27, 1775.

SMITH, SAMUEL. Return of sentences by a general court-martial, Brig. St. Clair, 
President, appearing in a general order dated Headquarters, Ticonderoga. Oct. 
16, 1776, taken from Col. Ephraim Wheelock s Orderly Book ; said Smith tried 
011 charge of mutiny, found guilty, and sentenced to receive 39 lashes on the 
bare back and be imprisoned picking oakum for 1 week.

SMITH, SAMUEL. Private, Capt. Francis Stebbins s co., Col. David Mosley s regt. ; 
entered service June 12, 1782 ; discharged June 1(5, 1782 ; service, 3 days ; com 
pany raised for support of the government at Springfield and Northampton and 
part of it probably mounted. Roll sworn to at West Springfield. 

SMITH, SAMUEL. Petition dated Boston, Jan. 6, 1783, signed by Samuel Brown, in 
behalf of Isaiah Doane and others, of Boston, asking that said Smith be com 
missioned as commander of the brigantine " Mentor " (privateer) ; advised in 
Council Jan. 6, 1783, that a commission be issued. 

SMITH, SAMUEL. Return for Feb., 1783, of the sick belonging to 1st Mass, brigade 
in hospital at New Windsor. 

SMITH, SAMUEL. Capt. Samuel Fisher s co. ; marched March 3, 1781 ; discharged 
March 17, 1781; service, 15 days; company detached from 4th Suffolk Co. 
regt. by order of His Excellency John Hancock for service on a 40 days expe 
dition to Rhode Island under Maj. Gen. Lincoln; also, Private, Capt. Fisher s 
co., Col. Turner s regt. ; treasury pay roll dated March 20, 1783. 

SMITH, SAMUEL. List of prisoners to be returned in exchange for British prisoners 
sent to New York in the cartel "Favorite," as returned by Robert Pierpont,

changed for John Bird, Seaman.

changed for Joseph Lewis, Seaman.

Co. regt. of Mass, militia; list of officers [year not given]. 

SMITH, SAMUEL, Jr., Barre. Private, Capt. Benjamin Nye s co. ; enlisted Sept. 26, 
1777 ; discharged Oct. 18, 1777 ; service, 29 days, including travel (128 miles) 
home ; company marched under command of Maj . Jonas Wilder to reinforce 
Northern army for 30 days.

SMITH, SARGENT. 1st Lieutenant, ship " Sky Rocket" (privateer) ; petition dated 
Boston, June 9, 1779, signed by Nehemiah Somes, in behalf of Joseph Stan- 
wood and others, of Newburyport, asking that William Burk be commissioned 
as commander of said vessel ; ordered in Council June 9, 1779, that a commis 
sion be issued; also, 1st Lieutenant, schooner " Wasp " (privateer) ; petition 
dated Boston, Aug. 3, 1779, signed by Eben Parsons, of Newburyport, asking 
that Isaac Somes be commissioned as commander of said vessel ; ordered in 
Council Aug. 3, 1779, that a commission be issued ; also, petition dated Boston, 
Sept. 22, 1780, signed by Daniel Sargent, in behalf of himself and others, ask 
ing that said Smith be commissioned as commander of the schooner " Pea 
cock " (privateer) ; ordered in Council Sept. 22, 1780, that a commission be 
issued and that the naval officer of the port of Boston be directed to clear said 
schooner with fish on board for the West Indies, any embargo to the contrary 
notwithstanding; also, petition dated Boston, May 24, 1781, signed by Stephen 
Higginson, in behalf of himself and Daniel Sargent, of Boston, asking that 
said Smith be commissioned as commander of the ship " Robin Hood " (priva 
teer) ; advised in Council May 26, 1781, that a commission be issued. 

SMITH, SARSOST. Private, Capt. Job Woodbridge s co., Col. Brown s regt. ; entered 
service July 8, 1777 ; discharged July 21, 1777 ; service, 14 days ; company 
formed part of a detachment under Maj. Caleb Hide which marched from 
Stockbridge on the evacuation of Ticonderoga. 

SMITH, SELAH, Shelburne. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Conti 
nental Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, re 
turned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Maj. Peter Harwood, of 
6th Mass, regt., at Springfield, July 2, 1780; age, 18 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 5 in. ; 
complexion, light ; engaged for town of Shelburne ; arrived at Springfield 
June 29, 1780 ; marched to camp July 1, 1780, under command of Ensign Joseph 
Miller ; also, list of men raised for the 6 months service and returned by Brig. 
Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 
25, 1780; also, pay roll for 6 months men raised by the town of Shelburne for 
service in the Continental Army during 1780; marched June 29, 1780: dis 
charged Dec. 31, 1780; service, 6 mos. 12 days, including travel (200 miles) 
home.

SMITH, SIMEON (also given SIMON), Sandisfield. Drummer, Capt. Noah Allen s

field: engaged for town of Northampton (also given Sandisfield) : joined Capt.

given South) Kingston, R. I., to Rehoboth.

to at Arundel and certified at Falmouth.

Whitcomb s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted April 26, 1775 ;

Hill, Oct. 6, 1775; reported as having gone to Quebec Sept. 11, 1775. 

SMITH, THOMAS, Lexington. Capt. John Minot sco., Col. Dike s regt. ; pay abstract 
for mileage to and from Dorchester Heights and travel allowance home ; said 
Smith credited with mileage for 34 miles and travel allowance for 1 day ; war 
rant allowed in Council Nov. 30, 1776. 

SMITH, THOMAS, Lexington. Private, Capt. Jesse Wyman s co., Col. Josiah Whit 
ney s regt. ; arrived at destination May 10, 1777 ; discharged July 10, 1777, at 
Point Judith; service, 2 mos. 9 days, at Rhode Island, including 3 days (54 
miles) travel to place of destination and 5 days travel from place of discharge 
home ; company raised for 2 months.

turned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Col. Timothy Bigelow, at 
Springfield, Sept. 7, 1780; age, 29 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 7 in. ; complexion, fresh ; 
engaged for town of Lincoln ; arrived at Springfield Aug. 26, 1780 ; marched to 
camp Sept. 7, 1780, under command of Ensign Simonds ; also, list of men raised 
for the 6 months service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed 
muster in a return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780; also, pay roll for 

6 months men belonging to the town of Lincoln raised for service in the Con 
tinental Army during 1780; marched to camp July 22, 1780; discharged Oct. 
15, 1780; service, 3 mos. 3 days, including travel (200 miles) home. 

SMITH, WILLIAM, Marblehead. Private, Capt. William Blackler s (6th) co., Col. 
John Glover s (21st) regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted May 19,

1775 ; also, order for money in lieu of bounty coat dated Camp Cambridge, Dec.

John Fisk ; abstract for advance pay for 1 month, dated Salem, March 17, 1777 ;

1777 ; service, 5 mos. 9 days ; roll dated Boston ; also, same vessel and com 
mander; engaged July 31, 1777; discharged Oct. 16, 1777; roll dated Boston. 

SMITH, WILLIAM. Private, Capt. Enoch Noble s co. ; entered service Aug. 21, 
1777 ; discharged Oct. 21, 1777 ; service, 60 (also given 61) days ; enlistment, 3 
months ; company marched to Manchester, Vt., thence to Allington, thence to 
Stillwater, by order of Gen. Lincoln, joined Col. John Ashley s (Berkshire 
Co.) regt., and marched to Bolton s Rills [ ?] and there served until regularly 
discharged ; also, pay roll for same service certified at Sheffield. 

SMITH, WILLIAM. List of prisoners sent from Halifax to Boston in the cartel

saries; said Smith reported as Captain of Marines on board the " Tartar." 

SMITH, WILLIAM. Private, Capt. John Noyes s co., Col. Samuel Johnson s regt. ;

SMITH, WILLIAM. Corporal, Capt. Benjamin Adams s co., Col. Johnson s regt. ; 
enlisted Aug. 15, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 30, 1777; service, 4 mos., in Northern

SMITH, WILLIAM. Private, Capt. Thomas Lord s co., Col. Job Cushing s regt. ;

SMITH, WILLIAM. Lieutenant, Capt. Nicholas Crosby s co., Col. Samuel McCobb s

others, as exhibited by Committee on Claims in behalf of Massachusetts against 
the United States, Sept. 21, 1787.

charged Oct. 26, 1780 ; service, 4 mos. 2 days, including travel (220 miles) home.

SNELLING, ASA, Penobscot (also given Boston and Boxford) . List of men mustered

co., Lieut. Col. John Brooks s (7th) regt.; muster rolls for Jan.-May, 1781,

mand at West Point in Aug., 1781, under guard in Sept., 1781 ; also, list of men

1781, by regimental court-martial, Capt. Lincoln, President, on charge of steal 
ing a fowl and cabbage, or suffering it to be done when on guard ; sentenced to 
receive 50 lashes; 11 reported remitted ; also, muster rolls for Oct., 1781-Jan., 

1782, dated York Hutts ; reported on command at Newburgh in Oct. and Nov., 
1781 ; also, muster roll for Feb., 1782, dated Hutts and sworn to at West Point ;

Boston (also given Boxford) ; enlisted March -, 1779 (also given June -, 
1777, and May-, 1779, by Lieut. Curtis) ; enlistment, during war; reported a

month of May, 1782, with an account of clothing received between Nov. 1, 
1781, and May 31, 1782; also, Capt. Thorp s co., Lieut. Col. Brooks s regt.; 
list of men tried by courts-martial subsequent to Jan. 1, 1781 ; said Snelling 
tried April 30, 1782, by regimental court-martial, Capt. Lincoln, President, on 
charge of absence from roll call ; sentenced to 10 days fatigue duty ; tried again 
June 26, 1782, by regimental court-martial, Capt. Lincoln, President, on charge 
of absence from roll call ; sentenced to receive 39 lashes ; tried again March 
10 [year not given, probably 1783], by regimental court-martial, Capt. Coburn, 
President, on charge of absence from roll call ; sentenced to receive 40 lashes; 
tried again March 24 [year not given, probably 1783], by regimental court- 
martial, Capt. Coburn, President, on charge of absence from roll call; sen 
tenced to receive 50 lashes ; also, list of men who died or were discharged 
subsequent to Jan. 1, 1781; said Snelling discharged June 8, 1783, by Gen. 
Washington, term of enlistment having expired.

vateer), asking that said Snoden be commissioned as commander of said vessel 
in place of one William Morony who had been previously commissioned but 
who had been displaced after said vessel had put back for repairs, owing to the 
refusal of the crew to sail under his command again ; ordered in Council June 
4, 1777, that a commission be issued.

vice, 5 days; company probably belonged to Leicester; also, Capt. Josiah 
White s co., Col. Job Cushing s regt. ; entered service Sept. 5, 1777 ; discharged

SNOW, ASA, Becket. Private, Capt. Peter Porter s co., Col. Benjamin Simomls s 
(Berkshire Co.) regt. ; entered service April 26, 1777 ; discharged May 20, 1777 ; 
service, 25 days; company called out April 26, 1777, by order of Maj. Gen. 
Gates and marched to Saratoga ; also, list of men raised for the 6 months ser 
vice and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return 
dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780 ; also, pay roll for 6 months men raised by 
the town of Becket for service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; marched 
July 21, 1780; discharged Dec. 31, 1780; service, 5 mos. 16 days, including travel 
(100 miles) home. 

SNOW, " AVENTON," Holden. Private, Capt. John Cutler s co., Col. Luke Drury s 
regt. ; marched Aug. 20, 1781 ; joined regiment at "West Point Aug. 28, 1781 ; 
discharged Nov. 28, 1781 ; service, 3 mos. 17 days, including travel (175 miles) 
home ; residence, Holden ; engaged for town of Holden ; regiment raised for 
3 months. 

SNOW, BARNABAS. Private, Capt. Elijah Deming s co., Col. Ashley s (Berkshire 
Co.) regt.; entered service July 8, 1777; discharged July 21, 1777; service, 14 
clays; company called out by Maj. Gen. Schuyler and ordered to march to 
Fort Edward ; also, Capt. Zenas Wheeler s co., Col. John Ashley s (Berkshire 
Co.) regt. ; entered service July 21, 1777 ; discharged Aug. 15, 1777 ; service, 
26 days; company marched to Fort Edward, N. Y., and received pay at 
Albany. 

SNOW, BARNES (also given BARNICE, BERNICE, and BARNABAS) , Whately. List of

White; residence, Whately ; engaged for town of Whately ; joined Capt. Bart- 
lett s co., Col. Wesson s regt. ; term, 3 years ; also, Private, Lieut. Col. Millen s 
co., Col. James Wesson s (9th) regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for ser 
vice from March 1, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; also, (late) Capt. Samuel Bartlett s 
co., Col. Wesson s regt. ; return of men who were in camp on or before Aug. 
15, 1777, and who had not been absent subsequently except on furlough, etc. ; 
also, Lieut. Colonel s co., Col. Wesson s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts 
for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to March 7, 1780; also, Lieut. Col. Mellen s co., 
Col. Wesson s regt. ; return for clothing for the year 1780 ; reported discharged ; 
also, receipt dated Whately, May 6, 1781, for bounty paid said Snow by a class 
of the town of Whately to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 3 
years; also, descriptive list of men raised in Hampshire Co. to serve in the 
Continental Army, as returned by Noah Goodman, Superintendent; age, 24 
yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 10 in. : complexion, light ; occupation, blacksmith ; engaged 
for town of Whately ; engaged May 7, 1781 ; term, 3 years.

nental Army, agreeable to resolve of Dec. 2, 1780, as attested by James Wil 
liams, Superintendent for said county, dated Taunton; engaged for town of

Hall s co., 3d regt. ; age, 17 yrs. ; stature, 4 ft. 11 in. ; complexion, light; eyes, 
blue; hair, light; occupation, laborer; residence, Raynham; term, 3 years;

co., Lieut. Col. Calvin Smith s (6th) regt. ; return for wages for the year 1781 ; 
wages allowed said Snow from March 5, 1781, to Dec. 31, 1781, 9 mos. 27 days ; 
reported promoted to Fifer in May, 1781, reduced to Private in Aug., 1781; 
also, Capt. John K. Smith s co., Lieut. Col. Smith s regt. ; return for wages 
for the year 1782 ; wages allowed said Snow for 12 mos. 

SNOW, ELISHA. List of men mustered between Sept. 10, and Sept. 15, 1777, by 
James Hatch, Muster Master for Plymouth Co. ; Col. Cye s (Keyes s) regt. ; en 
listed by Capt. Sparrow; also, Capt. Edward Sparrow s co., Col. Danforth 
Keys s regt. ; enlisted Sept. 2, 1777; service to Dec. 31, 1777, 3 mos. 29 days,

pay roll dated North Kingston, Dec. 4, 1777 ; term, 6 months from July 1, 1777 ; 
also, same co. and regt. ; service from Dec. 1, 1777, to date of discharge, Jan. 2, 
1778, 1 mo. 2 days ; roll dated Providence. 

SNOW, ELISHA. Private, Capt. Joseph Parker s co., Col. Ebenezer Sproat s (Sprout s)

SNOW, ISAAC, Eastham. Private, Capt. Isaiah Higgins s co., Col. Thomas Mar 
shall s regt. ; return for mileage, advance pay for 1 month from June 6, 1776, 
etc., dated June 17, 1776; mileage from camp (95 miles) allowed said Snow; 
regiment stationed at Boston ; also, same co. and regt. ; entered service June 
6, 1776; service to Oct. 31, 1776, 4 mos. 26 days; also, same co. and regt. ; ser 
vice from Nov. 1, 1776, to time of discharge, 1 mo. ; also, Capt. Benjamin God 
frey s co., Col. Josiah Whitney s regt.; arrived at destination May 10, 1777; 
discharged July 10, 1777 ; service, 2 mos. 12 days, at Rhode Island, travel (12 
days) included ; 108 miles reported as distance from Eastham to place of desti 
nation ; roll dated Boston Neck, South Kingston. 

SNOW, ISAAC, Harpswell (also given Casco Bay) . Petition dated Sept. 13, 1776, 
signed by said Snow, of Harpswell, in behalf of himself and others, of Harps- 
well, Georgetown, and Brunswick, asking that he be commissioned as com 
mander of the schooner " America " (privateer) ; ordered in Council Sept. 13, 
1776, that a commission be issued ; also, 1st Lieutenant, schooner " America " 
(privateer) ; petition dated Boston, April 16, 1777, signed by Thomas Harris & 
Co., asking that Daniel McNeill be commissioned as commander of said vessel, 
lying in Boston harbor fitted out for a 4 months cruise and lately commanded 
by said Snow, of Casco Bay ; ordered in Council April 17, 1777, that a com 
mission be issued. 

SNOW, ISAAC, Haverhill. Lieutenant, Capt. Joseph Eaton s co. of militia, Col. 
Johnson s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Cambridge; 
service, 2| days ; also, 1st Lieutenant, Capt. Joseph Eaton s 14th (Haverhill) 
co., 4th Essex Co. regt. of Mass, militia; list of officers chosen by the several 
companies in said regiment, as returned by Samuel Johnson and others, field 
officers, dated Andover, March 26, 1776 ; ordered in Council April 3, 1776, that 
said officers be commissioned ; reported commissioned April 3, 1776 ; also, letter 
from said Snow to Col. Samuel Johnson, dated Haverhill, Jan. 31, 1780, stating 
that he had held for some time the position of Lieutenant, but had been prom 
ised by Col. "Whittier that he should be dismissed whenever he requested it, as 
otherwise he would not have accepted the office when chosen, and as he was 
desirous of leaving the service, asking that his resignation might be accepted ; 
certificate dated Andover, April 18, 1780, signed by Col. Johnson, certifies his 
consent to the resignation of said Snow ; ordered in Council April 25, 1780, 
that Col. Johnson, commanding the 4th Essex Co. regt. of Mass, militia, be 
directed to cause the 14th co. in said regiment to make choice of a 1st Lieu 
tenant in the room of said Snow. 

SNOW, ISAAC, Rochester. Private, Lieut. Seth Briggs s co. of militia, which marched 
on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 4 days.

Tupper s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 7, 1777, 
to March 29, 1779; residence, Barnstable; reported deserted March 29, 1779; 
also, Capt. Page s co., Col. Ebenezer Francis s regt. ; subsistence allowed from 
date of enlistment, Jan. 7 [1777], to time of arrival at Bennington; credited 
with 80 days allowance; the Captain and 1st Lieutenant to march April 1, 
1777, the rest to march March 12, 1777; also, Capt. Page s co., Col. Tupper s 
regt.; return dated Jan. 25, 1778; residence, Eastham; enlisted for town of 
Eastham ; mustered by Col. Barber, County Muster Master, and Col. Verrick, 
Continental Muster Master; also, Maj. William Lithgow s co., Col. Tupper s 
regt.; muster roll for March, 1779, dated West Point; enlisted Jan. 7, 1777; 
enlistment, during war.

Brooks s (7th) regt. ; muster roll for Feb. and March, 1781, dated West Point :

Capt. Jonathan Maynard s co., Lieut. Col. Brooks s regt. ; muster roll for July, 
1781; reported on command at Verplanck s Point ; also, muster roll for Aug., 
1781, sworn to at Peekskill ; reported on command at Verplanck s Point. 

SOLA, NATHAN, Haverhill. Pay roll for 6 months men belonging to the town of 
Haverhill raised for service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; marched 
June 29, 1780; discharged Dec. 8, 1780; service, 5 mos. 21 days. 

SOLACE, JOSEPH. Private, Capt. Daniel Winchester s co., Col. Ruggles Wood- 
bridge s regt. ; enlisted Aug. 17, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 29, 1777 ; service, 3 
mos. 21 days, with Northern army, including 8 days (152 miles) travel home ; 
also, Sergeant, Capt. Joshua Shaw s co., Col. Elisha Porter s (Hampshire 
Co.) regt.; engaged July 22, 1779; discharged Aug. 27, 1779; service, 1 mo. 
9 days, at New London, Conn., including 3^ days (65 miles) travel home; roll 
dated Monson. 

SOLANY, JOHN. Capt. Archelaus Towne s co., Col. Ebenezer Bridge s (27th) regt.; 
order for bounty coat endorsed " Nov r 20 " [1775]. 

SOLDEN, ADAM. List dated Boston, May -, 1778, returned by Jabez Hatch, Colonel 
of Boston regt., of men raised by the town of Boston to serve in the Continen 
tal Army for the term of 9 months, agreeable to resolve of April 20, 1778.

SOLE, ASA. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental Army for 
the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as received 
of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Springfield, July 

10, 1780; age, 28 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 7 in.; complexion, dark; engaged for 
town of Marshfield ; arrived at Springfield July 8, 1780 ; marched to camp July 
10, 1780, under command of Capt. Daniel Shays. 

SOLE, ASA. Capt. King s co., Lieut. Col. John Brooks s (7th) regt.; register of 
furloughs granted subsequent to Jan. 1, 1781 ; leave given said Sole by Gen. 
McD l (McDougal) Dec. 24, 1781, to go from West Point to Kingston to remain 
until April 1 [year not given] ; also, list of men who died or were discharged 
subsequent to Jan. 1, 1781 ; said Sole discharged June 15, 1783, by Gen. Wash 
ington ; reported as servant to an officer. 

SOLE, BILDAD, New Marlborough. List of men raised for the 6 months service and 
returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return dated 
Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780.

by Capt. E. Smith; enlistment, during war. 

SOLE, EPHRAIM, Plympton. Private, Capt. John Bradford s co., Col. Theophilus 
Cotton s regt. ; company return dated Oct. 7, 1775. 

SOLE, IVORY, Barre. Private, Capt. Benjamin Nye s co. ; enlisted Sept. 26, 1777 ; 
discharged Oct. 18, 1777 ; service, 29 days, including travel (128 miles) home ; 
company marched under command of Maj. Jonas Wilder to reinforce Northern 
army for 30 days. 

SOLE, JAMES, Plympton. Private, Capt. Calvin Curtis s co., Col. John Jacobs s

ment to expire Jan. 1, 1779.

leting, dated Watertown, Aug. 20, 1776 ; mileage for 160 miles allowed said 
Sole ; warrant drawn for amount of abstract stated to be for mileage to Dor 
chester Heights. 

SOLE, JOHN, Woolwich. Private, Capt. John Wiley s co., Col. Michael Jackson s 
regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for 1777-1779 [no wages credited to said 
Sole] ; reported deserted. 

SOLE, JOHN. 1st Lieutenant, Capt. George Rogers s 7th (North Yarmouth) co., 2d

from the militia in accordance with an order of the General Court to serve 
under Col. Reuben Fogg; company raised in North Yarmouth.

service, 13 days; also, company return [probably Oct., 1775]; age, 19 yrs. ; 
also, order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Dec. 11, 1775; 
also, Quarter Gunner, Capt. William Ellery s (1st Artillery) co. ; enlisted 
June 19, 1776; service to Sept. 30, 1776, 3 mos. 13 days; company stationed at 
Gloucester for defence of seacoast. 

SOMES, SAMUEL, Gloucester. Private, Capt. Barnabas Dodge s co., Lieut. Col. 
Loammi Baldwin s (late Col. Samuel Gerrish s) 38th regt. ; company return 
dated Camp at Chelsea, Oct. 2, 1775; also, Capt. Dodge s (6th) co., Col. 
Baldwin s regt. ; order for money in lieu of bounty coat dated Chelsea, Dec. 
27, 1775; regiment stationed at Chelsea; also, account of arms retained in the 
army from soldiers who were going to leave the service [year not given] ; also, 
list of recruits for the new establishment in Col. Baldwin s regt., approved by 
Brig. Gen. W. Heath in Camp at Cambridge, Dec. 30, 1775 ; Capt. Dodge s 
co.; also, Private, Capt. Dodge s co., Col. Baldwin s (26th) regt.; return of 
men who enlisted for 1 year from Dec. 31, 1775; also, same co. and regt. ; pay 
abstracts for Jan.-April, 1776; also, order on Col. Baldwin, payable to Capt. 
Dodge, dated New York, April 19, 1776, signed by said Somes, for money due 
for his gun which was " Stop d & priz the Last of Deem 1775; " also, Capt. 
Dodge s co., Col. Baldwin s regt. ; pay abstracts for May and June, 1776, dated 
Camp at New York; also, list of men belonging to the 26th regt. who agreed 
to tarry 6 weeks from the last of Dec., 1776, as returned by Col. Baldwin, 
dated Trenton, Jan. 1, 1777; also, (late) Capt. Dodge s co. commanded by 
Lieut. Ezekiel Cheever, Col. Baldwin s regt. ; pay abstract for travel allow 
ance, etc., for the year 1776 ; reported discharged 360 miles from home. 

SOMES, SAMUEL, Gloucester. Descriptive list of officers and crew of the ship

8, 1780; age, 26 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 8 in.; complexion, dark; residence, 
Gloucester.

SOPER, ALEXAXDER, Pembroke. 2d Lieutenant, Capt. Thomas Turner s co. of

service March 4, 1776; discharged March 8, 1776; service, 5 days; company 
marched from West Parish in Pembroke to Braintree on the alarm of March 

3, 1776, thence to Weymouth and was stationed there.

Army in 1780.

charged Sept. 13, 1778 ; service, 1 mo. 16 days ; company raised in Plymouth 
Co. and marched to Rhode Island.

John Glover s (21st) regt. ; company return [probably Oct., 1775] ; also, Capt.

1776, 7 mos. 24 days, in defence of seacoast.

of Maj. Gen. Lincoln to serve for 20 days from time of joining at headquarters 
and was discharged at Pawlet, 60 miles from home; also, Capt. Clark s co., 
Col. Powel s (Berkshire Co.) regt.; enlisted July 22, 1779; discharged Aug. 
26, 1779; service, 1 mo. 12 days, at New Haven, Conn., including 7 days (131 
miles) travel home ; also, Private, Col. Warner s regt. ; Continental Army pay 
accounts for service from Dec. 23, 1779, to Dec. 31, 1780; residence, Williams- 
town; also, return of officers and men belonging to Massachusetts in Col. 
Seth Warner s regt., dated Fort George, June 11, 1780; enlisted Dec. 23, 
1779 ; enlistment, during war.

dition.

probably stationed at Cape Ann for defence of seacoast.

SPARHAWK, NATHAN, Rutland District. Colonel, 7th Worcester Co. regt. ; list of 
tield officers of regiments of Worcester Co. militia proposed by Legislature 
Jan. 12, 1776; regiment raised in Rutland, Petersham, Hutchinson, Athol, 
Templeton, Winchendon, Royalston, and Huhhardston ; reported commissioned 
Feb. 7, 1776; also, Colonel, 7th Worcester Co. regt. of Mass, militia; return of 
officers chosen by the several companies in said regiment, signed by said Spar- 
hawk and others, field officers, dated Petersham, March 2-4, 1776; also, return 
of officers chosen by the llth and 12th cos. in said Sparhawk s regiment, signed 
by him as Colonel and by Jonathan Grout, Lieutenant Colonel, dated Rutland 
District, July 5, 1776 ; also, Colonel of a regiment which marched to rein 
force army under Gen. Stark at Bennington Aug. 21, 1777; service, 10 days; 
also, Colonel ; service from Sept. 11 to Dec. 11 [year not given, probably 1778], 
3 mos. 7 days, near Boston, including time to return home ; also, petition 
addressed to the General Court, dated Boston, Jan. 26, 1779, signed by said 
Sparhawk, stating that he had served as Colonel of 7th Worcester Co. regt. 
iipwards of five years, and during that time had undergone without reluctance 
a great deal of fatigue and hardship in the performance of the duties of his 
position, but inasmuch as he felt obliged to give his attention to his domestic 
affairs and to prosecute the settlement of the estate of his late deceased 
brother, asking that he be permitted to resign his commission ; ordered in 
Council Jan. 28, 1779, that the resignation be accepted. 

SPARHAWK, NOAH. Private, Capt. Stephen Dana s co., Col. Samuel Thatcher s 
regt.; service, 5 days ; company marched to Roxbury March 4, 1776 ; roll sworn 
to in Middlesex Co.; also, Capt. John Walton s co., Col. Brooks s regt.; en 
listed Sept. 27, 1776 ; discharged Nov. 16, 1776 ; service, 2 mos. 1 day, including 
11 days (223 miles) travel home ; roll dated North Castle. 

SPARHAWK, NOAH. Quarter Master, Col. Job Cushing s regt., Gen. Warner s bri 
gade ; engaged July 28, 1777 ; discharged Aug. 29, 1777 ; service, 1 mo. 6 days, 
on an alarm at Bennington, including 5 days (100 miles) travel home. Roll 
dated Shrewsbury.

regt. ; service from July 31, 1778, to date of discharge, Sept. 14, 1778, 1 mo. 15

Petersham.

SPARKS, EBENEZER. Descriptive list of men raised in Worcester Co. to serve in the

Washburn, Superintendent for said county, June 12[?], 1781; age, 24 yrs. ; 
stature, 5 ft. 10 in. ; complexion, dark; occupation, farmer; engaged for town 
of Athol ; engaged March 15, 1781 ; term, 6 months. 

SPARKS, EBEXEZER. Private, Capt. Lebbeus Drew s co., Col. William Shepard s 
(4th) regt.: muster roll for Oct. and Nov., 1781, dated York Hutts: enlisted 
Sept. 22, 1781 ; enlistment, 6 months ; reported joined Oct. 15, 1781, deserted 
Dec. 6, 1781. 

SPARKS, HENRY. Private, Lieut. Daniel Brown s co., Col. Benjamin Simonds s

SPAULDING, BENONI. Private, Capt. Edward Farmer s co., Col. Jacob Garish s

SPAULDING, DANIEL, Townsend. Private, in a detachment from Townsend co. of 
militia, Col. James Prescott s regt., which marched April 20, 1775, in response 
to the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Cambridge under command of Lieut. Daniel 
Sherwin; discharged April 23, 1775; service, 5 days; also, Capt. Henry Far- 
well s (1st) co., Col. William Prescott s (10th) regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 
1, 1775; enlisted April 25, 1775; service, 98 days; also, company return [prob 
ably Oct., 1775] ; reported enlisted April 19, 1775 ; also reported sick at home ; 
also, petition dated Townsend, March 4, 1776, signed by Eleazer Spaulding, 
stating that his son, said Daniel Spaulding, had lost a gun at the battle of 
Bunker Hill which had been provided by the said Eleazer Spaulding, and 
requesting that $8, the value of the gun lost, and $1 additional, w r hich was 
deducted from the wages of said Daniel Spaulding for the use of a gun later 
issued to him, might be allowed as compensation ; certificate appended dated 
March 4, 1776, signed by Lieut. Levi Whitney, certifies that Daniel Spaulding 
was a soldier in Capt. FarwelFs co., Col. Prescott s regt., and had lost a gun 
during the battle at Bunker Hill which was worth at least $8, as was claimed 
by the petitioner.

regt. ; enlisted Sept. 10, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 29, 1777 ; service, 2 mos. 19 
days, with Northern army ; company marched to Saratoga. Roll dated Lit 
tleton.

on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 11 days. Roll endorsed " L t Benj 
Walkers Roll."

days ; company detached from militia by order of Gen. Hancock to man forts 
at and about Boston until Nov. 10, 1779, and stationed at Boston under Maj. 
Nathaniel Heath.

of Townsend for service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; marched July

included.

ordered part to Rhode Island and part to Fishkill ; regiment raised to rein 
force Continental Army for 3 months.

ber, Muster Master for Suffolk Co., dated Boston, July 7, 1777; Capt. Reed s 
co., Col. Alden s regt.; reported received State bounty; also, Sergeant, Capt.

vice from June 4, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; reported as serving 6 mos. as Private,

by a Continental Muster Master; also, Capt. Reed s co., (late) Col. Alden s 
regt. ; return of men who were in camp before Aug. 15, 1777, and who had not 
been absent subsequently except on furlough, etc., certified at Cherry Valley,

asking for additional wages ; petition endorsed " Leave to withdraw."

SPENCER, ARTHUR. Doctor, ship " Charming Sally," commanded by Capt. Alex 
ander Holmes ; list of officers, dated Boston ; vessel reported to have been in 
service from July 13, 1779, to Aug. 28, 1779, with a complement of 19 officers 
and 70 seamen and marines ; 30 artillery-men reported taken on board at Penob- 
scot Aug. 12, 1779, and continued on board until Aug. 28, 1779. 

SPENCER, CHARLES. Private, Capt. Samuel Low s co., Col. Benjamin Simonds s

as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Spring 
field, July 9, 1780 ; age, 28 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 7 in. ; complexion, light ; engaged 
for town of Newburyport; arrived at Springfield July 8, 1780; marched to 
camp July 9, 1780, under command of Lieut. Jackson, of the artillery.

1780 ; discharged Oct. 28, 1780 ; service, 3 days ; company marched to North 
ern frontiers by order of Gen. Fellows on an alarm.

SPENCER, JOSEPH. General order dated Headquarters, Cambridge, July 22, 1775, 
making disposition of the forces about Boston, and dividing the army into 
3 grand divisions to consist of 2 brigades each : said Spencer, Brigadier General, 
assigned to the command of a brigade, which with the brigade commanded by 
Brig. Gen. Thomas was to form the right wing of the army under Maj. Gen. 
Ward and to be stationed at Roxbury ; also, copy of a list of men who served 
in Oct., 1777, at request of said Gen. Spencer 011 an alarm.

SPENCER, WILLIAM, Williamstown. Private, Capt. Samuel Sloane s co. of Minute- 
men, which marched in response to the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; enlisted April 
22,1775; service, 14 days ; company discharged May 5, 1775 ; also, Capt. Samuel 
Sloan s co., Col. John Patterson s (26th) regt.; order for advance pay, signed

Private, same co. and regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted May 5,

regt.; entered service June 30, 1777; discharged July 26, 1777; service, 27 
days; company called out by Brig. Gen. Fellows at request of Maj. Gen. 
Schuyler and ordered to march to Fort Ann ; 15 men of said company joined 
Col. Ashley s regt.; also, same co. and regt.; entered service Aug. 14, 1777; 
discharged Aug. 21, 1777 ; service, 8 days ; company took part in battle of 
Wallumsick near Bennington Aug. 16, 1777, and later convoyed provisions to 
Pittsfield.

Phillipsburgh ; reported at West Point ; also, muster roll for Aug., 1781, sworn 
to at Peekskill; reported at West Point; also, muster roll for Sept., 1781, 
dated Camp Continental Village; also, muster roll for Oct. and Nov., 1781, 
dated York Hutts; reported transferred Oct. 19, 1781; also, Drummer, Capt. 
John Fuller s co., Col. Shepard s regt. ; muster rolls for Oct., Nov., and Dec.,

1782, dated York Hutts and sworn to in Garrison West Point.

miles) allowed.

SPINK, JOB. Private, in a detachment from Capt. Ezekiel Hearick s co., Col. John 
Ashley s (Berkshire Co.) regt., Brig. Gen. Fellows s brigade; entered service 
Sept. 22, 1777; discharged Oct. 18, 1777; service, 27 days; detachment ordered 
out at request of Maj. Gen. Gates to reinforce Northern army ; roll certified at 
Tyringham ; also, Capt. Elijah Deming s detachment from Col. Ashley s regt. ; 
entered service June 4, 1778; discharged July 15, 1778; service, 41 days; 
detachment ordered to Albany by Gen. John Fellows. 

SPINK, NICHOLAS. Corporal, Capt. Elijah Lewis s co., Col. Christopher Greene s 
(1st Rhode Island) battalion; muster rolls for Jan.-April, 1778; reported on 
General s guard in Jan. and Feb., 1778, on command at Ratney in April, 1778; 
also, Sergeant, same co. and battalion; muster rolls for Sept., 1778-Feb., 1779; 
engaged May 1, 1778 ; term, 3 years (also given during war) ; also, same co. 
and battalion ; muster roll for March, 1779, dated East Greenwich ; also, Capt. 
Lewis s (2d) co., Col. Greene s battalion; muster roll for April, 1779, dated 
East Greenwich ; also, Capt. Lewis s (3d) co., Col. Greene s battalion ; muster 
rolls for July, Aug., and Oct., 1779, dated East Greenwich ; reported a prisoner 
at Newport in July and Aug., 1779, a prisoner in Oct., 1779. 

SPINK, ROBERT. Private, Lieut. Joseph Willson s detachment from Capt. Ezekiel 
Hearick s co., Col. John Ashley, Jr. s (Berkshire Co.) regt.; entered service

shire Co.) regt. ; entered service July 22, 1777; discharged Aug. 14, 1777; ser 
vice, 24 days; company marched to Kingsbury by order of Brig. Gen. John 
Fellows; roll sworn to at Tyringham; also, pay roll of a detachment from 
Capt. Ezekiel Hearick s co., Col. John Ashley s (Berkshire Co.) regt., Brig. 
Gen. Fellows s brigade ; entered service Sept. 22, 1777 ; discharged Oct. 18, 
1777: service, 27 days; detachment ordered out at request of Maj. Gen. Gates 
to reinforce Northern army ; roll certified at Tyringham. 

SPINKE, ELDRED. Private; copy of a company receipt, given to Capt. Squire Mil- 
lard, dated Warwick, for wages and billeting for service for 1 day on an alarm 
Nov. 21, 1776.

also reported as entitled to share in the brig " Tryall " if made a prize; roll 
dated Boston.

the last of Aug., 1777, had made up the pay roll for service of the men in

field and delivered to Col. William Shepard ; age, 48 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 2f in. ; 
complexion, light; occupation, carpenter; engaged for town of Dartmouth; 
term, 3 years; also, Private, Capt. Sylvanus Smith s co., Col. Rufus Putnam s 
(5th) regt. ; muster rolls for April and May, 1781, dated West Point; enlisted 
April 2, 1781 ; reported an artificer in April, 1781 ; also, muster rolls for June 
and July, 1781, dated Camp near Dobbs s Ferry ; reported on command at West 
Point; also, muster roll for Aug., 1781, dated Camp Peekskill ; reported on 
command at West Point; also, muster rolls for Sept., 1781-Feb., 1782, dated 
Garrison West Point; reported artificer for the garrison in Sept., 1781; also, 
Capt. Smith s (1st) co., Col. Putnam s regt. ; muster roll for March, 1782; re 
ported died March 6, 1782. 

SPOONER, DAVID, Dartmouth. List of men who marched from Dartmouth to camp 
under command of Capt. Benjamin Dillingham and arrived there Feb. 15, 
1776; also, Private, Capt. Dillingham s co. ; enlisted April 16, 1776; service, 
7 mos. 12 days ; company stationed at Dartmouth for defence of seacoast ; also, 
Capt. Benjamin Lawrance s co. Col. George Williams s regt. ; service, 1 mo., 
on a secret expedition, to Rhode Island in 1777 ; also, Matross, Capt. Timothy 
Ingraham s co. ; service between March 1, 1778, and May 1, 1778, 22 days; 
company stationed at the fort at Dartmouth ; also, descriptive list of men 
raised in Bristol Co. for the term of 9 months from the time of their arrival at 
Fishkill, agreeable to resolve of April 20, 1778; Capt. Crandon s co. ; age, 20 
yrs.; stature, 6 ft. 2 in.; complexion, light; residence, Dartmouth; engaged 
for town of Dartmouth ; arrived at Fishkill July 23, 1778 ; reported not 
mustered.

for Continental service probably from Capt. Goodrich s co. ; residence, Noble- 
town ; engaged for town of Great Barrington ; joined Capt. Bartlett s co., Col. 
Weston s (Wesson s) regt. ; term, 3 years ; also, list of men mustered between 
Jan. 20, 1777, and June 1, 1778, by Truman Wheler, Muster Master for Berk

Mellin s co., Col. Wesson s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service 
from May 1, 1777, to Dec. 31. 1779 ; also, Capt. Samuel Bartlett s co., Col. James 
Wesson s regt.; return [year not given]; residence, Great Barrington; note 
on reverse of return states that said Spoor and others belonged to the disputed 
territory between the Massachusetts and New York governments and had 
been enlisted for the towns of Sheffield and Great Barrington by order of Gen. 
Fellows; also, Lieut. Colonel s co., Col. Wesson s regt.; Continental Army 
pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to May 1, 1780.

IX THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 743 

SPOOR, DAVID. Private, Capt. Enoch Noble s co., Col. John Ashley s (Berkshire 
Co.) regt. ; entered service Aug. 1, 1777; discharged Aug. 20, 1777; service, 20 
days ; company marched to Bennington hy order of Brig. Gen. Fellows and 
Committee of Safety at request of Gen. Stark. Roll certified at Sheffield. 

SPOOK, DERICK. Private, Capt. John King s CO., Col. Hopkins s (Berkshire Co.) 
regt. ; entered service July 15, 1776 ; discharged July 31, 1776 ; service, 16 days ; 
company marched by order of Brig. Gen. Fellows; also, pay roll of a detach 
ment from Capt. William Fellows s co. of matrosses, Gen. Fellows s (Berk 
shire Co.) brigade ; entered service July 9, 1777 ; discharged July 29, 1777 ; 
service, 20 days; detachment marched to Kingsbury, N. Y., 110 miles from 
home: roll dated Sheffield; also, Capt. John Spoor s co., Col. John Ashley, 
Jr. s regt. ; entered service Oct. 12, 1781 ; discharged Oct. 23, 1781 ; service, 11 
days ; company ordered to march to Barnes s Heiths in Stillwater on an alarm. 

SPOOR, ISAAC. Private, in a detachment from Capt. William Fellows s co. of 
matrosses, Gen. Fellows s (Berkshire Co.) brigade; entered service July 3, 
1777 ; discharged July 20, 1777 ; service, 17 days ; detachment marched to 
Kingsbury, N. Y., 110 miles from home; roll dated Sheffield; also, payroll 
of a detachment from Capt. Fellows s co. of matrosses commanded by Lieut. 
Paul Dewey, Brig. Gen. John Fellows s (Berkshire Co.) brigade; entered ser 
vice Sept. 21, 1777; discharged Oct. 9, 1777; service, 18 days; detachment 
ordered out by Brig. Gen. Fellows to serve under Maj. Gen. Gates in Northern 
department ; also, Capt. Fellows s co. of matrosses, Col. John Ashley s (Berk 
shire Co.) brigade ; enlisted Oct. 15, 1780 ; discharged Oct. 17, 1780 ; service, 
4 days ; company marched to the Northward on an alarm at the time Forts 
Ann and George were taken by the enemy [name appears as Isaac Spurr 
on a duplicate roll]. 

SPOOR, JOHN, Great Barrington (also given Sheffield). Private, Capt. William 
King s (1st) co., Col. John Fellows s (8th) regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 
1775 ; enlisted May 18, 1775 ; service, 2 mos. 18 days ; also, company return 
dated Dorchester, Oct. 7, 1775; also, order for bounty coat dated Dorchester 
Camp, Nov. 17, 1775; also, Private, Capt. Noah Allen s (late Capt. Moses 
Soul s) co., Col. Asa Whitcomb s regt.; muster roll dated Camp at Ticon- 
deroga, Nov. 27, 1776; enlisted Nov. 18, 1775; reported re-enlisted Nov. 14, 
1776, as Private in Capt. Allen s co., Col. Wigglesworth s regt. ; also, list of 
men raised for Continental service probably from Capt. Goodrich s co. ; resi 
dence, Great Barrington ; engaged for town of Great Barrington ; joined Capt. 
Allen s co., Col. Wigglesworth s regt.; term, during war; also, list of men 
mustered between Jan. 20, 1777, and June 1, 1778, by Truman Wheler, Muster 
Master for Berkshire Co. ; Capt. Allen s co., Col. Wigglesworth s regt. ; also, 
Private, Capt. Noah Allen s co., Col. Calvin Smith s (late Wigglesworth s) 
regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to June 
28, 1778; reported died June 28, 1778; also, Capt. Allen s co., Col. Edward 
Wiggelsworth s (4th) regt. ; return [year not given] ; residence, Sheffield : en 
gaged for town of Sheffield; mustered by Capt. Wheeler; also, same co. and 
regt. ; muster rolls for March and May, 1778, dated Camp at Valley Forge ; 
also, same co. and regt. ; muster roll for June, 1778, dated Camp Greenwich 
and sworn to at Camp Stamford ; reported died June 26, 1778.

Wesson s regt. ; return [year not given] ; note on reverse of return states that

SPOOR, JOHN. Captain, 2d co. (West co. in Sheffield), 1st Berkshire Co. regt, of

1777 ; discharged July 28, 1777 ; service, 22 days ; company marched to Kings-

entered service Oct. 12, 1781 ; discharged Oct. 23, 1781 ; service, 11 days; com 
pany ordered to march to Barnes s Heiths in Stillwater on an alarm.

SPORMAX, JOHX. Private, Maj. Nathaniel Heath s co. ; enlisted June 16, 1779 ; dis

Justin Ely, Esq., at Springfield; age, 44 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 6 in.; com 
plexion, light; hair, short and sandy; eyes, gray; reported detached from 
Capt. Belcher s co.

Anthony Burk; also, list of men returned as received of Justin Ely, Com 
missioner, by Capt. Christopher Marshall, at Springfield, July 16, 1779.

at Bristol, R. I., April 19, 1777.

co., Col. Asa Whitcomb s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted April 
26, 1775 ; service, 3 mos. 13 days.

regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Dec. 
31, 1779; reported invalided; also, Capt. Reuben Slayton s co., Col. Shepard s 
(3d) regt. ; return dated Valley Forge, Jan. 30, 1778 ; residence, Waltham ; 
enlisted for town of Waltham ; mustered by State and Continental Muster 
Masters ; also, same co. and regt. ; muster rolls for July, Aug., Oct., and Nov., 
1778, dated Providence ; reported wounded at Princeton on rolls for July, Aug., 
and Oct., 1778, wounded and in hospital on roll for Nov., 1778; also, Colonel s 
co., Col. Shepard s regt. ; muster roll for March and April, 1779, dated Provi 
dence ; enlisted Jan. 1, 1777 ; enlistment, during war ; also, Lieut. Osgood Carle-

SPRAGUE, CALEB. Private; pay roll of a detachment from Capt. Daniel Grout s 
co. commanded by Lieut. Thomas Parker, Col. John Rand s regt. ; enlisted 
July 24, 1780; discharged Oct. 9, 1780; service, 2 mos. 24 days, including 8 
days (160 miles) travel home ; regiment raised for 3 months, marched to Clav- 
erack, and was discharged at West Point.

and men belonging to Col. Lee s, Col. Henley s, and Col. Jackson s regts., and 
men belonging to Massachusetts in Col. Henry Sherburne s regt., who were 
incorporated into a regiment under the command of Col. Henry Jackson, agree 
able to the arrangement of April 9, 1779 ; rank, Private ; engaged Sept. 2, 1777 ; 
term, 3 years ; said Sprague appears among men belonging to Col. William R. 
Lee s regt. who had been discharged from the rolls prior to above arrangement ; 
reported died Feb. 28, 1778.

Metcalf , certifying that he had paid the sum of 6(3, lawful money, May 17, 1781, 
to Dr. John Sprague for his negro servant, said Cuff Sprague, who had volun 
tarily engaged to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 3 years for a 
class of the town of Dedham of which Dr. Sprague and said Metcalf were 
members.

SPRAGUE, HENRY. List of men who enlisted to serve for the term of 3 months for

SPRAGUE, HOSEA, Leicester. Matross, Capt. William Todd s (8th) co., Col. Thomas 
Crafts s (Artillery) regt. ; return for advance pay, mileage, etc., sworn to in 
Suffolk Co., Nov. 30, 1776; mileage for 53 miles allowed said Sprague; regi 
ment stationed at Boston ; also, same co. and regt. ; service from Feb. 1, to 
date of discharge, May 8 [year not given, probably 1777], 3 mos. 7 days; also, 
Private, Capt. David Prouty s co., Col. Job Cushing s (Worcester Co.) regt. ; 
marched July 27, 1777 ; discharged Aug. 28, 1777 ; service, 1 mo. 2 days ; com 
pany marched to reinforce Northern army by order of Gen. Worner (Warner) ;

reinforce Northern army under Gen. Gates ; also, list of 9 months men mus 
tered by Thomas Newhall, Muster Master for Worcester Co. ; Capt. Watson s 
co., Col. Denny s regt. ; engaged for town of Leicester ; mustered June 25, 1779 ;

term of 9 months, as returned by Seth Washbiirn, Superintendent for Worcester 
Co. ; Capt. William Wateson s co., Col. S. Danny s regt. ; age, 20 yrs. ; stature,

July 8, 1779; reported delivered to Capt. C. Marshall; also, Col. M. Jackson s 
(8th) regt. ; statement of Continental balances ; balance certified April 10, 
1786 ; term, 9 months ; also, descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Con 
tinental Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780 ; 
age, 21 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 7 in. ; complexion, dark ; engaged for town of 
Leicester ; arrived at Springfield July 5, 1780 ; marched to camp July 5, 1780, 
under command of Capt. Frothingham, of the artillery; also, pay roll for 6 
months men raised by the town of Leicester for service in the Continental 
Army during 1780 ; marched July 3, 1780 ; discharged at headquarters Jan. 5, 
1781 ; service, 6 mos. 11 days, including travel (180 miles) home ; also, Pri 
vate, Capt. Joshua Benson s (Light Infantry) co., Col. Rufus Putnam s (5th) 
regt. ; muster roll for Jan., 1781, dated Garrison at West Point; enlisted July 
5, 1780; discharged Jan. 5, 1781 ; enlistment, 6 months.

by Col. Benjamin Foster for defence of Machias and rivers adjacent when 
ship " Ambuscade " lay in the harbor.

Co.) regt.; service from Aug. 7, 1779, to Sept. 7, 1779,1 mo., on Penobscot 
expedition; company marched on expedition to Majorbagaduce Aug. 7, 1779, 
by order of Gen. Lovel.

(Berkshire Co.) regt.; engaged July 9, 1780; discharged Oct. 22, 1780; ser 
vice, 3 mos. 19 days, at Stone Arabia, N. Y., including 6 days (120 miles) 
travel home. 

SPRAGUE, JOHN. Lieutenant, in a detachment from Capt. Ezra Whipple s co. com 
manded by Lieut. William Peeters, Col. Simonds s regt. ; engaged Oct. 27, 
1780 ; discharged Oct. 29, 1780 ; service, 3 days, at the Northward on the alarm 
of Oct. 27, 1780; detachment marched to reinforce Gen. Allen. 

SPRAGUE, JOHN. Quarter Gunner, Capt. Lieut. William Burbeck s co. ; engaged

SPRAGUE, JOSEPH, Pembroke. Private, Capt. John Turner s co., Col. Theophilus 
Cotton s regt. ; marched Sept. 28, 1777 ; service, 1 mo. 3 days ; company marched 
to Rhode Island. 

SPRAGUE, JOSEPH. Official record of a ballot by the House of Representatives, 
dated Feb. 14, 177(5; said Sprague chosen 1st Major, Col. Timothy Pickering, 
Jr. s (1st Essex Co.) regt. of Mass, militia; appointment concurred in by 
Council Feb. 14, 1776; reported commissioned Feb. 14, 1776; also, resignation 
dated Salem, Feb. 18, 1778, addressed to the Council, signed by said Sprague, 
resigning his commission as Major of the 1st Essex Co. regiment because of 
his inability to longer fulfil the duties of his office with credit to himself or 
benefit to the country; resignation accepted in Council Feb. 21, 1778. 

SPRAGUE, JOSEPH. Seaman, brig "Hazard," commanded by Capt. John Foster 
Williams; engaged Dec. 2, 1778; discharged April 20, 1779; service, 4 mos. 
18 days. Roll dated Boston.

14, 1777, and fought in battle near Bennington Aug. 16, 1777.

co., Col. Ruggles Woodbridge s regt. ; enlisted Aug. 16, 1777 ; discharged Nov.

regiment raised to reinforce Continental Army at the Northward; also, 
account of cash paid by the Selectmen of Northampton to men who engaged 
to serve in the Continental Army or who were detached from militia at vari 
ous times, dated Northampton, Jan. 4, 177H [9] ; said Sprague appears among 
militia men who enlisted for 8 months ; mileage for 140 miles was allowed in 
the account to said men but was later crossed out ; also, order on Lieut. Potter, 
payable to Capt. Abner Pomeroy, dated Southampton, March 3, 1779, signed 
by said Sprague, for wages for service from Oct. 1 [1778], to the end of his

June -, 1779, is signed by Capt. Abner Pomeroy.
