Nov. 21, 1775. 

SPRAGUE, THOMAS, Stoneham. Private, (late) Capt. Isaac Hall s co., Lieut. Col. 
William Bond s (late Col. Thomas Gardner s) 37th regt. ; company retuni dated 
Camp Prospect Hill, Oct. 6, 1775 ; also, (late) Capt. Hall s co. commanded by 
Lieut. Caleb Brooks, Lieut. Col. Bond s regt. ; order for money in lieu of bounty 
coat dated Prospect Hill, Dec. 29, 1775. 

SPRAGUE, THOMAS. (Late) Capt. Elias Whiton s co., Col. Symms s regt. ; entered 
service March 9, 1778; discharged June 9, 1778; service, 3 mos., with guards 
at Boston. 

SPRAGUE, THOMAS. Sergeant, Capt. Francis Wilson s co., Col. Samuel Denny s 
regt. ; engaged Oct. 21, 1779; discharged Nov. 23, 1779; service, 1 mo. 11 days, 
at Claverack, including 7 days (150 miles) travel home ; regiment raised to 
reinforce Continental Army in state of New York for 3 months. 

SPRAGUE, TIMOTHY, Leicester. 2d Bombardier, Capt. David Henshaw s co., Col. 
Thomas Crafts s regt. ; retuni for advance pay, mileage from home to camp, 
etc., sworn to at Boston, Dec. 7, 1776 ; mileage for 53 miles allowed said Sprague ; 
also, Bombardier, Capt. Henshaw s (10th) co., Col. Crafts s (Artillery) regt. ; 
joined regiment Nov. 25, 1776 ; service to Feb. 1, 1777, 2 mos. 5 days ; roll sworn 
to in Suffolk Co. ; also, Sergeant, Capt. Loring Lincoln s co., which marched 
under command of Lieut. Col. Flagg on the alarm at Bennington in 1777 ; ser 
vice, 5 days ; company probably belonged to Leicester. 

SPRAGUE, TIMOTHY. List of 6 months men raised agreeable to resolve of June 5, 
1780, returned as received of Maj. Joseph Hosmer, Superintendent for Mid 
dlesex Co., by Justin Ely, Commissioner, dated Springfield; also, descriptive 
list of men raised to reinforce the Continental Army for the term of 6 months, 
agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as received of Justin Ely, Com 
missioner, by Maj. Peter Harwoo d, of 6th Mass, regt., at Springfield, July 2, 
1780; age, 17 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 5 in. ; complexion, light; engaged for town of 
Concord; arrived at Springfield July 1, 1780; marched to camp July 2, 1780, 
under command of Capt. Phineas Parker ; also, pay roll for 6 months men 
raised by the town of Concord for service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; 
marched June 26, 1780: discharged Dec. 5, 1780; service, 5 mos. 20 days, in 
cluding travel (200 miles) home ; also, receipt dated Concord, June 6, 1781, for 
bounty paid said Sprague by Maj. Joseph Hosmer, Chairman of a class of the 
town of Concord, to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 3 years. 



764: MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 

SPRAGUE, URIAH, Duxbury. Private, Capt. Andrew Samson s co. ; return dated 
May 20, 1777; reported mustered by G. Partridge, Muster Master; company 
stationed at the fort at the Gurnet; also, Capt. Nehemiah Allen s co., Col. 
Theophilus Cotten s regt. ; service, 33 days, on a secret expedition to Rhode 
Island in Sept. and Oct., 1777; also, Corporal, Capt. Calvin Partridge s co., 
Col. Josiah Whitney s regt. ; marched July 30, 1778 ; discharged Sept. 13, 1778 ; 
service 1 mo. 15 days, at Rhode Island ; company raised in Plymouth Co. 

SPRAGUE, WILLIAM, Abington. Private, Capt. William Reed s co., Gen. John 
Thomas s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted April 27, 1775 ; ser 
vice, 3 mos., 1 week, 5 days; also, company return dated Camp at Roxbury, 
Oct. 6, 1775. 

SPRAGUE, WILLIAM, Georgetown. 1st Lieutenant, Capt. James McCobb, Jr. s (4th) 
co., 1st Lincoln Co. regt. of Mass, militia; list of officers chosen by the several 
companies in said regiment, as returned by Dummer Sewall and others ; ordered 
in Council July 1, 1776, that said officers be commissioned; reported commis 
sioned July 1, 1776; also, 1st Lieutenant, Capt. James McCobb s (4th) co., Col. 
Samuel McCobb s (Lincoln Co.) regt. ; regimental return made by Lieut. Col. 
Dummer Sewall, dated Georgetown, Nov. 19, 1779; residence, Georgetown; 
commissioned July 1, 1776. 

SPRAGUE, WILLIAM, Maiden. Private, Capt. Benjamin Blaney s co. of militia, 
which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Watertown by order of Col. 
Gardner; service, 1 day; also, Capt. Nailer Hatch s co., Lieut. Col. William 
Bond s (late Col. Thomas Gardner s) 37th regt. ; company return dated Maiden, 
Oct. 6, 1775 ; also, pay roll of a company commanded by Capt. Benjamin Blaney , 
of Maiden ; marched June 13, 1776 ; service, 3 days ; company marched to Point 
Shirley by order of Gen. Lincoln ; also, Capt. John Walton s co., Col. Brooks s 
regt. ; company return dated Oct. 31, 1776 ; said Sprague reported as in camp and 
fit for duty ; also, same co. and regt. ; enlisted Sept. 27, 1776; discharged Nov. 
16, 1776 ; service, 2 mos. 1 day, including 11 days (228 miles) travel home ; roll 
dated North Castle; also, Capt. Stephen Dana s co., Col. Josiah Whitney s 
regt.; arrived at destination May 10, 1777; service, 2 mos. 7 days, including 
travel (7 days) to camp and from place of discharge home ; company raised to 
serve for 2 months at Rhode Island ; roll dated South Kingston. 

SPRAGUE, WILLIAM, Narraguagiis. Private, Capt. Francis Shaw, Jr. s co. ; enlisted 
Sept. 9, 1775 ; service, 4 mos. 1 day, in defence of seacoast ; company stationed at 
Gouldsborough, No. 4, Narraguagus, and Pleasant River; also, Lieut. Thomas 
Parrat s detachment ; enlisted June 25, 1777 ; discharged June 30, 1777 ; ser 
vice, 6 days, at Machias; detachment drafted from militia; roll sworn to at 
No. 4; also, pay roll of a detachment under Lieut. John Bohannan belonging 
to Col. Foster s (Lincoln Co.) regt. ; entered service Dec. 19, 1778; discharged 
Dec. 21, 1778 ; service, 3 days ; detachment called out by Lieut. Col. Campbell 
in defence of State stores on board the " Merry Sheet," from Boston, bound to 
garrison at Machias; also, Capt. Timothy Heald s co., Col. Samuel McCobb s 
regt. ; entered service June 30, 1779; discharged Sept. 25, 1779; service, 2 mos. 
27 days, on Penobscot expedition. 

SPRAGUE, WILLIAM, Waltham. Private, Capt. Abijah Child s co., Col. Thomas 
Gardner s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted April 29, 1775 ; ser 
vice, 94 days.

Briant s co., Col. Crane s regt.; pay rolls for Jan.-Sept., 1777; enlistment, 3

regt., Gen. Cushing s brigade; service, 2 weeks 1 day; company marched 
from Abington to Bristol, 11. I., Dec. 9, 1776, on an alarm. 

SPRAGUE, WILLIAM. Private, 1st division, Capt. Squire Millerd s co., Col. Water 
man s regt. ; service between April 6, and April 20, 1777, 12 days.

SPRAGUE, WILLIAM. Seaman, brigantine "Massachusetts," commanded by Capt. 
John Lambert: engaged Jan. 3, 1778. Roll made up for advance pay for 
1 month and sworn to in Suffolk Co. 

SPRAGUE, WILLIAM. Private, Capt. Edward Cobb s co., Maj. Eliphalet Gary s 
regt. : marched July 30, 1780; discharged Aug. 1, 1780: service, 3 days; com 
pany marched from Abington to Tiverton, R. I., July 30, 1780, on an alarm. 

SPRAGUE, WILLIAM. Letter from Samuel Dow to James Perkins, dated Boston, 
Jan. 15, 1786, in behalf of himself, said Sprague, and others, stating that they 
had been employed as blacksmiths in the Quarter Master s department at 
Boston from early in 1776 to Jan. 1, 1778, when owing to depreciation of money 
their wages were insufficient, whereupon they applied to Col. Chase, Deputy 
Quartermaster General, for 9 specie per month, or its equivalent, as wages, 
but as they failed to receive any increased allowance, they applied to Gen. 
Heath, who promised to write to Gen. Pickering and secure the advance re 
quested; they remained continuously in service until Sept., 1780, their pay 
remaining unchanged until March 1, 1780, when they were allowed 9 per 
month in specie notes ; the claim for the extra allowance asked for was 
apparently not granted, as the foregoing letter was read in Continental Con 
gress and returned to said Dow without action, and two endorsements bearing 
dates Boston, Oct. 15, 1788, and Sept. 27, 1790, show that the grievance of the 
claimants was not redressed at the respective dates. 

SPRAGUE, WILLIAM, Jr., Abington. Private, Capt. Edward Cobb s co. of militia, 
Col. Edward Mitchell s regt., which marched April 20, 1775, in response to 
the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Marshfield ; service, 3 days. 

SPRAGUE, ZEBADIAH. Private, Capt. Asa Barns s (1st) co., Col. Israel Chapen a 
(3d) regt.: enlisted Oct. 18, 1779; discharged Nov. 21, 1779; service, 1 mo. 8 
days, at Claverack, including 3 days (60 miles) travel home ; regiment raised 
to reinforce Continental Army for 3 months. 

SPRAGUE, ZERAH (also given TERAH), Township No. 4. Private, Capt. Henry 
Dyer s detachment from Col. Benjamin Foster s (Lincoln Co.) regt. ; entered 
service Sept. 27, 1777: discharged Oct. 5, 1777: service, 8 days: company 
marched to Machias at sundry times when British ships lay in that harbor. 

SPRAIGE, LABAN. Petition dated Camp at Hull, Sept. 17, 1776, signed by said 
Spraige and others belonging to battalion stationed at Hull, asking for increase 
and payment of wages.

SPRING, JOHN. Seaman, sloop " Winthrop," commanded by Capt. George Little;

had received 30, legal money, of Cadwallader Ford, Jr., as a bounty given

regt., for the term of 3 years to the credit of the town of Wilmington, and in

SPRING, SAMUEL, Newton. Fifer, Capt. Amariah Fuller s (Newton) co., Col.

SPROUT, ALEXANDER. Descriptive list of officers and crew of the ship " Franklin," 
commanded by Capt. John Turner, dated Salem, Dec. 2, 1780; age, 16 yrs. ; 
complexion, light ; birthplace, Salem ; cruise reported to have begun Aug. 8, 
1780. 

SPROUT. EBENEZER, Hardwick. Private, Capt. Simeon Hazeltine s (5th) co., Col. 
John Fellows s (8th) regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted May 2, 
1775 ; service, 3 mos. 7 days ; also, company return dated Oct. 7, 1775. 



IX THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 777 

SPROUT, EBEXEZER (also given EBEXEZER, Jr.), Middleborough. Order dated in 
Provincial Congress, May 27, 1775, signed by Samuel Freeman, Secretary 
pro teni, directing that commissions be delivered said Sprout, Major, and 
Ichabod Alden, Lieutenant Colonel, of Col. Theophilus Cotton s regt. ; also, 
Major, Col. Cotton s regt.; engaged April 23, 1775; service to Aug. 1, 1775, 
3 uios. 16 days; also, same regt. ; return of field and staff officers, dated Camp 
at Roxbury, Oct. 7, 1775; also, Lieutenant Colonel; Continental Army pay 
accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; also, letter from said 
Sprout, Lieutenant Colonel, to the President of the Board of War, dated Provi 
dence, Sept. 11, 1778, stating that he had been informed that provision had 
been made by a resolve of the General Court for providing the officers of the 
Mass. Line of the Continental Army with suits of clothing at moderate prices, 
and inasmuch as he had been absent from home for 18 months and had been 
unable to procure clothing except at exorbitant prices which he could not 
afford, requesting that his necessities might be considered and the clothing 
furnished; also, Lieutenant Colonel, Col. William Shepard s regt.; list of 
officers who were in need of clothing, dated Sept. 26, 1778 ; also, same regt. ; 
return for clothing delivered officers Oct. 7, 1778; also, Lieutenant Colonel 
and Captain, Col. Shepard s regt. ; muster roll of field, staff, and commissioned 
officers for March and April, 1779, dated Providence : appointed Nov. 1, 1776 ; 
also, Lieutenant Colonel, Col. Shepard s (3d) regt. ; return of field and staff 
officers who were in service on or before Aug. 15, 1777, etc. ; warrant for pay 
allowed in Council March 12, 1779; reported resigned; also, letter from Gen. 
Horatio Gates to Hon. Jeremiah Powell, dated Providence, June 16, 1779, 
stating that there were three vacancies for Colonels of the Mass. Line and 
recommending the appointment of said Sprout, Lieutenant Colonel, to the 
command of the regiment formerly commanded by Col. Wiggles worth ; also, 
Lieutenant Colonel and Captain, 13th Mass. regt. commanded by Maj. John 
Porter; return of officers for clothing, dated Camp at Lower Salem, Aug. 28, 
1779; also, Lieutenant Colonel Commandant, 12th Mass, regt.; list of settle 
ments of rank of Continental officers, dated West Point, made by a Board 
held for the purpose and confirmed by Congress Sept. 6, 1779 ; commissioned 
Sept. 29, 1778 ; also, Lieutenant Colonel Commandant, 12th Mass. regt. : Con 
tinental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780. to Dec. 31, 1780; 
also, return of officers belonging to (late) 12th Mass. regt. commanded by said 
Sprout, "now in actual service," dated Boston, Jan. 17, 1781. 

SPROUT, EBEXEZER. Lieutenant Colonel, Col. James Warren s (1st Plymouth Co.) 
regt. of Mass, militia; list of officers; commissioned Aug. 31, 1775; also, offi 
cial record of a ballot by the House of Representatives, dated Feb. 7, 1776 ; 
said Sprout chosen Colonel, 4th Plymouth Co. regt. of Mass, militia ; appoint 
ment concurred in by Council Feb. 10, 1776 ; reported commissioned Feb. 10, 
1776. 

SPROUT, EBEXEZER. Company receipt for ammunition, given to Capt. Barnabas 
Sears, dated Dorchester Camp, Feb. 15, 1776. 

SPROUT, EBEXEZER. Private, Capt. Xoah Allen s (late Capt. Moses Soul s) co., 
Col. Asa Whitcomb s regt. : muster roll dated Camp at Ticonderoga, Nov. 24, 
1776; enlisted Nov. 25, 1775; reported discharged Oct. 29, 1776. 

SPROUT, JAMES, Middleborough. Private, Capt. Nehemiah Allen s co., Col. The 
ophilus Gotten s regt. ; service, 31 days, on a secret expedition to Rhode Island 
in Sept. and Oct., 1777. 

SPROUT, JAMES. Private, Capt. Perez Churchill s co., Col. John Dogged s (Dag- 
gett s) regt. : entered service Aug. 24, 1778; discharged Sept. 2, 1778; service, 
9 days, at Rhode Island. Roll sworn to at Middleborough.

SPROUT, JAMES. Private, Capt. Henry Pierce s co., Col. Theophilus Cotton s regt. ; 
enlisted March 8, 1781 ; discharged March 31, 1781; service, 26 days, at Rhode 
Island, including travel (65 miles) out and home; company raised by order of 
His Excellency John Hancock to serve for 40 days, unless sooner discharged. 

SPROUT, JAMES, Paxton. Private, Capt. Phineas Moore s co. of Minute-men, Col. 
Ephraim Doolittle s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to 
Cambridge; service, 8 days; also, Capt. Adam Wheeler s co., Col. Ephraim 
Doolittle s regt. ; receipt for advance pay, signed by said Sprout and others, 
dated Charlestown Canip, July 13, 1775 ; also, Corporal, same co. and regt. ; 
company return dated Camp at Winter Hill, Oct. 6, 1775 ; also, list of 9 months 
men mustered by Thomas Newhall, Muster Master for Worcester Co. ; Capt. 
Maynard s co., Col. Denny s regt.; mustered July 2, 1779; also, descriptive 
list of men raised for Continental service, as returned by Seth Washburn, 
Superintendent for Worcester Co. ; Capt. Maynard s co., Col. Danny s regt.; 
age, 26 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 11 in. ; complexion, light ; engaged for town of 
Paxton; marched July 21, 1779; reported delivered to Ensign J. Hubble; 
also, Major s co., 13th Mass, regt.; entered service July 22, 1779; discharged 
April 22, 1780; term, 9 months. 

SPROUT, NATHAX, Hardwick. Receipt dated Hardwick, April 23, 1781, for bounties 
paid said Sprout and others by the town of Hardwick to serve in the Continen 
tal Army for the term of 6 months in 1780 ; also, descriptive list of men raised 
to reinforce the Continental Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to re 
solve of June 5, 1780, returned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by 
Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Springfield, July 7, 1780; age, 17 yrs.; stature, 

5 ft. 10 in. ; complexion, light ; engaged for town of Hardwick ; marched to 
camp July 7, 1780, under command of Capt. Dix; also, list of men raised for 
the 6 months service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed 
muster in a return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780 ; also, pay roll for 6 
months men raised by the town of Hardwick for service in the Continental 
Army during 1780; marched July 1, 1780; discharged Dec. 27, 1780; service, 

6 rnos. 3 days, in state of New York, including 9 days (180 miles) travel home.

John Fellows s (8th) regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted April 28,

ported sick at Hardwick.

1776; enlisted Dec. 22, 1775; reported sick in general hospital. 

SPROUT, ROBERT, Hardwick. Private, Capt. Samuel Billings s co., Col. Ebenezer 
Learned s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 4, 1775; service,

Hastings s co., Col. Rice s regt.; engaged for town of Hardwick; mustered

for Worcester Co. ; Lieut. Hastins s co., Col. Rice s regt. ; age, 25 yrs. ; stature,

(3d) regt. ; muster roll for Jan.- June, 1780; enlisted July 10, 1779; discharged 
April 10, 1780; enlistment, 9 months.

tree March 22, 1776 ; also, pay roll of a company in Col. Benjamin Gill s regt. ;

mand of Capt. Robert Swan, of Stoughton.

SPURR, JOHN. Captain, Col. Nixon s regt.; Continental Army pay accounts for 
service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; also, Captain, 3d co., Col. Nixon s 
(4th) regt. ; muster roll of field, staff, and commissioned officers, dated Van 
Schaick s Island, Sept. 2, 1777, and sworn to at Camp near Stillwater ; appointed 
Jan. 1, 1777 ; also, muster roll of field, staff, and commissioned officers for Nov. 
and Dec., 1777, dated Albany; also, pay abstracts for rations between June 11, 
1777, and Jan. 1, 1778, certified at Albany; credited with 166 days allowance;

3, 1778, to May 4, 1778 ; reported on command at King s Ferry ; also, return of 
officers for clothing ; receipt for said clothing, dated Boston, April 30, 1778 ; 
also, return of officers for clothing, certified at Boston, Nov. 24, 1778; also, re 
turn of men who were in camp on or before Aug. 15, 1777, and who had not been 
absent subsequently except on furlough, etc., certified at Camp near Peekskill, 
Feb. 16, 1779; also, Col. Nixon s (5th) regt.; muster roll for May, 1779, dated 
Highlands ; also, Captain, 6th Mass. regt. ; list of settlements of rank of Con 
tinental officers, dated West Point, made by a Board held for the purpose and 
confirmed by Congress Sept. 6, 1779 ; commissioned Jan. 1, 1776 ; also, Captain 
and Major, Col. Nixon s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from 
Jan. 1, 1780, to Dec. 31, 1780; reported as serving 9 mos. 15 days as Captain, 
2 mos. 15 days as Major; also, Captain, Col. Nixon s (6th) regt. ; pay rolls for 
Jan.-Dec., 1780; also, Major, Col. Nixon s regt.; list of officers promoted in 
the Continental Army and for whom warrants were made out [year not given] ; 
also, 2d Major, Lieut. Col. Calvin Smith s (6th) regt. ; return of commissioned 
officers, dated April 23, 1782 ; commissioned Oct. 16, 1780 ; also, same regt. ; 
returns for wages for the years 1781 and 1782 ; wages allowed said Spurr for 24 
months ; also, Major, Col. Nixon s regt. ; return of officers entitled to the com 
mutation of five years full pay in lieu of half pay, agreeable to act of Con 
gress of March 22, 1783 ; also, order on Capt. Benjamin Heyward, for wages etc., 
dated Providence, March 17, 1784, signed by said Spurr, payable to Maj. Asa 
Coburn. 

SPURR, JOSEPH, "Wrentham. Matross, Capt. Perez Cushing s co. ; pay abstract for 
mileage from home to camp at Boston where company joined Col. Thomas 
Crafts s (Artillery) regt., etc., sworn to at Boston, Dec. 7, 1776; also, Capt. 
Perez Cushing s (9th) co., Col. Crafts s (Artillery) regt. ; joined regiment 
Nov. 9, 1776 ; service to Feb. 1, 1777, 2 mos. 21 days ; roll sworn to in Suffolk 
Co. 

SPURR, JOSEPH. Corporal, Capt. Israel Trow s co., Col. John Daggett s regt.; 
entered service Jan. 12, 1778 ; discharged March 31, 1778 ; service, 2 mos. 20 
days; company drafted to serve for 3 months from Jan. 1, 1778, under Maj. 
Gen. Spencer at Rhode Island. Roll sworn to at Norton. 

SPURR, LEMUEL, Milton. Private, Capt. John Bradley s (Milton) co. of militia, Col. 
Lemuel Robinson s regt., which rendered service after the fight at Concord and 
before completion of the standing army ; service, 4 days. 

SPURR, LEMUEL. Private, Capt. Aaron Smith s co., Col. Benjamin Gill s regt.; 
enlisted Sept. 29, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 29, 1777 ; service, 2 mos. 8 days (also 
given 2 mos. 1 day) , including 12 days (240 miles) travel home ; company 
marched to reinforce Northern army. Roll sworn to in Suffolk Co.

SPURR, SAMUEL. Corporal, Capt. Theophilus Lyon s co. ; entered service March 1, 
1778; discharged April 5, 1778; service, 36 days; company marched to Castle 
Island March 1, 1778, under command of Lieut. Col. Samuel Pierce. 

SPURR, THOMAS, Boston. Private, Capt. Edward Payson Williams s co., 36th 
regt. ; company return dated Camp at Fort No. 2, Oct. 5, 1775 ; also, Capt. 
Williams s co., Col. Greaton s regt. ; order for bounty coat or its equivalent 
in money dated Cambridge Camp, Dec. 22, 1775. 

SPYWOOD, NEHEMIAH, Sherburne. List of men raised to serve in the Continental 
Army from Col. Bullard s (5th Middlesex Co.) regt., as returned by Aaron 
Gardner, Captain, 1st co., and Moses Perry, Lieutenant, 9th co. ; residence, 
Sherburne; engaged for town of Sherburne; joined Capt. Alexander s co., 
Col. Wigglesworth s regt.; term, 3 years; also, list of men mustered by 
Nathaniel Barber, Muster Master for Suffolk Co., dated Boston, March 30, 
1777; Capt. Alexander s co., Col. Wigglesworth s regt.; reported received 
State bounty; also, Private, Major s co., Col. Calvin Smith s (late Wiggles- 
worth s) regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from March 15, 
1777, to Sept. 20, 1777; reported died Sept. 20, 1777; also, Capt. Nathaniel 
Alexander s co., Col. Edward Wigglesworth s regt. ; return [year not given] ; 
mustered by Maj. Barber. 

SQIRES, STEPHEN. Private, Capt. Samuel Sloan s co., Col. Asa Barns s regt. ; en 
tered service Oct. 11, 1781 ; discharged Oct. 28, 1781 ; service, 14 days ; mileage 
out (80 miles) allowed ; company marched from Berkshire Co. at request of 
Gen. Stark on an alarm at Saratoga. 

SQUAIRE, DAVID, Granville. List of men raised for the 6 months service and re 
turned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return dated Camp 
Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780. 

SQUATPAN, TOMO. Private, Capt. Ambrose Bear s detachment of Indians ; entered

Jonathan Eddy on expedition against Fort Cumberland, N. S. 

SQUEIR, ELIAS. Receipt dated June 26, 1776, for wages for 2 mos. service in the 
winter of 1775-6 in Capt. Selah Heart s co., Col. Erastus Woolcot s regt.

SQUEYAH, DANIEL. Private, (late) Capt. Keep s co. commanded by Lieut. John 
Wright, Col. William Shepard s (3d) regt.; muster roll for July and Aug., 
1778 ; enlisted May 1 [year not given] ; enlistment, 8 months. 

SQUIER, ANDREW. Capt. David Wheler s co. ; service, 6 days ; company marched 
from Lanesborough to Meloomscuyck Aug. 14, 1777, on an alarm. 

SQUIER, DANIEL. Private, (late) Capt. Caleb Keep s co. commanded by 1st Lieut. 
John Wright, Col. William Shepard s (3d) regt. ; muster rolls for Oct. and 
Nov., 1778, dated Providence ; enlistment, 9 months ; reported sick at Norwich 
in Oct., 1778; deserted Nov. 30, 1778.

SQUIER, JAMES. Private, Capt. Lemuel Stewart s co. ; entered service July 2 [1775] ;

at Albany, Jan. 27, 1776.

Col. Murray s regt., in 1780. 

SQUIER, NOBLE. Account of cash paid by the Selectmen of Northampton to men 
who engaged to serve in the Continental Army or who were detached from 
militia at various times, dated Northampton, Jan. 4, 1778 [9] ; said Squier 
appears among militia men who enlisted for 8 months ; mileage for 140 miles 
was allowed in the account to said men but was later crossed out; also, Pri 
vate, Capt. Abner Pomeroy s co., Col. Ezra Wood s regt.; service, 7 mos. 27 
days ; regiment raised for 8 months, agreeable to resolve of April 20, 1778, and 
marched to the state of New York ; also, same co. and regt. ; pay roll for part 
of May and the month of June, 1778; said Squier credited with 11 days ser 
vice, being 3 days preceding march and 8 days (160 miles) travel; also, same 
co. and regt. ; pay rolls for Aug., Sept., Oct., and Dec., 1778 ; also, same co. and 
regt. ; pay roll for Jan. and part of Feb., 1779, sworn to at Soldier s Fortune; 
said Squier credited with 1 mo. 10 days service, being 1 mo. 2 days in camp 
and 8 days (160 miles) travel; also, order on Lieut. Potter, Paymaster, Col. 
Wood s regt., payable to Capt. Abner Pomeroy, dated Southampton, April 10, 
1779, signed by said Squier and others, for wages due from Oct, 1, 1778, to the 
end of their service : Capt. Pomeroy s receipt for above wages, dated Brook- 
field, June -, 1779, appears on reverse of order.

Pope s co., Col. Shepard s regt. ; term, 3 years or during war. 

SROUT, BENJAMIN. Private, Lieut. William Nickels s co., Col. Benjamin Foster s 
(Lincoln Co.) regt.; marched Sept. 16, 1777; discharged Oct. 8, 1777; service, 
22 days ; company marched to Machias on an alarm and served there when 
British ships lay in the harbor. 

STABEHEN, CHARLES. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental

as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Spring- 
field, Aug. 2, 1780 ; age, 36 yrs. ; stature, 6 ft., 1 in. ; complexion, light ; engaged 
for town of Walpole ; arrived at Springfield July 31, 1780; marched to camp 
Aug. 2, 1780, under command of Lieut. Benjamin Pike. [See Charles Stab- 
kins and Charles Stebehen.]

gaged for town of Walpole; arrived at Springfield July 31, 1780; marched to 
camp Aug. 2, 1780, under command of Lieut. Benjamin Pike. [See James 
Stabkins and James Stebehen.]

STABSTON, WILLIAM. Private, Lieut. Job Winchel s detachment, Col. Hallet s 
regt. ; enlisted July 19, 1780; discharged Oct. 30, 1780; service, 3 mos. 22 days, 
including 10 days (200 miles) travel home ; regiment raised for 3 months. 

STAGEY, ABEL, Taunton. Private, Capt. Oliver Soper s co., Col. Timothy Walker s 
regt. ; company return dated Oct. 6, 1775 ; also, company receipt, given to Capt.

company receipt, given to Capt. Oliver Soper, for wages for July and Aug.,

force Continental Army; affidavit dated Marblehead, June 25, 1840, made by

to be a true copy of the original found among his father s papers, and that the 
service was rendered at Rhode Island.

Wrentham ; joined Col. Poor s regt. ; term, 3 years, to expire Jan. -, 1780.

regt. ; service, 25 days, on the alarm at Rhode Island of Dec. 8, 1776; travel

Williams s (Bristol Co.) regt. ; age, 23 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 8 in. ; complexion, 
dark; hair, black; eyes, dark; engaged for town of Taunton.

joined Col. Ichabod Alden s regt. ; term, 3 years.

Wade s regt. ; enlisted June 22, 1778 ; service at Rhode Island ; enlistment to 
expire Jan. 1, 1779; also, descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Conti 
nental Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780 ; 
age, 19 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 7 in. ; complexion, light ; engaged for town of 
Belchertown ; arrived at Springfield July 4, 1780 ; marched to camp July 5, 
1780, under command of Capt. Frothingham, of the artillery; also, payroll for 
6 months men detached from militia of the town of Belchertown for service in 
the Continental Army during 1780; marched from home July 4, 1780; dis 
charged Oct. 26, 1780; service, 3 mos. 30 days, including 8 days (150 miles) 
travel home.

arrived at Fishkill June 21, 1778.

formerly commanded by Col. Ichabod Alden ; muster roll for March arid April, 
1779, dated Fort Alden and sworn to in Quarters at Cherry Valley ; enlisted 
June 9 [1778] ; discharged March 9, 1779; term, 9 months. 

STACY, SAMUEL, 2d. Descriptive list of men raised for the term of 9 months from 
the time of their arrival at Fishkill, dated Taunton, May 16, 1778, returned as 
mustered by James Leonard, Muster Master; Capt. Ichabod Leonard s (6th) 
co., Col. George Williams s (Bristol Co.) regt. ; age, 21 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 8 
in.; complexion, dark ; hair, black; eyes, black; engaged for town of Taunton. 

STACY, SILAS. Private, Capt. Asahel Wheeler s co., Col. Jonathan Read s regt.; 
enlisted Sept. 28, 1777; service, 41 days, in Northern department; mileage 
(200 miles) from home to camp allowed. 

STACY, SIMON, Monson (also given Wilbrahain) . Private, Capt. Paul Langdon s 
co., Col. Timothy Danielson s regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted 
May 4, 1775; service, 3 mos. 5 days; also, company return dated Oct. 6, 1775; 
also, order for money in lieu of bounty coat dated Roxbury Camp, Dec. 25, 
1775. 

STACY, SIMON. Descriptive list of men raised in Hampshire Co. to serve in the 
Continental Army for the term of 9 months, agreeable to resolve of June 9, 
1779, as returned by Noah Goodman, Superintendent; Capt. Shaw s co., Col. 
Bliss s regt. ; age, 25 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 10 in. ; complexion, red ; hair, red ; en 
gaged for town of Monson ; reported delivered to William Storey. [See Simeon 
Stacey.] 

STACY, WILLIAM, Monson. Private, Capt. Reuben Munn s (Monson) co. which 
marched April 21, 1775, in response to the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Cam 
bridge; left Cambridge April 27, 1775; service, 10 days; also, Capt. Aaron 
Charles s co., Lieut. Col. Timothy Robinson s detachment of Hampshire Co. 
militia; muster roll dated Garrison at Ticonderoga, Feb. 24, 1777; enlisted 
Dec. 25, 1776; enlistment to expire March 25, 1777; also, Capt. Reuben 
Munn s co., Col. Elisha Porter s regt.; entered service Sept. 26, 1777; dis 
charged Oct. 18, 1777 ; service, 30 days, with Northern army, including travel 
(140 miles) home; company detached to join army under Gen. Gates and 
serve for 30 days. 

STACY, WILLIAM, New Salem. Major, Col. R. Woodbridge s (25th) regt. ; engaged 
April 27, 1775; service, 3 mos. 12 days; also, orders of the day, dated May 10, 
and Cambridge, May 13, May 28, and June 3, 1775 ; said Stacy, Major, appointed 
field officer of the main guard May 11, May 14, and May 29, 1775, field officer 
of the picket guard June 3, 1775 ; also, general orders dated June 8, and June 
13, 1775 ; said Stacy, Major, appointed officer of fatigue June 9, 1775, officer of 
the picket guard June 13, 1775; also, Major; return of officers in Col. Wood-

STACY, WILLIAM, continued. 

bridge s regt. recommended for commissions, dated Cambridge Camp, June 
10, 1775; ordered in Provincial Congress June 21, 1775, that said officers be 
commissioned; also, general order issued by Maj. Gen. Putnam, dated Camp 
at Prospect Hill, July 15, 1775 ; said Stacy, Major, appointed officer of fatigue ; 
also, Lieutenant Colonel ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from 
Jan. 1, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; reported taken prisoner Nov. 11, 1778; also, 
Lieutenant Colonel of a regiment formerly commanded by Col. Ichabod Alden ; 
return of field, staff, and commissioned officers who were in camp on or before 
Aug. 15, 1777, etc., certified at Cherry Valley, Feb. 24, 1771); appointed Nov. 
6, 1776; also, Lieutenant Colonel and Captain, 7th co., Col. Ichabod Alden s 
(6th) regt. ; muster roll for March and April, 1779, dated Cherry Valley ; 
appointed Oct. 1, 1778 ; reported taken prisoner Nov. 11, 1778 ; also, Lieu 
tenant Colonel, 4th Mass. regt. ; list of settlements of rank of Continental 
officers, dated West Point, made by a Board held for the purpose and con 
firmed by Congress Sept. 6, 1779; commissioned Jan. 1, 1777. 

STACY, WILLIAM, Pepperell (also given Chelmsford) . Descriptive list dated Feb. 
20, 1782; Light Infantry co., Lieut. Col. John Brooks s (7th) regt.; age, 19 
(also given 20) yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 10 in. ; complexion, light (also given dark) ; 
hair, light (also given dark) ; occupation, blacksmith ; birthplace, Chelms 
ford ; residence, Pepperell (also given Chelmsford) ; engaged for town of 
Chelmsford; engaged April 22, 1782 ; term, 3 years; also, Light Infantry co., 
Lieut. Col. Brooks s (7th) regt. ; list of men who died or were discharged 
subsequent to Jan. 1, 1781; said Stacy discharged June 15, 1783, by Gen. 
Washington ; reported an officer s servant. 

STACY, WILLIAM, Townsend. Private, Capt. Thomas Hovey s co., Col. Nathan 
Tyler s regt. ; enlisted July 6, 1779: discharged Dec. 25, 1779; service, 5 mos. 
25 days, at Rhode Island; also, same co. and regt.; payroll for Dec., 1779, 
allowing 1 mo. 5 days service at Rhode Island, including travel (100 miles) 
home. 

STACY, WILLIAM, Townsend. List of men raised to serve in the Continental Army 
from Capt. Hosley s co., Col. Jonathan Reed s (6th Middlesex Co.) regt., dated 
Littleton, May 29, 1777 ; residence, Townsend ; enlisted for town of Townsend ; 
joined Capt. Maxwell s co., Col. Bailey s regt. ; enlistment, 3 years; also, Pri 
vate, Capt. McFarland s corps of invalids ; Continental Army pay accounts 
for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to May 1, 1780; reported transferred from Col. 
Bailey s regt. ; also reported discharged ; also, discharge dated Boston, May 1, 
1780, signed by Lieut. Osgood Carleton, by order of the Commandant, granting 
a discharge from the Continental Army to said Stacy, of the corps of invalids, 
and late of Col. John Bailey s regt., he being unfit for service on account of 
lameness contracted while in the service of the United States ; also, memorial 
addressed to the Council, dated Boston, Aug. 25, 1780, signed by John Lucas, 
Commissary of Invalids, in behalf of said Stacy, a soldier in Capt. Hugh Max 
well s co., Col. John Bailey s regt., who had been rendered unfit for any kind 
of guard or garrison duty by reason of lameness contracted while in the service 
of the United States, claiming for said Stacy the rights and privileges allowed 
soldiers in such cases, under resolve of Sept. 25, 1778 ; ordered in Council Aug. 
20, 1780, that said Stacy be entitled to half pay from May 1, 1780. 

STACY, WILLIAM. Capt. William Hooper s co. ; company receipt for advance pay 
for 1 month, given to Daniel Hopkins, dated Salem, Sept. 20, 1775. 

STACY, WILLIAM (also given WILLIAM, Jr.) . List of 6 months men raised agree 
able to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as received of Maj. Joseph Hosmer, 
Superintendent for Middlesex Co., by Justin Ely, Commissioner, dated Spring 
field ; also, descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental Army for

the terra of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as received 
of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Springfield, July 
9, 1780 ; age, 17 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 9 in. ; complexion, ruddy ; engaged for town 
of Townsend; arrived at Springfield July 9, 1780; also, pay roll for 6 months

ing 1780; marched July 6, 1780; discharged Dec. 16, 1780; service, 5 mos. 21 
days, travel (220 miles) included. 

STACY, WILLIAM. Private, Capt. Daniel Bowker s co., Col. Webb s regt. ; enlisted 
Aug. 18, 1781 ; discharged Nov. 30, 1781 ; service, 3 mos. 22 days, including 10 
days (206 miles) travel home ; regiment raised to reinforce Continental Army 
for 3 months. 

STACYS, CALEB, Belchertown. List of men raised for the 6 months service and re 
turned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return dated Camp 
Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780. 

STADDARD, SAMUEL. Private, Capt. Eliphalet Thorp s co., Lieut. Col. John Brooks s 
(7th) regt. ; muster roll for Jan., 1782, dated York Huts ; enlisted Feb. 8, 1781 ; 
enlistment, 3 years ; reported transferred to light infantry co. Jan. 1, 1782. 

STADELY, JOHN. Private, Capt. Thomas Starret s detachment from Col. Mason 
Wheaton s regt. ; service from June 29, 1779, to July 2, 1779, 4 days, at Camden, 
Eastern department. 

STADER, CHRISTIAN. Private, Capt. John H. Wendell s co., Col. Goose Van 
Schaick s (1st New York) regt. ; muster roll for Jan., Feb., and March, 1781, 
dated West Point; enlistment, during war; also, (late) Capt. Wendell s co., 
Col. Van Schaick s regt. ; muster roll for April, 1781, dated West Point ; re 
ported on command at Stony Point. 

STADLEY, BENONI. List of men mustered ; said Stadley appears among men raised 
from Col. Wood s regt. for service at Rhode Island ; Capt. Seagres s (Sea- 
grave s) co. ; engaged for town of Uxbridge ; mustered July 7 [year not given, 
probably 1778]. 

STADMAN, JONATHAN. Receipt dated Westminster, March 28, 1781, for bounty paid 
said Stadman by a committee of the town of Westminster to serve in the Con 
tinental Army for the term of 3 years, agreeable to resolve of Dec. 2, 1780. 

STAFFARD, JOHN. Copy of a company receipt, given to Capt. Squire Millard, dated 
Warwick, for wages and billeting for service for 1 day on an alarm Nov. 21, 
1776. 

STAFFORD, . [This name also appears under the form of Staffard, Stalford, Star- 
ford, Straff ard.] 

STAFFORD, CYRUS, New Providence. List of men mustered between Jan. 20, 1777, 
and June 1, 1778, by Truman Wheler, Muster Master for Berkshire Co. ; term, 
3 years ; also, Private, 6th co., Col. John Bailey s regt. ; Continental Army pay 
accounts for service from May 24, 1777, to Sept. 15, 1778 ; reported died Sept. 
15, 1778; also, Capt. Isaac Warren s (6th) co., Col. Bailey s regt.; company 
return dated Camp Valley Forge, Jan. 24, 1778 ; residence, New Providence ; 
mustered by County Muster Master. 

STAFFORD, DANIEL. Ensign, Capt. Amos Green s co. of militia under command 
of Col. Joseph Noyes, Commander of militia stationed at South Kingston ; en 
listed Dec. 28, 1776; service to Jan. 8, 1777, 12 days. 

STAFFORD, DAVID. Pay roll for 6 months men raised by the town of Adams for 
service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; marched to camp June 30, 1780 ; 
discharged Dec. 7, 1780; service, 5 mos. 14 days, including travel (140 miles)

borne [see David Haford] ; also, Fifer, Capt. Levi Brown s co., of Adams,

STAFFORD, JOAB. Colonel, serving as Captain of a company of volunteers which 
marched from New Providence at request of Maj. Gen. Schuyler to reinforce 
troops under Col. Warner at Manchester; marched July 16, 1777; returned 
July 30, 1777; service, 15 days; also, Colonel, serving as Captain of an Inde 
pendent co. of volunteers raised from the alarm lists of New Providence, 
Laneshorough, East Hoosuck, and Gageborough, which marched Aug. 14, 
1777, and fought in battle near Bennington Aug. 16, 1777 ; service, 6 days. 

STAFFORD, JOAB. Private, Capt. Samuel Low s co., Col. Benjamin Simonds s 
(Berkshire Co.) regt. ; entered service Oct. 13, 1780; discharged Oct. 21, 1780; 
service, 9 days, by order of Gen. Fellows on an alarm at the Northward. 

STAFFORD, JOAB, Jr. Private, Lieut. Jeremiah Brown s detachment, Col. Asa 
Barnes s regt. ; entered service Oct. 13, 1781 ; discharged Oct. 29, 1781 ; service, 
16 days ; detachment raised in Adams, ordered out on the alarm of Oct. 13, 
1781, and joined army under Gen. Stark at Saratoga. 

STAFFORD, JOHN. Ensign ; copy of a company receipt, given to Capt. Squire 
Millard, dated Warwick, for wages and billeting for service for 1 day on an 
alarm Nov. 21, 1776; also, Capt. Squire Millard s co., Col. John Waterman s 
regt. ; pay abstract for wages and billeting allowed from Dec. 4, 1776, to Jan. 
9, 1777 ; said Stafford credited with 36 days allowance ; also, copy of a company 
receipt, given to Capt. Squire Millerd, dated Warwick, for wages and billet 
ing for service from Dec. 4, 1776, to Jan. 9, 1777 ; also, 1st division, Capt. 
Millerd s co., Col. Waterman s regt.; service from Jan. 9, 1777, to Feb. 3, 
1777, 31 days ; also, same division, co., and regt. ; service from April 6 to April 
20, 1777, 15 days ; also, list of men drafted from Capt. Squire Millard s (2d 
Warwick) co. Sept. 28 [year not given], 

STAFFORD, JOHN. Descriptive return made by Edward Procter, Colonel of Boston 
regt., of men who had enlisted to serve in the Continental Army for the term 
of 6 months from the time of their arrival at place of rendezvous, unless sooner 
discharged, and who had received bounty and mileage due them of said Col. 
Procter; Capt. Hodgdon s co. ; age, 28 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 8 in. ; complexion, 
dark ; also, descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental Army 
for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as re 
ceived of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Capt. Lieut. John Cal lender, of 3d 
Artillery battalion, at Springfield, July 6, 1780 ; age, 28 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 7 in. ; 
complexion, ruddy ; engaged for town of Boston ; arrived at Springfield July 
5, 1780. 

STAFFORD, JOHN R. Adjutant, in a detachment from 3d Mass. regt. commanded 
by Maj. B. Porter; returns of effectives between July 11, 1783, and Aug. 14, 
1783, made by said Stafford ; also, Ensign and Adjutant, in a detachment from 
3d Mass. regt. commanded by Maj. B. Porter; return of effectives, made by 
said Stafford, dated Aug. 21, 1783; also, Adjutant, 3d Mass. regt. commanded 
by Col. M. Jackson ; return of effectives, made by said Stafford, dated Oct. 31, 
1783. 

STAFFORD, PRIMUS. Marine, ship " General Putnam," commanded by Capt. Daniel 
Waters; engaged July 12, 1779; service to Sept. 7, 1779, 1 mo. 25 days, on 
Penobscot expedition. 

STAFFORD, PRINCE. List of men raised in Essex Co. for the term of 9 months from 
the time of their arrival at Fishkill, returned as received of Jonathan Warner,

Commissioner, by Col. R. Putnam, July 20, 1778; engaged for town of Salem;

STAFFORD, RICHARD. Private, Capt. Samuel Low s co., Col. Benjamin Simonds s 
(Berkshire Co.) regt. ; entered service Oct. 13, 1780; discharged Oct. 21, 1780; 
service, 9 days, by order of Gen. Fellows on an alarm at the Northward ; also, 
Capt. Levi Brown s co., of Adams, Col. Asa Barnes s (Berkshire Co.) regt. ; 
entered service Oct. 30, 1781; discharged Nov. 7, 1781; service, 9 days; com 
pany detached on the alarm of Oct. 30, 1781, and joined army under Gen. Stark 
at Saratoga. 

STAFFORD, SAMUEL. Private, Capt. Sylvanus Rice s co., Col. Israel Chapen s (3d) 
regt. ; enlisted Oct. 27, 1779 ; discharged Nov. 22, 1779 ; service, 1 mo. 2 days, 
at Claverack, including 6 days (120 miles) travel home. 

STAFFORD, SAMUEL. Capt. Samuel Low s co., Col. Benjamin Simonds s (Berkshire 
Co.) regt. ; entered service Aug. 14, 1777 ; discharged Aug. 19, 1777 ; service, 
6 days, at Bennington ; also, Private, Capt. William Clark s co., Col. Simonds s 
regt.; entered service Oct. 13, 1780; discharged Oct. 18, 1780; service, 6 days, 
on an alarm at the Northward ; company marched from Windsor to Shaftsbury 
Oct. 13, 1780, by order of Gen. Fellows; also, Lieut. John Cole s co., Col. Ben 
jamin Simonds s regt. ; entered service Oct. 26, 1780; discharged Oct. 28, 1780; 
service, 3 days; company marched from Windsor Oct. 26, 1780, by order of 
Gen. Fellows on an alarm at the Northward; also, Sergeant, Capt. Samuel 
Clark s co., in a detachment from Col. Barnabas Sears s regt. ; engaged July 
18, 1781; discharged Nov. 2, 1781; service, 3 mos. 21 days, "up the Mohawk 
River," including 5 days (100 miles) travel home ; regiment raised for3months ; 
roll sworn to in Berkshire Co. 

STAFFORD, STUKELY. Ensign, Capt. Thomas Rice s co., Col. John Waterman s 
regt. ; copy of a pay abstract for wages and billeting allowed from Dec. 1, 1776, 
to Jan. 6, 1777; said Stafford credited with 34 days allowance. 

STAFFORD, THOMAS, Hancock. List of men raised for the 6 months service and 
returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return dated 
Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780; also, pay roll for 6 months men raised by the 
town of Hancock for service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; marched 
July 5, 1780; service, 3 rnos. ; reported enlisted for the war Oct. 5, 1780. 

STAFFORD, THOMAS. Private, Capt. Samuel Barnard s co. of militia, Col. Thomas 
Gardner s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 3 days. 
Roll endorsed " Watertown." 

STAFFORD, THOMAS. Corporal, Capt. John S. Dexter s (4th) co., Col. Christopher 
Greene s (1st Rhode Island) battalion ; muster roll for July, 1779, dated East 
Greenwich ; enlisted May 1, 1779 ; enlistment, during war. 

STAGG, JOHN. Private, Capt. John H. Wendell s co., Col. Goose Van Schaick s 
(1st NCAV York) regt. ; muster roll for Jan., Feb., and March, 1781, dated West 
Point; enlistment, during war; also, (late) Capt. Wendell s co., Col. Van 
Schaick s regt. ; muster roll for April, 1781, dated West Point. 

STAGGS, JOSEPH. Seaman, brigantine " Tyrannicide," commanded by Capt. John 
Cathcart ; engaged May 20, 1779 : discharged June 23, 1779 ; service, 1 mo. 3 
days ; roll sworn to in Suffolk Co. ; also, Quarter Master, same vessel and 
commander; engaged June 24, 1779; discharged Sept. 6, 1779; service, 2 mos. 
14 days ; roll sworn to at Boston. 



IN THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 809 

STAGPOLE, ABSALOM. Private, Capt. Samuel Grant s co., (late) Col. Storer s regt. ; 
entered service Aug. 14, 1777 ; discharged Oct. 23, 1777 ; service, 85 days, with 
Northern army, including 15 days (300 miles) travel home ; company discharged 
at Queman s Heights. 

STAGPOLE, JOHN. Private, Capt. George Rogers s co., Col. Nathaniel Jordan s 
regt.; enlisted Sept. 23, 1779; discharged Oct. 23, 1779; service, 1 mo., at 
Falinouth. 

STAIN, EDWARD. Private, Capt. John Dennis s co., in a regiment commanded by 
Lieut. Col. John Parke; pay roll for Aug., 1778. 

STAIRNES, JOHN. Private, Capt. William Marean s co., Col. Jonathan Reed s (1st) 
regt. of guards; muster rolls dated Cambridge, May 9, and June 1, 1778; en 
listed March 28, 1778 ; enlistment, 3 months from April 2, 1778 ; also, Capt. 
William Marean s co., Col. Stairns s (Stearns s) regt. of guards; service from 
March 27, 1778, to July 2, 1778, 3 mos. 9 days, at Cambridge guarding troops 
of convention. 

STAIRNS, LEMUEL. Private, Capt. Christopher Banister s co., Col. Ezra May s regt. ; 
enlisted Sept. 20, 1777 ; discharged Oct. 14, 1777 ; service, 29 days, on expedi 
tion to Stillwater and Saratoga, including travel (100 miles) home. 

STAIRNS, PETER. Sergeant, Capt. Stephen Frost s co., Col. Cyprian How s regt.; 
entered service Aug. 12, 1780, 3 days preceding march; discharged Nov. 1, 
1780; service, 2 mos. 24 days, at Rhode Island, including travel (60 miles) 
home ; regiment raised for 3 months. 

STAKPOLE, ABSALOM. List of men drafted from Col. John Frost s (2d York Co.) 
regt., dated May 7, 1777, and endorsed " for R d Island." 

STALFORD, THOMAS. Certificate dated Watertown, Feb. 10, 1778, signed by Alex 
ander Shepard, certifying that said Stalford and others enlisted to serve as 
guards at the powder house at Watertown for the term of 6 months, agreeable 
to resolve of Oct. 13, 1777, and had received provisions for only a portion of 
the time. 

STALKER, . [This name also appears under the form of Stocker.] 

STALKER, ROBERT, Ipswich. Corporal, Capt. Abraham Dodge s co., Col. Moses 
Little s regt. ; receipt for advance pay, signed by said Stalker and others, dated 
Cambridge, June 23, 1775 ; also, same co. and regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 
1, 1775; enlisted May 3, 1775; service, 12 weeks 6 days; also, order for money 
in lieu of bounty coat dated Dec. 21, 1775; also, Sergeant, Capt. Abraham 
Dodge s co., Col. Moses Little s (12th) regt. ; engaged Jan. 1, 1776 [service not 
given]. 

STALKER, ROBERT. Petition dated Ipswich, Oct. 17, 1782, signed by said Stalker 
and others, asking for wages for 3 mos. service in 1780 in Capt. Benjamin 
Gould s co., Col. Nathaniel "Wade s regt. 

STALL, . [This name also appears under the form of Staul.] 

STALL, HENRY. Descriptive list of men detached from Boston regt. to serve in the 
Continental Army for the term of 9 months from the time of their arrival at 
place of rendezvous, agreeable to resolve of June 9, 1779, returned as received 
of Maj. Stephen Badlam, by Capt. Anthony Burk, at Roxbury, July 3, 1779, 
to be delivered to Justin Ely, Esq., at Springfield: age, 44 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 
10 in. ; complexion, dark ; hair, dark and short ; eyes, blue ; reported detached 
from Capt. Belcher s co. ; also, list of men returned as received of Stephen 
Badlam, Superintendent for Suffolk Co., by Justin Ely, Commissioner, at 
Springfield, July 9, 1779, at the hands of Mr. Anthony Burk; also, list of 
men returned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Capt. Christopher 
Marshall, at Springfield, July 16, 1779.

STALL, JACOB. Private, Capt. Jordan Parker s co., Col. Samuel McCobb s regt. ; 
enlisted July 16, 1781; discharged Dec. 1, 1781 ; service, 4 mos. 14 days, at the 
Eastward. Roll sworn to at Georgetown, Lincoln Co. 

STALL, JOHN. Private, Capt. Winthrop Boston s (Baston s) co. ; enlisted Jan. 29, 
1776; company raised in North Yarmouth, Brunswick, Harpswell, New 
Gloucester, New Boston (Gray) , and Windham, Cumberland Co., for 2 months 
service during the siege of Boston in 1776. 

STALL, PHILIP. Marine, "Lincoln Galley," commanded by Capt. John Curtis; en 
gaged May 19, 1781 ; discharged June 22, 1781 ; service, 1 mo. 3 days. 

STAMFORD, EBEN, Ipswich. Seaman, ship " Pilgrim," commanded by Capt. Joseph 
Robinson; descriptive list of officers and crew, dated Aug. 2, 1780; age, 34 
yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 4 in. ; complexion, light; residence, Ipswich. 

STANARD, ABRAHAM. Seaman or Marine, sloop [brigantine] "Tyrannicide," com 
manded by Capt. John Fisk; engaged June 21, 1776; discharged Sept. 30, 
1776; roll dated Salem; also, Seaman, same vessel and commander; engaged 
Sept. 30, 1776; discharged Jan. 1, 1777; roll sworn to at Boston; also, same 
vessel and commander; engaged Jan. 1, 1777; discharged Feb. 17, 1777; roll 
sworn to at Boston. 

STANARD, JOHN. Private, Capt. Noah Allen s (late Capt. Moses Soul s) co., CoL 
Asa Whitcomb s regt. ; muster roll dated Camp at Ticonderoga, Nov. 27, 1776; 
enlisted Jan. 1, 1776; also, Capt. Zenas "Wheeler s co., Col. John Ashley s 
(Berkshire Co.) regt. ; entered service July 21, 1777; discharged Aug. 15, 1777; 
service, 26 days; company marched to Fort Edward, N. Y., and received pay 
at Albany. 

STANARD, JOSEPH. Private, Capt. Nathan Rowlee s co., Lieut. Col. Timothy Rob 
inson s detachment of Hampshire Co. militia ; muster roll dated Garrison at 
Ticonderoga, Feb. 25, 1777 ; enlisted Dec. 25, 1776 ; enlistment to expire March 
25, 1777. 

STANDARD, JOHN. List of prisoners sent in the cartel " Silver Eel " from Halifax 
to Boston Oct. 8, 1778, to be exchanged for British prisoners, as returned by 
Bat. Fox, Commissary of Prisoners; reported a Seaman. 

STANDCLIFT, . [This name also appears under the form of Standlift, Stanlief, 

Stanlif, Sterndelift.] 

STANDCLIFT, SAMUEL, Sandisfield. List of men mustered between Jan. 20, 1777, 
and June 1, 1778, by Truman Wheler, Muster Master for Berkshire Co. ; Capt. 
Allen s co., Col. Wiggles worth s regt. ; term, 3 years or during war; reported 
received State bounty; also, Private, Capt. Noah Allen s co., Col. Smith s 
regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to March 
11, 1780; residence, Sandisfield. 

STANDELY, MARK. Capt. Samuel Leighton s co., Col. Ebenezer Francis s regt.; 
company receipts for wages for Aug. -Nov., 1776, dated Dorchester. 

STANDFORD, EBENEZER, Ipswich. Private, Capt. Nathaniel Wade s co., Col. Little s 
regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted May 15, 1775 ; service, 11 weeks ; 
also, order for money in lieu of bounty coat dated Sept. 21, 1775. 

STANDFORD, JOSIAH, Bradford (also given Cape Elizabeth) . Private, Capt. Smart s 
co., Col. Calvin Smith s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from 
March 9, 1777, to May 27, 1778 ; residence, Bradford ; credited to town of Brad 
ford ; reported deceased ; also, Capt. Nicholas Blasdel s co., Col. Edward Wig- 
glesworth s regt. ; return dated Camp Valley Forge, Feb. 5, 1778 : residence,

Beverly co. ; also, Capt. Billy Porter s co., Col. Ebenezer Francis s regt. ; sub

Bennington ; credited with 41 days allowance ; 240 miles travel allowed said 
Standly; company to march March 12, 1777.

month.

STANLY, JONATHAN, Cambridge. Capt. Jonathan Bardwell s co., (late) Col. David

STANLY, NATHANIEL, Raynham (also given Kingston). Private, 4th co., Col.

STANLY, NATHANIEL. General order dated Headquarters, May 27, 1776 ; said Stauly, 
of 1st co., Col. Wyllys s regt., tried by a late general court-martial, Col. 
Ritrmo[?], President, on charge of absenting himself from and refusing to 
join said company after he had received a month s advance pay and blanket 
money : found guilty and sentenced to receive 39 lashes on the bare back and 
be confined 7 days on bread and water. 

STANLY, NICHOLAS. Private, Capt. Benjamin Peabody s co., Col. Jacob Gerrish s

STANWOOD, JOSEPH (also given JOHN). Private, Capt. Jonathan Evans s co., Col. 
Nathaniel Wade s regt. ; enlisted July 8, 1778; discharged Jan. 1, 1779; ser 
vice, 6 mos., at North Kingston, R. I., including 6 days (115 miles) travel 
home ; roll sworn to at Newburyport ; also, same co. and regt. ; muster roll 
dated North Kingston, Nov. 6, 1778; also, same co. and regt.; muster rolls 
sworn to at East Greenwich, Sept. 17, Sept. 22, Oct. 14, and Nov. 13, 1778; 
enlistment to expire Jan. 1, 1779. 

STANWOOD, JOSEPH. Private, Capt. Richard Titcomb s co., Col. Nathaniel Wade s 
regt. ; enlisted July 3, 1780; discharged Oct. 10, 1780; service, 3 mos. 21 days, 
including 13 days (260 miles) travel home ; company raised in Newburyport, 
Salisbury, and Amesbury; regiment raised in Essex Co. to reinforce Con 
tinental Army for 3 months. 

STANWOOD, JOSHUA. Receipts dated Sept. 16, 1775, and Gloucester, Sept. 28, 1775, 
for advance pay for 1 month and 4 weeks billeting, respectively, received of 
Michael Farley, Muster Master and Paymaster of men raised in Essex Co. for 
defence of seacoast ; said Stanwood and others raised in Gloucester and stationed 
there under Capt. Daniel Warner; also, Private, Capt. Daniel Warner s (1st) 
co. : enlisted July 19, 1775; service to Dec. 31, 1775, 5 mos. 26 days; company 
stationed at Gloucester for defence of seacoast ; also, same co. ; enlisted Jan. 
13, 1776; service to Dec. 31, 1776, 11 mos. 19 days; company stationed at 
Gloucester for defence of seacoast. 

STANWOOD, NEHEMIAH, Gloucester. List of men belonging to Capt. Barnabas 
Dodge s co. who took the oath in Middlesex Co. June 10, 1775, required by 
Congress to be taken by the Mass, army ; also, Private, Capt. Dodge s co., Col. 
Gerrish s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 30, 1775 ; service, 
9 weeks; also, Capt. Dodge s (6th) co., Lieut. Col. Loammi Baldwin s (late 
Col. Samuel Gerrish s) 38th regt. ; pay abstract for Aug., 1775, dated Camp at 
Chelsea; also, company return dated Chelsea, Oct. 2, 1775; also, order for 
money in lieu of bounty coat dated Chelsea, Dec. 27, 1775; regiment stationed 
at Chelsea; also, Capt. Dodge s co. ; list of recruits for the new establishment 
in Col. Baldwin s regt., approved by Brig. Gen. W. Heath in Camp at Cam 
bridge, Dec. 30, 1775; also, Private, Capt. Dodge s co., Col. Baldwin s regt.; 
return of men who enlisted for 1 year from Dec. 31, 1775; also, same co. and 
regt. ; abstract for advance pay for Jan., 1776, etc. ; also, same co. and regt. ; 
pay abstracts for Feb., March, and April, 1776; also, same co. and regt. ; pay 
abstracts for May and June, 1776, dated Camp at New York ; also, list of men 
belonging to the 26th regt. who engaged to continue in service for 6 weeks 
from Jan. 1, 1777; also, (late) Capt. Dodge s co. commanded by Lieut. Joseph 
Cheever, Col. Baldwin s (26th) regt.; pay abstract for travel allowance, etc., 
for the year 1776 ; reported discharged 360 miles from home. 

STANWOOD, PETER, Newbury. Private, Capt. Gideon Woodwell s detachment, 
which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Cambridge ; service to April 
23, 1775, 6 days. 

STANWOOD, PH. Corporal, Capt. George Rogers s co., Col. Nathaniel Jordan s regt. ; 
enlisted Sept. 23, 1779; discharged Oct. 23, 1779; service, 1 mo., at Falmouth. 

STANWOOD, ROB. Private, Capt. Nehemiah Curtis s co., Col. Jonathan Mitchel s 
regt. ; entered service July 7, 1779 ; discharged Sept. 25, 1779 ; service, 2 mos. 
18 days, on Penobscot expedition. Roll dated Harpswell and sworn to at 
North Yarmouth. 

STANWOOD, SAMUEL. Private, Capt. Samuel Knight s co. ; enlisted Aug. 2, 1775; 
service, 5 mos., 1 week, 5 days; company stationed at Falmouth, Cumberland 
Co., for defence of seacoast. 



IN THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 839 

STANWOOD, SAMUEL. Private, Capt. Nehemiah Curtis s co., Col. Jonathan Mitchel s 
regt. ; entered service July 7, 1779; discharged Sept. 25, 1779; service, 2 mos. 
18 days, on Penobscot expedition. Roll dated Harpswell and sworn to at 
North Yarmouth. 

STANWOOD, SOLOMON. Petition dated Boston, Sept. 18, 1782, signed by David 
Pearce, in behalf of himself and others, of Cape Ann, asking that said Stan- 
wood be commissioned as commander of the brigantine " Success " (privateer) ; 
advised in Council Sept. 18, 1782, that a commission be issued. 

STANWOOD, STEPHEN, Cape Ann. Private, Capt. Mark Pool s (Cape Ann) co., Col. 
Jonathan Titcomb s regt. ; service, 2 mos., at Bristol, R. I. ; 4 days (85 miles) 
travel allowed to place of rendezvous and 5 days (100 miles) travel allowed 
from place of discharge home ; roll dated Bristol, June 28, 1777. 

STANWOOD, STEPHEN, Gloucester. Capt. Benjamin KimbalPs co., Col. Mansfield s 
regt. ; receipt for advance pay, signed by said Stanwood and others, dated Cam 
bridge, July 1, 1775 ; also, Private, same co. and regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 
1, 1775 ; enlisted June 5, 1775 ; service, 2 mos. 1 day ; also, Capt. Kimball s co., 
Col. John Mansfield s (19th) regt. commanded by Lieut. Col. Israel Hutch- 
inson ; company return dated Winter Hill, Oct. 6, 1775 ; also, order for money 
in lieu of bounty coat dated Winter Hill, Dec. 30, 1775. 

STANWOOD, STEPHEN, Gloucester. List of men mustered by Nathaniel Barber, Mus 
ter Master for Suffolk Co., dated Boston, Feb. 14, 1779; Capt. Child s co., Col. 
Wesson s regt.; also, Private, 6th co., Col. James Wesson s (9th) regt.; Con 
tinental Army pay accounts for service from March 20, 1779, to Dec. 31, 1779; 
residence, Gloucester; also, list of men whore-enlisted between Oct. 22, 1779, 
and Nov. 24, 1779, for the war and who received State and Continental bounties, 
as returned by Maj. Joseph Pettengill, of 9th Mass. regt. ; also, Colonel s co., 
Col. Wesson s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 
1780, to Dec. 31, 1780; also, order on Henry Gardner, Treasurer, payable to 
Lieut. Col. Ezra Badlam, dated West Point, Sept. 29, 1781, signed by said 
Stanwood and others, for wages for 3 mos. service in the Continental Army in 
1780 in Capt. Nathan Dix s co., Col. Wesson s regt. 

STANWOOD, STEPHEN. Seaman or Marine, sloop "Tyrannicide," commanded by 
Capt. John Fisk ; engaged July 1, 1776; service to July 13, 1776; reported 
killed. Roll dated Salem. 

STANWOOD, STEPHEN. Private, Capt. Bradbury Sanders s (2d) co. ; enlisted Jan. 
19, 1776; discharged July 27, 1776; service, 6 mos. 9 days; company stationed 
at Gloucester for defence of seacoast. 

STANWOOD, STEPHEN. Matross, Capt. William Ellery s (1st Artillery) co. ; enlisted 
July 15, 1776: service to Dec. 31, 1776, 5 mos. 17 days; company stationed at 
Gloucester for defence of seacoast. 

STANWOOD, STEPHEN. Capt. Mark Pool s detachment of militia, Col. Jacob Gerrish s 
regt. of guards ; pay abstract for service from Nov. 12, 1777, to Feb. 3, 1778, at 
Charlestown; also, Private, Capt. Pool s co., Col. Gerrish s regt. ; muster roll 
for March, 1778, dated Winter Hill; also, same co. and regt.; service from 
Feb. 3, 1778, to April 5, 1778, 2 mos. 2 days, at Cambridge. 

STANWOOD, STEPHEN. List of men raised in Essex Co. for the term of 9 months 
from the time of their arrival at Fishkill, agreeable to resolve of April 20, 1778, 
returned as received of Brig. Gen. Jonathan Warner by Capt. John Santford, 
of Col. Malcom s regt. ; engaged for town of Gloucester; arrived at Fishkill 
July 30, 1778. 

STANWOOD, THOMAS. Private, Capt. Richard Titcomb s co., Col. Nathaniel Wade s 
regt. ; enlisted July 3, 1780; discharged Oct. 10, 1780; service, 3 mos. 21 days,

STANWOOD, WILLIAM, Brunswick. Corporal, Capt. James Curtis s co. ; muster roll 
dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 17, 1775; service, 3 mos. ; also, Sergeant, 
Capt. Curtis s co., Col. James Cargill s regt. ; engaged Aug. 26, 1775; service, 
4 mos. 16 days, in defence of seacoast ; reported as serving as Corporal from 
Aug. 9 to Aug. 26, 1775. 

STANWOOD, WILLIAM, Brunswick. Captain, 2d (Brunswick) co., 2d Cumberland 
Co. regt. of Mass, militia; list of officers returned in accordance with order of 
Council of Feb. 14, 1776, by Jonathan Mitchell and others, field officers of said 
regiment, dated North Yarmouth, April 4, 1776 ; ordered in Council June 5, 
1776, that said officers be commissioned ; reported commissioned June 5, 1776 ; 
also, Captain, 1st (Brunswick) co., 2d Cumberland Co. regt. of Mass, militia; 
return dated Brunswick, Aug. 29, 1776, made by Samuel Thompson, of three 
regiments of militia in Cumberland Co., showing numbers and equipments; 
also, Captain of a company raised in Brunswick and Harpswell ; return dated 
Falmouth, Dec. 9, 1776, signed by Col. Jonathan Mitchell and Col. Timothy 
Pike, field officers in Cumberland Co., of officers appointed to command vari 
ous companies drafted from the militia in accordance with an order of the Gen 
eral Court to serve under Col. Reuben Fogg. 

STANWOOD, WILLIAM, Brunswick. Sergeant, Capt. William Lithgow s co. ; marched 
March 11, 1776 ; service to Aug. 31, 1776, 5 mos. 21 days ; company stationed at 
Falmouth, Cumberland Co., for defence of seacoast; also, Capt. William Lith- 
gow, Jr. s co., Col. Mitchel s regt.; service from Aug. 31, 1776, to date of 
discharge, Nov. 23, 1776, 2 rnos. 23 days; company stationed at Falmouth, 
Cumberland Co., for defence of seacoast ; also, Lieutenant, Col. Tupper s regt. ; 
Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Sept. 8, 1778 ; 
reported left out of the arrangement Sept. 8, 1778; also, 1st Lieutenant, Capt. 
George White s co., Col. Ebenezer Francis s regt. ; subsistence allowed from 
date of engagement, Dec. 3, 1776, to time of arrival at Bennington ; credited with 
109 days allowance ; 368 miles travel allowed said Stanwood ; also, same co. and 
regt. ; subsistence allowed from March 20, 1777, to May 5, 1777 ; credited with 47 
days allowance ; also, 1st Lieutenant, same co. and regt. ; list of officers returned 
to be commissioned ; ordered in Council Feb. 3, 1777, that said officers be com 
missioned; reported commissioned Feb. 3, 1777; also, Lieutenant; petition 
addressed to the General Court, dated Van Schaick s Island, Aug. 31, 1777, 
signed by said Stanwood and other officers of (late) Col. Francis s regt., asking 
that Lieut. Col. Littlefield be appointed Colonel of said regiment ; also, Capt. 
George White s co., Col. Benjamin Tupper s regt. ; return dated Jan. -, 1778; 
residence, Brunswick ; mustered by Col. Varrick, Continental Muster Master. 

STANWOOD, WILLIAM. Receipts dated Sept. 16, 1775, and Gloucester, Sept. 28, 1775, 
for advance pay for 1 month and 4 weeks billeting, respectively, received of 
Michael Farley, Muster Master and Paymaster of men raised in Essex Co. for 
defence of seacoast ; said Stanwood and others raised in Gloucester and sta 
tioned there under Capt. Daniel Warner; also, Private, Capt. Daniel Warner s 
(1st) co. ; enlisted July 19, 1775 ; service to Dec. 31, 1775, 5 mos. 26 days ; com 
pany stationed at Gloucester for defence of seacoast. 

STANWOOD, WILLIAM. Private, Capt. William Lithgow s co. ; marched Feb. 19, 
1776; service to Aug. 31, 1776, 6 mos. 11 days; company stationed at Fal 
mouth, Cumberland Co., for defence of seacoast; also, Capt. William Lith- 
gow, Jr. s co., Col. Mitchel s regt.; service from Aug. 31, 1776, to date of 
discharge, Nov. 23, 1776, 2 mos. 23 days ; company stationed at Falmouth, 
Cumberland Co., for defence of seacoast.

STANWCOD, WILLIAM. List of prisoners sent from Newport, R. I., in the prison- 
ship " Lord Sandwich " and landed at Bristol March 7, 1T8. 

STANWOOD, WINTHROP. Private, Capt. John Kettell s co., Maj. Nathaniel Heath s 
detachment of guards; enlisted Aug. 3, 1779; discharged Sept. 30, 1779; ser 
vice, 2 mos. (also given 2 mos. 1 day) ; company detached from militia for 3 
months service at and about Boston ; term to expire Oct. 1, 1779. 

STAPALS, WILLIAM. Receipt dated Sanford, Feb. 13, 1781, for bounty paid said 
Stapals by James Gare, Chairman of a class of the town of Sanford, to serve 
in the Continental Army for the term of 3 years, agreeable to resolve of Dec. 
2, 1780. 

STAPE, AARON. Private, Capt. Samuel Carr s co., Col. James Wesson s regt. ; 
Continental Army pay accounts for service from May 15 [year not given], to 
; reported a transient; also reported deserted; also, same co. and regt. ; 
return dated Jan. 25, 1778; reported deserted. 

STAPEL, EBENEZER. Orders, returns, etc., taken from Capt. Benjamin Munroe s 
papers ; said Stapel appears in a list of men reported as having deserted Jan. 
17, 1778; reported returned to duty Jan. 24, 1778. 

STAPEL, JAMES. Company receipt, given to Capt. Samuel Leighton, for wages for 
Aug. and Sept., 1776, dated Dorchester. 

STAPEL, JOSIAH. Captain, 12th (6th Berwick) co., 2d York Co. regt. of Mass, 
militia ; list of officers chosen by the several companies in said regiment, as 
returned by John Frost and others, field officers, dated Kittery, April 23, 1776 ; 
ordered in Council April 29, 1776, that said officers be commissioned ; reported 
commissioned April 29, 1776. 

STAPELS, JOHN. Private, Capt. Thomas Bragdon s co., (late) Col. Storer s regt. ; 
entered service Aug. 14, 1777 ; discharged Oct. 30, 1777 ; service, 92 days, with 
Northern army, including 15 days (300 miles) travel home ; company dis 
charged at Queman s Heights. 

STAPELS, JONATHAN. Seaman, sloop "Republic," commanded by Capt. John F. 
Williams; engaged Sept. 30, 1776; service to Oct. 1, 1776. Roll sworn to in 
Middlesex Co. 

STAPELS, JOSEPH. Sergeant, Capt. Benjamin Lemont s co., Col. Nathaniel Wade s 
regt. ; enlisted June 25, 1778 ; discharged Dec. 31, 1778 ; service, 6 mos. 19 days, 
at Rhode Island, including 12 days (233 miles) travel home ; enlistment to 
expire Jan. 1, 1779; also, same co. and regt. ; muster roll dated Warwick, Nov. 
7, 1778 ; also, same co. and regt. ; muster rolls dated East Greenwich, Sept. 17, 
Sept. 23, Nov. 13, and Dec. 30, 1778. 

STAPELS, NOAH. Private, Capt. Joseph Soper s co. ; enlisted July 17, 1775 ; service 
to Dec. 31, 1775, 6 mos., under direction of field officers of 1st Plymouth Co. 
regt. ; company stationed on seacoast. 

STAPELS, SAMUEL, Hanover. Private, Capt. Amos Turner s co. of Minute-men, Col. 
John Bailey s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19,1775; service, 
14 days. 

STAPELS, SAMUEL. Private, Capt. Benjamin Lemont s co., Maj. William Lithgow s 
detachment; enlisted Sept. 15, 1779; discharged Nov. 1, 1779; service, 1 mo. 
18 (also given 1 mo. 15) days, near Penobscot. 

STAPELS, SIMO., Bedford (Biddeford). Private, Capt. Timothy Eaton s co., Col. 
Edward Wigglesworth s regt. ; pay abstract for travel allowance, etc., from 
Ticonderoga in 1776, sworn to in Suffolk Co., Jan. 31, 1777; 310 miles travel 
allowed said Stapels.

STAPELS, TIMO., Bedford (Biddeford). Private, Capt. Timothy Eaton s co., Col. 
Edward Wigglesworth s regt. ; pay abstract for travel allowance, etc., from 
Ticonderoga in 1776, sworn to in Suffolk Co., Jan. 31, 1777; 310 miles travel 
allowed said Stapels. 

STAPLE, DANIEL. Capt. George Rogers s co. ; service, 6 days; company detached 
from 2d Cumberland Co. regt. by order of Col. Jonathan Mitchel to work on 
the fort at Falmouth in Nov., 1775. 

STAPLE, EBENEZEK. Private, Capt. Simeon Cobb s co., 3d regt., Gen. Godfrey s 
brigade ; enlisted Aug. 14, 1779 ; service, 1 mo. 2 days ; company detached from 
militia to serve at Rhode Island for 4 weeks in a regiment under Capt. Samuel 
Fisher. 

STAPLE, EBENEZER. Private, Capt. Jacob Haskins s co., Col. Isaac Dean s regt.; 
entered service March 6, 1781; discharged March 14, 1781; service, 10 days; 
company raised to serve for 40 days at Rhode Island, unless sooner discharged. 

STAPLE, EDWARD. Private, Capt. Thomas Cutts s co., Maj. Daniel Littleneld s 
detachment of York Co. militia ; detached July 10, 1779 ; discharged Sept. 10, 
1779; service, 2 mos., on Penobscot expedition; mileage allowed for 150 miles 
travel home with 20 miles additional from Kittery to Wells. 

STAPLE, GEORGE, Taunton. Sergeant, Capt. Josiah King s co., Col. George Wil- 
liams s regt. ; service, 25 days, on the alarm at Rhode Island of Dec. 8, 1776; 
mileage (54 miles) allowed to camp at Warren, R. I., and home; also, Capt. 
King s co., Col. Mitchel s regt. commanded by Lieut. Col. James Williams, 
Brig. Gen. Godfrey s (Bristol Co.) brigade ; service, 8 days ; company marched 
to Tiverton, R. I., on the alarm of Aug. 2, 1780. 

STAPLE, HEZEKIAH. Capt. Elisha Shapleigh s co., (late) Col. Joseph Storer s regt. ; 
entered service Aug. 14, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 30, 1777 ; service, 123 days, in 
cluding 15 days (300 miles) travel home. Roll sworn to at Kittery. 

STAPLE, ISAAC, Kittery. Private, Capt. Tobias Fernald s co., Col. James Scam- 
mon s (30th) regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted May 22, 1775 ; ser 
vice, 2 mos. 14 days; also, company return [probably Oct., 1775], including 
abstract of pay to last of July, 1775 ; also, order for bounty coat or its equiv 
alent in money dated Camp at No. 1, Nov. 28, 1775. 

STAPLE, JAMES, Kittery. Capt. Samuel Leighton s co. ; pay abstract for mileage 
from home to Dorchester Heights in Aug., 1776 ; also, Private, Capt. Leighton s 
co., Col. Ebenezer Francis s regt. ; pay abstract for travel allowance, etc., from 
Dorchester Heights home, sworn to in Suffolk Co., Nov. 29, 1776; said Staple 
credited with allowance for 4 days (85 miles) travel. 

STAPLE, JOHN. 1st Lieutenant, Capt. Josiah Davis s (3d) co., Col. Cutt s (Cutts s) 
(3d York Co.) regt. of Mass, militia; list of officers; commissioned Dec. 14, 
1779. 

STAPLE, JOSEPH, North Yarmouth. Sergeant, Capt. Benjamin Parker s co., Col. 
Nathan (Nathaniel) Wade s regt. ; engaged June 25 [1778] ; company stationed 
at Rhode Island for 6 months. 

STAPLE, JOSEPH, Taunton. Private, Capt. Josiah King s co., Col. George Williams s 
(Bristol Co.) regt. ; service, 9 days, on the alarm at Rhode Island of Dec. 8, 
1776; mileage (54 miles) allowed to camp at Warren, R. I., and home. 

STAPLE, JOSEPH. Private, Capt. Benjamin Hooper s co. ; service from Feb. 29, 
1776, to May 31, 1776, 3 mos. ; company stationed at Falmouth for defence of 
seacoast; also, same co. ; service from Aug. 30, 1776, to Nov. 24, 1776, 2 mos. 
23 days; company stationed at Falmouth, Cumberland Co., for defence of 
seacoast.

tachment of York Co. militia: detached July 10, 1779; discharged Sept. 10, 
1779; service, 2 mos., on Penobscot expedition ; mileage allowed for 150 miles 
travel home with 20 miles additional from Kittery to Wells. 

STAPLE, JOSEPH. Private, Maj. Cogswell s co., Col. Vose s regt. ; Continental 
Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; also, Capt. 
Robert Davis s co.,Col. Vose s regt.; muster roll for Dec., 1777, sworn to at 
Camp near Valley Forge ; enlistment, 3 years ; also, same co. and regt. ; pay 
roll for Nov., 1778; also, same co. and regt. ; pay roll for Dec., 1778, sworn to 
at Providence; also, same co. and regt.; pay rolls for Jan. and Feb., 1779; 
also, (late) Capt. Davis s co., Col. Vose s regt.; muster roll for March and 
April, 1779, dated Providence. 

STAPLE, JOSEPH. Private, Lieut. Job Winchel s detachment, Col. Hallet s regt. ; 
enlisted Aug. 12, 1780 ; discharged Oct. 30, 1780 ; service, 2 mos. 27 days, at 
Rhode Island, including 8 days (160 miles) travel home ; regiment raised for 
3 months. 

STAPLE, JOSEPH. Receipt dated Biddeford, April 3, 1782, for bounty paid said 
Staple by Capt. James Carlile, Chairman of Class No. 3 of the town of Bidde 
ford, to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 3 years. 

STAPLE, JOSHUA, Taunton. Private, Capt. Joshua Wilbore s co., Col. Ebenezer 
Francis s regt. ; pay abstract for travel allowance from camp home, etc. ; said 
Staple credited with allowance for 2 days (36 miles) travel ; company drafted 
from Taunton, Raynham, Easton, Dartmouth, Freetown, Berkley, and Digh- 
ton ; warrant allowed in Council Nov. 29, 1776. 

STAPLE, JOSHUA, Taunton. Private, Capt. Ichabod Leonard s co., Col. Thomas 
Carpenter s regt. ; service, 1 mo. 9 days ; company marched from Bristol Co. 
to Rhode Island in July, 1778, to serve for 6 weeks. 

STAPLE, JOSHUA. Private, 3d co. commanded by Lieut. Noah Dean, Col. George 
Williams s regt. ; service, 7 days ; company marched from Taunton to Warren, 
R. I., via Rehoboth, on the alarm at Rhode Island of Dec. 8, 1776. 

STAPLE, JOSHUA. Sergeant, Capt. Jacob Haskins s co., Col. John Hathway s regt. ; 
entered service March 13, 1779 ; discharged April 15, 1779 ; returned home April 
17, 1779; service, 1 mo. 5 days, at Rhode Island. 

STAPLE, JOSHUA. Private, Capt. Josiah King s co., Col. Mitchel s regt. commanded 
by Lieut. Col. James Williams, Brig. Gen. Godfrey s (Bristol Co.) brigade; 
service, 8 days ; company marched to Tiverton, R. I., on the alarm of Aug. 2, 
1780. Roll sworn to at Taunton. 

STAPLE, JOTHAM, Cambridge. List of men raised to serve in the Continental Army 
from 1st Middlesex Co. regt., as returned by Lieut. Stephen Frost, agreeable 
to order of Council of Nov. 7, 1777 ; residence, Cambridge ; engaged for town 
of Cambridge: also, Capt. Abraham Watson s co., Col. John Greaton s (2d) 
regt.; return [year not given]; mustered by County Muster Master Barrett; 
reported deserted. 

STAPLE, MARK. Descriptive list of men raised to serve in the Continental Army 
for the term of 9 months, agreeable to resolve of June 9, 1779, returned as re 
ceived of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Capt. James Tisdale, at Springfield, 
Aug. 23, 1779 : Capt. Shapleigh s co., 2d regt. ; age, 18 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. (&gt; in. ; 
complexion, dark ; engaged for town of Kittery ; also, company receipt for 
equipments, given to Capt. James Tisdall, dated Springfield, Aug. 22, 1779.

STAPLE, NATHANIEL, Kittery. Private, Capt. Tobias Fernald s co., Col. James
