STAPLE, NOAH, Taunton. Private, 3d co. commanded by Lieut. Noah Dean, Col. 
George Williams s regt. ; service, 18 days ; company marched from Taunton 
to Warren, R. I., via Rehoboth, on the alarm at Rhode Island of Dec. 8, 1776; 
also, Capt. Josiah King s co. ; service, 32 days; company marched from Taun 
ton Sept. 29, 1777, under command of Col. George Williams on a secret expe 
dition and was discharged Oct. 29, 1777. 

STAPLE, PETER. List of men who moved from the town of Cape Elizabeth subse 
quent to 1776, dated Cape Elizabeth, Jan. 17, 1782, accompanying a petition of 
the Selectmen stating their inability to supply their quota. 

STAPLE, SAMUEL. Private, Capt. Josiah King s co., Col. Mitchel s regt. commanded 
by Lieut. Col. James Williams, Brig. Gen. Godfrey s (Bristol Co.) brigade; 
service, 8 days; company marched to Tiverton, R. I., on the alarm of Aug. 2, 
1780. Roll sworn to at Taunton. 

STAPLE, SETH. Private, Capt. James Williams, Jr. s co. of Minute-men, which 
marched April 20, 1775, in response to the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Roxbury ; 
discharged April 23, 1775 ; service, 6 days. 

STAPLE, SOLOMON, Kittery. Private, Capt. Tobias Fernald s co., Col. James Scam 
mon s (30th) regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 3, 1775; ser 
vice, 3 mos. 5 days; also, company return [probably Oct., 1775], including 
abstract of pay to last of July, 1775 ; also, order for bounty coat or its equiva 
lent in money dated Camp at No. 1, Nov. 28, 1775. 

STAPLE, STEPHEN, Falmouth. List of men returned by a committee for settling 
disputes between towns as to soldiers credited to them [year not given] ; said 
Staple claimed by Falmouth and Stoughtonham ; allowed to Stoughtonham . 

STAPLE, THOMAS. Descriptive list of men raised to serve in the Continental Army 
for the term of 9 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1779, returned as 
received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Capt. James Tisdale, at Springfield, 
Aug. 23, 1779 ; Capt. Shapleigh s co., 2d regt. ; age, 18 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 6 in. ; 
complexion, dark ; engaged for town of Kittery ; also, company receipt for 
equipments, given to Capt. James Tisdall, dated Springfield, Aug. 22, 1779. 

STAPLE, WILLIAM, Cohasset. List of men raised to serve in the Continental Army 
from 1st co., 5th Hampshire Co. regt., as returned by Capt. Thomas Dickin 
son, dated Deerfield, Sept. 4, 1777; residence, Cohasset; engaged for town of 
Deerfield (also given Cohasset) ; joined Capt. Jarvis s co., Col. Henry Jack 
son s regt. ; term, 3 years ; a similar list is attested by Col. David Field. 

STAPLES, . [This name also appears under the form of Stables, Stapals, Stapel, 

Stapels, Staple, Steaples.] 

STAPLES, ABIJAH. Private, Capt. Peter Penniman s co., Col. Wood s regt. ; service 
from April 18, 1777, to May 7, 1777, 21 days ; company marched for defence of 
Rhode Island ; also, Capt. Edward Seagrave s co., Col. Wade s regt. ; enlisted 
June 19, 1778 ; discharged July 12, 1778 ; service, 26 days, at Rhode Island ; 
company raised for 21 days ; roll dated Uxbridge. 



IN THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 845 

STAPLES, ABRAHAM, Mendon. Sergeant, Capt. Joseph Daniels s (3d Mendon) co., 
which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Roxbury ; service, 8 days ; 
reported returned home; also, 1st Lieutenant, Capt. Peter Penniman s (6th) 
co., Col. Ezra Wood s (3d Worcester Co.) regt. of Mass, militia; list of officers 
chosen by the several companies in said regiment, dated July 9, 1776 ; reported 
commissioned July 9, 1776; also, petition addressed to the Council, dated Men 
don, July 20, 1779, signed by said Staples, 1st Lieutenant, and other officers of 6th 
co., Col. Nathan Tyler s (3d Worcester Co.) regt. of Mass, militia, asking leave 
to resign their commissions, and stating that they had resigned, as they sup 
posed, to Maj. Daniels " Some Months past " in the absence of Col. Wood and 
Col. Tyler; ordered in Council July 22, 1779, that the resignations be accepted. 

STAPLES, ABRAHAM (also given ABRAM) . Seaman, sloop " Machias Liberty," com 
manded by Capt. Jeremiah Obrien ; engaged July 8, 1776 ; discharged Aug. 1, 
1776 ; service, 24 days ; also, list of prisoners sent from port of Halifax by order 
of Sir George Collier June 28, 1777, to be exchanged for British prisoners, as 
returned by John Emerson, Commissary; said Staples, Seaman, reported as 
having been taken in the snow " Lord Stanley," a prize of the " True Blue " 
(privateer) ; also, list of prisoners to be returned in exchange for British pris 
oners sent to New York in the cartel " Favorite," as returned by Robert Pier- 
pont, Commissary of Prisoners [year not given] ; said Staples, Seaman, to be 
exchanged for Nicholas Bavey, Seaman. 

STAPLES, ASA. Private, Capt. Benjamin Barns s co., Col. David Moseley s (Hamp 
shire Co.) regt.; service, 6 days; company marched to quell the mob at 
Northampton June 12, and June 16, 1782, and was allowed horse rations. 

STAPLES, DAVID, Bellingham. Private, Capt. Samuel Cowell s co., Col. L. Robin 
son s regt. ; enlisted Jan. 27, 1776 ; service, 2 mos. 6 days ; regiment raised in 
York and Suffolk counties. Roll dated Roxbury. 

STAPLES, EBENEZER (also given EBENEZER, Jr.), Sudbury. Descriptive list of 
men raised from 4th Middlesex Co. regt. to reinforce the Continental Army for 
the term of 9 months from the time of their arrival at Fishkill, agreeable to 
resolve of April 20, 1778, as returned by E. Brooks, Superintendent; Capt. 
Maynard s co., Col. How s regt. ; age, 18 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 8 in. ; complexion, 
light ; residence, Sudbury ; engaged for town of Sudbury ; also, list of men re 
turned as received of Jonathan Warner, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. J. Glover ; 
arrived at Fishkill July 11, 1778; also, list of 6 months men raised agreeable 
to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as received of Maj. Joseph Hosiner, Super 
intendent for Middlesex Co., by Justin Ely, Commissioner, dated Springfield; 
also, descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental Army for the 
term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as received of 
Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Springfield, Aug. 9, 
1780; age, 20 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 8 in.; complexion, light; engaged for town 
of East Sudbury ; arrived at Springfield Aug. 6, 1780 ; marched to camp Aug. 
9, 1780, under command of Capt. Daniel Lunt ; also, list of men raised for the 
6 months service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster 
in a return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780; also, Private, 7th Mass. regt. ; 
pay roll for 6 months men raised by the town of East Sudbury for service in 
the Continental Ai-my during 1780; marched Aug. 8, 1780; discharged Jan. 8, 
1781; service, 5 mos., at West Point; travel (9 days) allowed.

ited to town of Newburyport ; also, Corporal, same co. and regt. ; Continental

age, 25 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 7 in.; complexion, dark; hair, dark; occupation, 
husbandman ; birthplace, Phillipstown ; residence, Deer Island ; enlisted Dec.

charge dated June 13, 1783, signed by Gen. Washington, granting said Staples, 
a Corporal in Col. Jackson s regt., an honorable discharge from the service, 
he having served yrs. 2 mos. ; discharge also states that said Staples had 
been honored with the badge of merit for years faithful service.

Taunton; reported deserted; also, Capt. James Cooper s co., Col. Bradford s 
(12th) regt.; subsistence allowed from date of enlistment, Feb. 10 [1777], to 
time of arrival at Bennington ; credited with 49 days allowance ; also, same co. 
and regt. ; return dated Feb. 1, 1778 ; residence, Taunton ; enlisted for town 
of Taunton ; mustered by County and Continental Muster Masters ; joined 
April 1, 1777; reported missing July 6, 1777; also, descriptive list of deserters 
from (late) 14th Mass, regt., as returned by Jonathan Haskell, Adjutant, 7th 
Mass, regt., dated West Point, Aug. 19, 1782; age, 20 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 3 in. ; 
complexion, light ; hair, light ; enlisted for town of Taunton ; deserted July 
-, 1777. 

STAR, BENJAMIN, Gloucester. List of men belonging to Capt. Barnabas Dodge s 
co. who took the oath in Middlesex Co. June 10, 1775, required by Congress to 
be taken by the Mass, army; also, Private, Capt. Dodge s co., Col. Gerrish s 
regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted May 23, 1775 ; service, 10 weeks ; 
also, Capt. Dodge s (6th) co., Lieut. Col. Loammi Baldwin s (late Col. Samuel 
Gerrish s) 38th regt.; pay abstract for Aug., 1775, dated Camp at Chelsea;

money in lieu of bounty coat dated Chelsea, Dec. 27, 1775; regiment stationed 
at Chelsea; also, Private, Capt. Dodge s co., Col. Baldwin s (26th) regt.; list 
of men who enlisted to serve for 1 year from Dec. 31, 1775 ; also, same co. and 
regt. ; pay abstract for March, 1776; reported died March 4, 1776.

issued.

STARKWETHER, ELISHA. Return of sentences by a court-martial, Brig. St. Clair, 
President, appearing in a general order dated Headquarters, Ticonderoga, Oct. 
16, 1776, taken from Col. Wheelock s Orderly Book ; said Starkwether tried 
on charge of mutiny, found guilty, and sentenced to receive 20 lashes on the 
bare back and to pick oakum for a week. 

STARKWETHER, JOHN. Private, Capt. Nathaniel Ide s co., Col. Thomas Carpenter s 
regt. ; marched Aug. 1, 1780 ; discharged Aug. 8, 1780 : service, 10 days ; com 
pany marched from Rehoboth to Tiverton, R. I., on the alarm of July 31, 1780, 
and there served under Gen. Hieth (Heath) . 

STARKWETHER, OLIVER, Rehoboth (probably) . List of men drafted to march to 
Tiverton for 6 days service, dated July 28, 1780 ; also, Private, Capt. Nathaniel 
Ide s co., Col. Thomas Carpenter s regt.; marched Aug. 1, 1780; discharged 
Aug. 8, 1780 ; service, 10 days ; company marched from Rehoboth to Tiverton, 
R. I., on the alarm of July 31, 1780, and there served under Gen. Hieth (Heath).

STARNS, JONATHAN. Private, Capt. John Drury s co., Col. Ezra Wood s regt. ;

river, N. Y. ; roll sworn to in Worcester Co. ; also, same co. and regt. ; pay roll

IN THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 805 

STARR, WILLIAM. Descriptive return dated Boston, made by Edward Procter, 
Colonel of Boston regt., of men who had enlisted to serve in the Continental 
Army for the term of 6 months from the time of their arrival at place of rendez 
vous, unless sooner discharged, and who had received bounty and mileage due 
them of said Col. Procter; Capt. Kneeland s co. ; age, 30 yrs. ; stature, 5ft. 
7 in. ; complexion, brown; also, descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the 
Continental Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, 
returned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, 
at Springfield, July 11, 1780; age, 30 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 6 in.; complexion, 
ruddy ; engaged for town of Boston ; marched to camp July 11, 1780, under com 
mand of Capt. George Webb ; also, Matross, Col. Crane s regt.; pay roll for 
6 months men raised by the town of Boston for service in the Continental Army 
during 1780; marched July 1, 1780; discharged Dec. 30, 1780; service, 6 mos. 
10 days, including travel (10 days) home. 

STARR, WILLIAM. Private, Capt. William Bird s co., Col. Webb s regt.; enlisted 
Aug. 17, 1781 ; discharged Dec. 1, 1781 ; service, 3 mos. 24 days, near West Point, 
including travel (220 miles) home ; regiment raised in Suffolk and Middlesex 
counties to reinforce Continental Army for 3 months. 

STARRET, DAVID. List of prisoners on board the cartel " Hostage " to be exchanged 
for British prisoners, as returned by Thomas Stone, Commissary [year not 
given]; said Starret, Master, taken in the sloop "Retrieve" (privateer), of 
Casco Bay, by the British ship " Milford." 

STARRET, THOMAS. Captain, 2d co., Col. Wheaton s (4th Lincoln Co.) regt. of 
Mass, militia ; list of officers chosen by the several companies in said regiment,

in command of a detachment from Col. Mason Wheaton s regt. ; service from 
June 28, 1779, to July 5, 1779, 8 days, at Camden, Eastern department.

den, Eastern department. 

START, JOHN, Temple. Descriptive list endorsed "August 4 1775;" Capt. Ezra

men raised in Worcester Co. for the term of 9 months from the time of their

of Jonathan Warner, Commissioner, by Col. R. Putnam, July 20, 1778; 
arrived at Fishkill June 7, 1778.

the Continental Army, agreeable to resolve of Dec. 2, 1780, as returned by 
Seth Washburn, Superintendent; Capt. Hartwell s co., Col. Whitny s regt.; 
age, 16 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 4 in. ; complexion, light ; occupation, blacksmith ; 
engaged for town of Princeton; engaged March 16, 1781 ; term, 3 years; also, 
Private, Col. Benjamin Tupper s (10th) regt. ; service from March 16, 1781, 21 
mos. 15 days.

draw."

vice from March 11, 1778, to Dec. 31, 1779; residence, Springfield ; also, Black

STEARNS, JOHN. Copy of a list taken from Ashby records, of men who enlisted into 
the Continental Army in July, 1776, and served 5 mos. at the Westward. 

STEARNS, JOHN. List of members of committees appointed to raise men for New 
York and Canada, showing number of commissions delivered them [year not 
given, probably 1776] ; said Stearns, Captain, reported as belonging to committee 
for Bristol Co. 

STEARNS, JOHN. Private, Capt. Reuben Petty s co., Lieut. Col. Samuel Williams s 
regt.; enlisted Dec. 16, 1776; discharged March 19, 1777; service, 3 mos. 15 
days, including 12 days (240 miles) travel home. 

STEARNS, JOHN. Private, Capt. James Hosley s co. of volunteers, Col. Jonathan 
Reed s regt.; enlisted Sept. 26, 1777; discharged Nov. 9, 1777; service, 1 mo. 
15 days; company raised in Townsend, Pepperell, and Ashby, and marched to 
assist army under Maj. Gen. Gates. 

STEARNS, JOHN. Corporal, Capt. Peter Porter s detachment, Gen. Fellows s (Berk 
shire Co.) brigade ; entered service July 1, 1778 ; discharged Oct. 31, 1778 ; ser 
vice, 4 mos., under Brig. Gen. Stark at Albany; detachment raised for 6 
months. 

STEARNS, JOHN. List of men who marched from Pittsfield to Boston Dec. 31, 1775, 
thence via New York to Canada, under command of Capt. David Noble, and 
were dismissed Dec. 31, 1776; service, 1 year; also, list of men who marched 
from Pittsfield to Fort Edward July 8, 1777, under command of Capt. William 
Francis, and were dismissed Aug. 26, 1777 ; service, 7 weeks ; also, list of men 
who marched from Pittsfield to Stillwater Sept. 30, 1777, under command of 
Capt. William Francis, and were dismissed Oct. 10, 1777; service, 1 week 4 
days ; also, list of men who were drafted agreeable to order of General Court, 
marched from Pittsfield to Albany July 10, 1778, and were dismissed Dec. 1, 
1778 ; service, 20 weeks.

STEARNS, JOHN. Private, Capt. Joseph Slarrow s co., Col. Ezra Wood s regt. ; 
enlisted Aug. 20, 1778; discharged Jan. 11, 1779; service, 4 mos. 23 days, at 
Peekskill ; roll dated Leverett; also, same co. and regt.; pay roll for Sept., 
1778; reported sick in hospital, not joined; also, order on Lieut. Potter, Pay 
master, Col. Wood s regt., payable to Lieut. Thomas Hartwell, dated Litch- 
field, Nov. 13, 1778, signed by said Stearns and others, for wages for Aug. and 
Sept., 1778; also, Capt. Slarrow s co., Col. Wood s regt.; pay roll for Dec., 
1778 ; reported not joined. 

STEARNS, JOHN. Corporal, Capt. Adam Henry s co. of guards; enlisted Jan. 3, 
1779; discharged March 31 (also given April 1), 1779; service, 3 mos. (also 
given 2 mos. 29 days) ; company detached from militia to guard troops of con 
vention at Rutland for 3 months from Jan. 1, 1779. 

STEARNS, JOHN. Private, in a detachment commanded by Sergt. William Kendall ; 
enlisted July 17, 1778 ; discharged Oct. 24, 1778 ; service, 3 mos. 8 days, guard 
ing Continental stores at Concord ; also, receipt given to Joseph Hosmer, dated 
Concord, June 7, 1779, signed by said Stearns and others, for wages for ser 
vice as guards in the town of Concord under Sergt. Kendall. 

STEARNS, JOHN. Descriptive list of men raised in Middlesex Co., agreeable to re 
solve of Dec. 2, 1780, as returned by Joseph Hosmer, Superintendent for said 
county; age, 21yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 6 in. ; complexion, light; hair, light; eyes, 
blue; occupation, laborer; engaged for town of Cambridge; engaged March 
30, 1781 ; term, 3 years. 

STEARNS, JOHN. List of men mustered between June 19, 1777, and July 4, 1777, by 
Thomas Newhall, Muster Master for Worcester Co.; Capt. Gates s co., Col. 
Putnam s regt.; mustered June 26, 1777; term, 8 months; also, descriptive 
list of men raised for Continental service, as returned by Seth Washburn, 
Superintendent for Worcester Co.; Capt. How s co., Col. Grout s regt.; age, 
34yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 7 in. ; complexion, light ; engaged for town of Petersham ; 
marched July 14, 1779; also, receipt dated Petersham, April 9. 1781, for 
bounty paid said Stearns by Capt. Asa How to serve in the Continental Army 
for the term of 3 years to the credit -of the town of Petersham; also, receipt 
given to the Selectmen, dated Petersham, signed by said Stearns and others, 
for mileage allowed on march to Springfield, via Leicester; also, descriptive 
list of men raised in Worcester Co. to serve in the Continental Army, agree 
able to resolve of Dec. 2, 1780, as returned by Seth Washburn, Superintendent ; 
Capt. How s co., Col. Grout s regt.; age, 35 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 8 in.; com 
plexion, light; occupation, farmer; engaged for town of Petersham; engaged 
Feb. 9, 1781 ; term, 3 years. 

STEARNS, JOHN, Jr. Private, Capt. Rufus Allen s co. of matrosses, Col. David 
Rossetter s regt. ; entered service Oct. 14, 1780; discharged Oct. 17, 1780; ser 
vice, 3 days, on the alarm of Oct. 14, 1780; roll dated Pittsfield ; also, same co. 
and regt. ; entered service Oct. 18, 1780; discharged Oct. 21, 1780; service, 3 
days ; company marched on the alarm of Oct. 18, 1780. 

STEARNS, JONATHAN, Billerica. Private, Lieut. Colonel s (7th) co., Col. Nixon s

counts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to March 23, 1780; term, during war.

dated Aug. 1, 1775; engaged April 27, 1775; service, 3 mos., 1 week, 4 days.

returned home.

than Clapp ; service from July 9, 1777, to Aug. 12, 1777, 39 days, including

sworn to in Hampshire Co. 

STEARNS, JONATHAN. Private, Capt. David Bent s co., Col. Nathan Sparhawk s 
regt.; travel out and home, 226 miles; service at 20 miles per day, 11 days;

on an alarm. 

STEARNS, JONATHAN. Private, Capt. Samuel Hill s co., Col. Josiah Whitney s 
regt.; marched Aug. 19, 1777; service to Aug. 26, 1777, 6 days; company

marched to join Continental Army at the Northward.

enlisted March 7, 1781 ; discharged March 14, 1781 ; service, 11 days, including 
travel (60 miles) home : company marched to Rhode Island by order of His 
Excellency John Hancock to serve on a 40 days expedition.

signed by Col. Ephraim Doolittle and others, officers of his regiment, asking 
that certain officers be recommended to Gen. Washington for commissions; 
said Stearns recommended as Captain ; also, Captain, Col. Ephraim Doolittle s 
regt. ; company return dated Charlestown, Winter Hill, Oct. 6, 1775.

payable to Samuel Thomas, dated Chesterfield, April 1, 1779, signed by said 
Stearns, for all wages due him.

1779; discharged Nov. 10, 1779; service, 1 mo. 4 days; company detached 
from militia by order of Gen. Hancock to man forts at and about Boston until 
Nov. 10, 1779, and stationed at Boston under Maj. Nathaniel Heath.

from camp home ; regiment raised for 3 months.

and marched to reinforce Northern army under Gen. Gates; also, pay roll for 
same service sworn to in Worcester Co.

Thayer, with amounts due them. [The service above referred to was in Capt. 
Nathan Thayer s co., Col. Ebenezer Thayer s regt., from July 14, 1780, to Oct.

Point.]

884 MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 

STEARNS, NOAH, Littleton. Private, Capt. Moses Men-ill s co., Col. Edmund 
Phiimy s (31st) regt. ; billeting allowed from date of enlistment, May 15, 1775, 
to date of marching to headquarters, July 5, 1775 ; credited with 7 weeks 2 
days allowance; also, company return [probably Oct., 1775]; also, order for 
bounty coat dated Fort No. 2, Cambridge, Oct. 26, 1775. 

STEARNS, NOAH. Private, Capt. Isaac Woods s co., Col. Jonathan Reed s regt. of 
guards ; muster rolls dated Cambridge, May 9, and June 1, 1778 ; also, same 
co. and regt. ; joined April 1, 1778 ; service to July 3, 1778, 3 mos. 3 days, at 
Cambridge ; enlistment, 3 months from April 1 (also given April 2) , 1778. 

STEARNS, PETER, Cambridge. Private ; list of men returned as serving on main 
guard under Lieut. Col. L. Baldwin at Prospect Hill, dated July 16,1775; 
also, Capt. Benjamin Lock s co., Lieut. Col. William Bond s (late Col. Thomas 
Gardner s) 37th regt. ; company return dated Camp Prospect Hill, Oct. 6, 
1775: enlisted May 4, 1775; age, 17 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 7 in.; also, company 
receipt for wages for Oct., 1775, dated Camp Prospect Hill; also, order for 
bounty coat dated Prospect Hill, Dec. 1, 1775. 

STEARNS, PETER. Lists of men appearing under the heading " Hartwell Brook the 
first Everidge ; " said Stearns appears among men with Col. Buttrick at Rhode 
Island in 1778; also, Private, Capt. Francis Brown s co., Col. Mclntosh s 
regt., Gen. Lovell s brigade; enlisted Aug. 1, 1778: discharged Sept. 11, 1778; 
service, 1 mo. 14 days, on expedition to Rhode Island, including 3 days (60 
miles) travel home. 

STEARNS, PHINEAS, Watertown. 2d Lieutenant, Capt. Samuel Barnard s co. of 
militia, Col. Thomas Gardner s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 
19, 1775; service, 6 days; roll endorsed "Watertown;" also, Captain, 2d 
(Watertown) co., Col. Samuel Thatcher s (1st Middlesex Co.) regt. of Mass, 
militia ; list of officers chosen by the several companies in said regiment, dated 
Watertown, April 26, 1776 ; ordered in Council April 29, 1776, that said offi 
cers be commissioned ; reported commissioned April 29, 1776 ; also, petition 
addressed to the General Court, dated Watertown, March 29, 1780, signed by 
said Stearns, of Watertown, stating that he had been commissioned Captain of 
2d co., 1st Middlesex Co. regt., in April, 1776; that in March, 1777, he pre 
sented his resignation to the Council, but had never been informed whether or 
not it had been accepted ; that in Sept., 1777, he was called upon to enter the 
service, and had continued therein until Dec., 1777; that in May, 1778, he was 
called upon to serve for 8 mos. at Peekskill; that in 1779 he was ordered to 
furnish a guard for the magazines at Watertown until another could be 
appointed and had done duty for 40 days, for which he had never received any 
pay or allowance ; that in April, 1779, inasmuch as all the field officers of the 
regiment had resigned, Gen. Brooks ordered him to cause the regiment to be 
prepared for marching at the shortest notice ; that in consequence of this state 
of affairs having continued to date of his petition he had performed the duties 
of Captain and Field Officer no less than seven different times ; and as several 
of the company officers had refused to do duty when called upon and the con 
dition of the regiment was such that it could not be utilized in any emergency, 
being totally disorganized, asking that his resignation might be accepted ; 
ordered in Council April 7, 1780, that the resignation be accepted. 

STEARNS, PHINEAS. Sergeant, Capt. Samuel Farrar s co., Col. Reed s regt. ; engaged 
Sept. 29, 1777: discharged Nov. 7, 1777; service, 1 mo. 10 days; company de 
tached from Col. Eleazer Brooks s regt. to reinforce army under Gen. Gates at 
the Northward. 

STEARNS, REUBEN. Private, Capt. Joshua Whitney s co., Col. Josiah Whitney s 
regt. ; service from July 31, 1778, to Sept. 14, 1778, 1 mo. 18 days, at Rhode 
Island, including 3 days (52 miles) travel home. Roll dated Worcester.

ter roll for Dec., 1776-Feb., 1777 ; credited to town of Lexington ; enlisted Dec. 
20, 1776; regiment raised to serve until March 1, 1777. 

STEARNS, SAMUEL, Grafton. Return of men raised to serve in the Continental Army 
from Capt. Ephraim Lyon s co., 6th Worcester Co. regt. ; residence, Grafton; 
engaged for town of Grafton; joined Capt. Barns s co., Col. Biglow s regt.;

regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from April 26, 1777, to Dec. 
31, 1779; also, muster roll for Jan.-Aug., 1777, dated Van Schaick s Island and

days; also, Capt. Dow s co., Col. Bigelow s regt.; Continental Army pay 
accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to April 26, 1780.

Middlesex Co., by Justin Ely, Commissioner, dated Springfield; also, descrip 
tive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental Army for the term of 
6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as received of Justin 
Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Springfield, July 19, 1780;

tleton ; marched to camp July 19, 1780, under command of Capt. Clark ; also,

son as having passed muster in a return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780 ; 
also, pay roll for 6 months men raised by the town of Littleton for service in 
the Continental Army during 1780; marched July 15, 1780; discharged Dec. 
6, 1780; service, 5 mos. 2 days, travel (220 miles) included.

regt. ; receipt for advance pay, signed by said Stearns and others, dated Cam

ment to expire Jan. 1, 1779. 

STEARNS, SAMUEL. Private, Capt. Nathaniel Lakin s co., Col. John Jacobs s (Light

STEARNS [SAMUEL]. Private, Capt. Amos Foster s co., Col. Cyprian How s regt. ; 
entered service July 28, 1780, 3 days preceding march ; discharged Oct. 30,

miles) travel home ; company detached from 7th Middlesex Co. regt. and

force Continental Army for 3 months.

for 3 months.

STEARNS, SILAS. Private, Capt. Edward Fuller s (1st Newton) co., Col. Thatcher s

STEARNS, SIMEON. Private, Capt. Eldad Wright s co. of Minute-men, Col. Samuel 
Williams s regt., which marched April 20, 1775, in response to the alarm of

1 day. 

STEARNS, SOLOMON. Private, Capt. John Moore s (Bedford) co. of militia, which 
marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 18 days. 

STEARNS, STEPHEN, Concord (also given Cambridge). Capt. Abishai Brown s co., 
Col. John Nixon s (5th) regt. ; receipt for advance pay, signed by said Stearns 
and others, dated Cambridge, June 26, 1775 ; also, Private, same co. and regt. ; 
muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted April 24, 1775 ; service, 3 mos. 15 days ; 
also, company return dated Sept. 30, 1775; also, receipt given to Benjamin 
Hey wood, Paymaster, 4th regt., dated Camp Mt. Washington, Sept. 30, 1776, 
signed by said Stearns and others belonging to Capt. Butler s co., for wages, 
etc., due prior to Jan. 1, 1776; also, Corporal, 8th co., Lieut. Col. Thomas 
Nixon s (4th) regt. ; regimental return dated North Castle, Nov. 9, 1776; also, 
company receipts for wages for Sept., Oct., and Nov., 1776; also, same regt. ; 
return of men who engaged to serve the month of Jan., 1777, dated Springfield ; 
also, order dated Camp Chatham, Jan. 21, 1777, signed by said Stearns, for $5, 
for service in Col. Nixon s regt., payable to Richard Crispan ; also, order dated 
Chatham, Feb. 4, 1777, signed by said Stearns, for $20, for service in Col. 
Nixon s regt., payable to Lieut. Silas Walker; also, Corporal, Capt. Nathan 
Dix s co., Col. James Wesson s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for ser 
vice from March 28, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; residence, Concord; credited to 
town of Concord ; also, same co. and regt. ; return for the year 1777 ; mustered 
by Col. Barrett, State Muster Master ; also, list of men who re-enlisted between 
Oct. 22, 1779, and Nov. 24, 1779, for the war and who received State and Con 
tinental bounties, as returned by Maj. Joseph Pettengill, of 9th Mass, regt.; 
also, Sergeant, Capt. Nathan Dix s co., Col. James Wesson s (9th) regt. ; Con 
tinental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to Dec. 31, 1780; 
also, descriptive list dated Jan. 11, 1781; Capt. Dix s co., Col. Michael Jack 
son s (8th) regt. ; rank, Sergeant ; age, 24 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. Sin. ; complexion, 
light; hair, red; occupation, currier; birthplace, Charlestown ; residence, 
Cambridge; enlisted Nov. 17 [year not given], by Capt. Dix, at West Point; 
enlistment, during war.

Iday.

STEARNS, TIMOTHY, Billerica. Private, Capt. Samuel Tay s co., Lieut. Col. Webb s 
regt. ; enlisted Aug. 18, 1781 ; discharged Nov. 29, 1781 ; service, 3 mos. 22 
days, including 11 days (212 miles) travel home ; regiment raised in Suffolk 
and Middlesex counties to reinforce Continental Army for 3 months. 

STEARNS, TIMOTHY. List of men who marched from Pittsfield to Cambridge April 
22, 1775, under command of Capt. David Noble, and served 6 mos. 

STEARNS, TIMOTHY. List of men who marched from Pittsfield to Quebec Jan. 23, 
1770, and were dismissed June 20, 1770 ; service, 21 weeks 5 days. 

STEARNS, TIMOTHY. List of men who inarched from Pittsfield to Boston Dec. 31, 
1775, thence via New York to Canada, under command of Capt. Noble, and 
were dismissed Dec. 31, 1770; service, 1 year. 

STEARNS, TIMOTHY. Private, Capt. William Francis s co., Col. John Ashley s de 
tachment of militia ; entered service July 22, 1777 ; discharged Aug. 13, 1777 ; 
service, 23 days, in Northern department; also, list of men who marched from 
Pittsfield to Fort Edward July 8, 1777, under command of Capt. Francis, and 
were dismissed Aug. 26, 1777 ; service, 7 weeks. 

STEARNS, TIMOTHY. Private, Capt. David Goodwin s co., Col. Cogswell s regt.; 
entered service Sept. 25, 1778 ; discharged Dec. 31, 1778 ; service, 3 mos. 8 days ; 
company detached to guard and fortify posts at and about Boston. 

STEARNS, TIMOTHY. Private, Capt. Walter McFarland s co., Col. Cyprian Howe s 
regt. ; enlisted July 24, 1780; discharged Oct. 30, 1780; service, 3 mos. 10 days, 
including travel (60 miles) home ; regiment raised in Middlesex Co. to rein 
force Continental Army for 3 months and stationed at Rhode Island. 

STEARNS, TIMOTHY. Private, Capt. Staples Chamberlin s co., Col. Dean s regt.; 
enlisted March 7, 1781 ; discharged March 14, 1781 ; service, 11 days, including 
travel (60 miles) home ; company marched to Rhode Island by order of His 
Excellency John Hancock to serve on a 40 days expedition. 

STEARNS, WILLIAM, Rutland. List of men raised to serve in the Continental Army, 
as returned by Capt. David Bent and Capt. Phineas Walker; residence, Rut 
land; engaged for town of Rutland; joined Capt. Cogswell s co., Col. Wes 
son s regt. ; term, during war (also given 3 years) ; also, Private, Capt. Amos 
Cogswell s (2d) co., Col. James Wesson s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts 
for service from Feb. 1, 1777, to Aug. 4, 1777 ; also, same co. and regt. ; return 
dated Jan. 25, 1778 ; mustered by Capt. Newall, State Muster Master ; reported 
died Aug. 4, 1777. 

STEARNS, WILLIAM, Sutton. Private, Capt. James Greenwood s co. of militia, Col. 
Learned s regt., which marched April 20, 1775, in response to the alarm of April 
19, 1775, to Roxbury ; service, 6 days. 

STEARNS, WILLIAM. Capt. Solomon Pollard s (Billerica) co. ; list of men in camp 
at Cambridge, dated May 1, 1775.

hospital in Sept., 1783.

over, with himself, to Col. William Shepard.

rations.

STEBBINS, EBENEZER, Springfield. Private, in a Springfield co. of militia, which

command of Lieut. David Burt and Lieut. Jonathan Hale to Brookfield and

co., Lieut. Col. Timothy Robinson s detachment of Hampshire Co. militia;

Col. Elisha Porter s regt. ; entered service Sept. 26, 1777; discharged Oct. 18, 
1777 ; service, 30 days, with Northern army, including travel (140 miles) home ; 
company detached to join army under Gen. Gates and serve for 30 days.

Co., April 5, 1779 ; residence, Westfield ; engaged for town of Westfield ; joined 
Capt. Ball s co., Col. William Shepard s regt. ; term, during war.

Roll sworn to at West Springfield.

STEBBINS, FRANCIS. Ensign, Col. John Greaton s regt., Continental Army pay 
accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Oct. 8, 1778; reported resigned Oct. 
8, 1778; also, Ensign, Capt. Edward Cumpston s co., Col. Greaton s (2d) regt. ;

Oct. 6, 1778; also, Col. Greaton s regt. ; return of officers for clothing; receipt 
for said clothing, dated Boston, May 4, 1778 ; also, receipt given to Col. James 
Wesson, dated West Springfield, March 26, 1781, signed by said Stebbins, for 
w r ages as Ensign in Col. Greaton s regt. ; also, Captain, Col. David Mosley s 
regt. ; pay roll sworn to at West Springfield, made up for service of said Steb- 
bins s co., which Avas raised for support of the government at Springfield and 
Northampton June 12, and June 16, 1782, served until June 20, 1782, and part 
of it probably mounted. 

STEBBINS, GAD. Capt. Aaron Graves s co., Col. David Leonard s regt.; entered 
service May 8, 1777 ; discharged July 8, 1777 ; service, 70 days, at the North 
ward, including 10 days (206 miles) travel from camp home. 

STEBBINS, GAIUS, Wilbraham. Private, Capt. Joshua L. Woodbridge s co., Col. 
Nathan Tyler s regt. ; entered service July 22, 1779; discharged Dec. 25, 1779; 
service, 5 mos. 9 days, at Rhode Island ; roll dated Newport ; also, same co. 
and regt. ; pay roll for Dec., 1779, sworn to at Newport, allowing 1 mo. 5 days 
service at Rhode Island, including travel (93 miles) home.

also, petition dated Hull, Oct. 30, 1776, signed by said Stebbins and others, 
asking for compensation on account of having subsisted themselves for seven 
days in consequence of having been delayed in rejoining regiment at Hull by 
stress of weather, etc., they having been ordered by a resolve of June 8, 1776, 
to proceed on board the sloop " Betsey " to Falmouth, Casco Bay, as guards 
over cannon, etc., forwarded to that place; also, Corporal, Capt. Smith s co., 
Col. Whitney s regt. ; pay roll for Nov., 1776; service, 1 mo. 6 days, including 
travel (125 miles) home.

STEDMAN, DAVID. Private, Capt. William Thurlo s co. ; travel out and home, 180

STEEL, AARON, Springfield. Sergeant, in a company of Minute-men, which marched

Nov. 28, 1777 ; also, account of the seven years half pay allowed agreeable to 
resolve of Aug. 24, 1780, to widows and orphans of officers who were killed or 
died in service; [Col.] Brooks s regt.; rank, Lieutenant; reported died of 
sickness Nov. 24, 1777 ; half pay allowed to Nov. 25, 1784.

at Thomaston.

regt. ; enlisted July 11, 1779; service to Sept. 24, 1779, 2 mos. 13 days, on expe 
dition against Majorbagaduce. Roll endorsed " Regt at Penobscot." 

STEPHENS, JOHN, Andover. Private, Capt. Abbott s co., Col. Tupper s regt. ; Con 
tinental Army pay accounts for service from Feb. 19, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; 
residence, Andover ; credited to town of Andover ; also, Capt. Benjamin Far- 
num s co., Col. Ebenezer Francis s regt. ; subsistence allowed from date of 
enlistment, Feb. 19, 1777, to time of arrival at Bennington ; credited with 
allowance to March 28, 1777, 49 days, including 11 days (220 miles) travel; 
also, Capt. Farnum s co., Col. Benjamin Tupper s regt. ; return dated Jan. 24, 
1778; mustered by County and Continental Muster Masters; term, 3 years; 
also, Capt. Stephen Abbott s co., Col. Tupper s regt.; muster roll for March, 
1779, dated West Point ; reported furloughed March 2, 1779, by Col. Tupper 
for 40 days. 

STEPHENS, JOHN, Belchertown (also given Hadley) . List of men raised to serve in 
the Continental Army from Capt. Jonathan Bardwell s co., Col. R. Wood- 
bride s (Woodbridge s) 4th Hampshire Co. regt. ; residence, Belchertown ; 
engaged for town of Belchertown; joined Capt. Benson s (also given Capt. 
Shays s and Capt. Barns s) co., Col. Putnam s regt.; term, 3 years; also, 
Private, Capt. Joshua Benson s co., Col. Rufus Putnam s regt.; Continental 
Army pay accounts for service from April 2, 1777, to July 4, 1777; reported 
discharged July 4, 1777 ; also, same co. and regt. ; return dated Albany, Feb. -, 
1778; residence, Hadley; enlisted for town of Hadley; mustered by Col. 
Woodbridge. 

STEPHENS, JOHN, Brookfield. Descriptive list of men raised to serve in the Conti 
nental Army for the term of 9 months, as returned by Seth Washburn, Super 
intendent for Worcester Co.; Capt. Hamilton s co., Col. S. Rice s regt.; age, 
19 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 9 in. ; complexion, light ; residence, Brookfield ; marched 
to Springfield July 8, 1779. 



IN THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 915 

STEPHENS, JOHN, Charlton. Private, Capt. Samuel Curtis s co. (South co. of 
Minute-men in Charlton), which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; 
service, 14 days. 

STEPHENS, JOHN, Dighton. Private, Capt. Elijah Walker s co., Col. Pope s (Bristol 
Co.) regt. ; marched Dec. 8, 1776 ; service, 9 days, at Rhode Island on the 
alarm of Dec. 8, 1776 ; also, Capt. James Briggs s co. ; service, 29 days ; com 
pany marched from Dighton Oct. 2, 1777, under command of Col. Freeman on 
a secret expedition to Rhode Island and was discharged by Gen. Spencer Oct. 
29, 1777. 

STEPHENS, JOHN, Groton (also given Townsend). Private, Capt. Luke Day s co., 
Lieut. Col. John Brooks s (7th) regt. ; muster roll for Jan., 1782, dated York

send ; residence, Groton (also given Townsend) ; engaged for town of Groton ; 
engaged Jan. -, 1781 ; term, 3 years. [See Joseph Stephens.] 

STEPHENS, JOHN, Plympton. Private, Capt. Nathaniel Shaw s co., Col. James 
Warren s regt., which marched in response to the alarm of April 19, 1775. to 
Marshfield ; service, 2 days. 

STEPHENS, JOHN, Rochester. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Con 
tinental Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, 
returned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at 
Springfield, July 10, 1780; age, 20 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 9 in. ; complexion, dark; 
engaged for town of Rochester ; arrived at Springfield July 9, 1780 ; marched 
to camp July 10, 1780, under command of Capt. Daniel Shays; also, list of 
men raised for the 6 months service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as 
having passed muster in a return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780. 

STEPHENS, JOHN, Salem. Sailor, ship "Rhodes," commanded by Capt. Nehemiah 
Buffinton; descriptive list of officers and crew, sworn to Aug. 14, 1780; age, 
35 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 8 in. ; complexion, light; residence, Salem. 

STEPHENS, JOHN, Stoughton. Capt. Newcomb s (Independent) co. ; muster return 
of four Independent cos. stationed at Hull, dated March 1, 1777 ; age, 16 yrs. ; 
mustered by Daniel Souther, Muster Master.

916 MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 

STEPHENS, JOHN. Sergeant, Capt. John Nickols s co., Col. Jonathan Holman s 
regt. ; service, 30 days ; company marched Sept. 27, 1777, to reinforce Conti 
nental Army under Gen. Gates in Northern department. Roll dated Charlton. 

STEPHENS, JOHN. Capt. Peleg Peck s co., Col. George "Williams s regt. ; entered 
service Sept. 29, 1777; discharged Oct. 30, 1777; service, 1 mo. 1 day, under 
Maj. Gen. Spencer on a secret expedition; company stationed at Tiverton, 
R.I. Roll sworn to at Swanzey. 

STEPHENS, JOHN. Private, Capt. Nathaniel Hammond s co., Col. John Dagget s 
regt. ; entered service Aug. 25, 1778; discharged Sept. 1, 1778; service, 8 days; 
company detached from militia for service on expedition to Rhode Island. 

STEPHENS, JOHN. List of men mustered by Joseph Bragdon, Jr., Muster Master 
for York Co., dated York, Jan. 11, 1779; Capt. Daniel Merrill s co., (late) Col. 
Samuel Brewer s regt. ; reported received State bounty. 

STEPHENS, JOHN. Private, Capt. Keep s co., Col. Sheppard s regt.; Continental

deserted; also, certificate dated Providence, Jan. 18, 1779, signed by F. Green, 
Deputy Muster Master, certifying that said Stephens, of Lieut. John Wright s 
co., and others in Col. William Shepard s regt., had passed muster before him 
and appeared to be able-bodied men and fit for the service of the United 
States; also, Lieut. Col. Ebenezer Sprout s co., Col. Shepard s (3d) regt.; 
muster roll for March and April, 1779, dated Providence; enlisted Jan. 10, 
1779 ; enlistment, 3 years ; reported on command at Greenwich. 

STEPHENS, JOHN. Private, Capt. John Collar s co., Col. John Ashly s (Berkshire 
Co.) regt. ; entered service July 19, 1779; discharged Aug. 27, 1779; service, 1 
mo. 9 days ; company marched to Connecticut under command of Lieut. Col. 
Powel. 

STEPHENS, JOHN. Mariner, ship "Vengeance," commanded by Capt. Thomas 
Thomas; engaged June 27, 1779; discharged Aug. 27, 1779; service, 2 mos., 
on Penobscot expedition ; vessel reported lost. Roll sworn to in Suffolk Co. 

STEPHENS, JOHN. Pay roll for 6 months men raised by the town of Stoughton for

discharged Dec. 9, 1780 ; service, 5 mos. 16 days, including travel (220 miles) 
home. 

STEPHENS, JOHN. Private, Capt. Ephraim Brookins sco., Lieut. Col. John Collar s 
(Berkshire Co.) regt. ; entered service Oct. 13, 1781 ; discharged Oct. 26, 1781 ; 
service, 18 days, including 4 days (84 miles) travel home ; company marched 
by order of Col. John Ashley, Jr., on an alarm at the Northward. 

STEPHENS, JOHN. Private, Capt. Japhet Daniels s co., Lieut. Col. Calvin Smith s 
(6th) regt. ; return for wages for the year 1782 ; wages allowed said Stephens 
for 1 mo. 10 days ; reported died March 10, 1782. 

STEPHENS, JOHN, Jr. Private, Capt. Stephen Farrington s detachment; marched 
Aug. 4, 1781 ; discharged Aug. 12, 1781 ; service, 9 days, on expedition sent by 
the town of Fryeburg for relief of inhabitants on Androscoggin river ; warrant 
for pay reported as having been drawn in favor of Selectmen of Fryeburg.

at Cambridge, Oct. 6, 1775. 

STEPHENS, JONATHAN, Groton. List of men entitled to $20 or 200 acres of land, 
agreeable to resolve of March 5, 1801 ; 5th Mass. regt. ; residence, Groton.

to Capt. Gilbert s co. and other companies in Col. Converse s regt. ; engaged 
for town of Brookfield; mustered May 19 [year not given, probably 1778];

12 days, at Claverack, including 7 days (140 miles) travel home; regiment 
raised for 3 months.

Williams on a secret expedition and was discharged Oct. 29, 1777, by Gen. 
Spencer.

said Stephens discharged Sept. 1, 1782, by Gen. Washington, being old and 
worn out in the service ; also, list of men entitled to honorary badges for faith 
ful service; said Stephens served from April -, 1775; entitled to 2 stripes.

return of men who were in camp on or before Aug. 15, 1777, and who had not 
been absent subsequently except on furlough, etc., certified at Camp near 
Peekskill, Feb. 16, 1779; also, Capt. Holden s co., Col. Nixon s (5th) regt.; 
muster roll for May, 1779, dated Highlands; enlisted March 14, 1777; also, 
same co. and regt. ; pay rolls for June-Dec., 1779. 

STEPHENS, SIMEON, Gloucester. Descriptive list of men in Continental service; 
Capt. Lincoln s co., Lieut. Col. John Brooks s (7th) regt. ; age, 18yrs. ; stature, 
5 ft. 4 in.; complexion, light: hair, light; occupation, farmer; residence, 
Gloucester; engaged March 11, 1782; term, 3 years; also, Private, 4th co. ; 
return of men belonging to 7th Mass. regt. in service in Jan., 1783, who had 
not been mustered but who were entitled to pay by order of the Commander- 
in-Chief of Feb. 22, 1783; also, 3d co. ; entries dated Oct. 1(5, 1783, and Jan. -, 
1784, of orders for wages for May-Dec, [year not given], appearing in a register 
of orders accepted on account of wages, etc. 

STEPHENS, SIMEON. Descriptive return made by order of Gen. Heath, dated Jan. 
10, 1781 ; Capt. Thomas Vose s co., 3d Artillery regt. ; rank, Matross ; age, 33 
yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 7 in. ; complexion, light ; engaged for town of Dedham ; 
engaged April 12, 1777, by Sergt. Rand; term, 3 years; reported discharged 
April 12, 1780. 

STEPHENS, SIMON. Surgeon, Col. Samuel Denny s (2d) regt.; engaged Oct. 23, 
1779; discharged Nov. 26, 1779; service, 1 mo. 13 days, including 9 days (175 
miles) travel home ; regiment raised for 3 months and ordered to rendezvous 
at Claverack, N. Y. 

STEPHENS, SOLOMON. 1st Lieutenant, Capt. Silas Fowler s (llth) co., Col. John 
Mosely s (3d Hampshire Co.) regt. of Mass, militia ; list of officers chosen by 
the several companies in said regiment, endorsed "April 26 1776; " reported 
commissioned April 26, 1776. 

STEPHENS, SQUIRE. Private, Capt. Elihu Gifford s co., Col. Turner s regt. ; entered 
service July 12, 1781 ; discharged Nov. 27, 1781 ; service at Rhode Island ; 
regiment raised in Bristol and Barnstable counties to serve for 5 months. 
[See Esquire Stephens.]

STEPHENS, SYLVANUS. Fifer, Lieut. Francis Shurtleff s co., Col. Lothrop s (Plym 
outh Co.) regt. ; service, 14 days; company marched to Bristol, R. I., Dec. 11, 
1776, on an alarm; roll dated Plympton ; also, Capt. Joseph Stetson s co., 
Col. Dike s regt.; muster roll for Dec., 1776-Feb., 1777; credited to town of 
Plympton ; enlisted Dec. 28, 1776 ; regiment raised to serve until March 1, 1777 ; 
also, Private, Capt. Ebenezer Washburn s co., Col. Eleazer Brooks s regt. of 
guards; enlisted Nov. 10, 1777; service to April 3, 1778, 4 mos. 23 days, at 
Cambridge. 

STEPHENS, THEODORE, Lanesborough. Receipt dated April 11, 1781, for bounty 
paid said Stephens by Bethuel Baker, to serve in the Continental Army dur 
ing the war to the credit of the town of Lanesborough ; also, certificate dated 
Jan. 28, 1782, signed by the Selectmen of Lanesborough, certifying that said 
Stephens had been a resident of Lanesborough for about 12 months previous 
to his enlisting in 1780 to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 6 months ; 
that he had re-enlisted to serve for during war about the expiration of his 
6 months term, and had received bounty from the town of Lanesborough. 

STEPHENS, THOMAS, Andover. Private, Capt. Abbot s co., Col. Tupper s regt.; 
Continental Army pay accounts for service from March 8, 1777, to Nov. 30, 
1777; reported died Nov. 30, 1777; also, Capt. Benjamin Farnum s co., Col. 
Ebenezer Francis s regt. ; subsistence allowed from date of enlistment, March 
8, 1777, to time of arrival at Bennington : credited with allowance to March 
28, 1777, 33 days, including allowance for 11 days (220 miles) travel ; also, 
Capt. Farnum s co., Col. Benjamin Tupper s regt. ; return dated Jan. 24, 1778 ; 
residence, Andover ; enlisted for town of Andover ; mustered by County and 
Continental Muster Masters ; reported deceased. 

STEPHENS, THOMAS, Boston. Landsman, brig "Prospect," commanded by Capt. 
Joseph Vesey; descriptive list of officers and crew, sworn to in Suffolk Co., 
June 20, 1781 ; age, 21 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 11 in. ; complexion, light ; occupation, 
tailor; residence, Boston. 

STEPHENS, THOMAS, Danvers. List of men raised to serve in the Continental Army 
from 1st, 2d, 3d, and 4th cos., of Danvers; residence, Danvers; engaged for 
town of Danvers; joined Capt. Page s co., Col. Francis s regt. ; term, 3 years; 
reported as belonging to 3d Danvers co. ; also, Private, Capt. Page s co., Col. 
Tupper s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Feb 15, 1777, 
to Dec. 31, 1779; also, Capt. Samuel Page s co., Col. Ebenezer Francis s regt. ; 
subsistence allowed from date of enlistment, Feb. 15, 1777, to time of march 
ing; credited with 71 days allowance; also, Capt. Page s co., Col. Tupper s 
regt. ; return dated Jan. 25, 1778 ; mustered by Esq. Gushing, County Muster 
Master, and by Col. Verrick, Continental Muster Master; also, Maj. William 
Lithgow s co., Col. Benjamin Tupper s regt. ; muster roll for March, 1779, 
dated West Point; reported transferred to light infantry co. April 1, 1779; 
also, Capt. Page s (Light Infantry) co., Col. Tupper s regt. ; muster roll dated 
West Point, April 5, 1779 ; also, descriptive list of men in Continental ser 
vice ; Capt. Thomas Francis s co., llth Mass. regt. (also given Capt. Lunt s 
co., 10th Mass, regt.) ; rank, Corporal ; age, 23 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 7 in. ; com 
plexion, dark ; hair, brown ; residence, Danvers ; engaged Nov. 20, 1779, by 
Lieut. McKenney ; term, during war.

Stephens appears among men belonging to the company who went to Roxbury

service ; also among men who went to Rhode Island on an alarm Dec. 8, 1776, 
with Capt. Blake ; credited with service for 1 mo. ; also among men who went 
to Providence in July, 1777, with Capt. Deen to serve for 1 month ; also

STEPHENS, THOMAS, continued. 

among men who went on the 6 weeks campaign in July, 1778, with Capt.

STEPHENS, WILLIAM, New Boston. Pay roll for mileage from home for a number

29, 1776, to Feb. 29, 1776, 1 mo. 3 days ; company stationed at Plymouth for

regt. ; enlisted Oct. 9, 1775 ; service, 2 mos. 3 days ; company marched to Man

STEPHENS, WILLIAM. Private, Capt. Eliphalet Sawen s co., Col. William Mcln- 
tosh s regt.; enlisted March 25, 1778; discharged April 7, 1778; service, 13

STEPHENS, WILLIAM. Carpenter, ship "Charming Sally," commanded by Capt. 
Alexander Holmes ; list of officers, dated Boston ; vessel reported to have been 
in service from July 13, 1779, to Aug. 28, 1779, with a complement of 19 officers 
and 70 seamen and marines; 30 artillery-men reported taken on board at 
Penobscot Aug. 12, 1779, and continued on board until Aug. 28, 1779.

tion against St. Johns, N. S., and continued in service at Machias for its 
defence.

Warner, and was discharged by Gen. Lincoln after proceeding 90 miles.

STERNS, JONATHAN. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental 
Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned 
as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Spring- 
field, July 22, 1780; age, 17 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 7 in.; complexion, ruddy; en 
gaged for town of Harvard; marched to camp July 22, 1780, under command 
of Capt. "William Scott ; also, pay roll for 6 months men raised by the town of 
Harvard for service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; marched from home 
July 19, 1780; discharged Jan. 12, 1781; service, 6 mos. 2 days, including 
travel (180 miles) home. 

STERNS, JOSEPH, Attleborough. Corporal, Capt. Jabez Ellis s (Attleborough) co. 
of Minute-men and militia, which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; 
service, 11 days; also, Capt. Caleb Richardson s co., Col. Timothy Walker s 
regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted May 1, 1775 ; service, 3 mos. 
8 days. 

STERNS, JOSEPH. Private, Capt. Alexander Foster s co., Col. Thomas Carpenter s 
regt. ; service from July 27, 1778, to Aug. 12, 1778, 17 days, on expedition to 
Rhode Island. 

STERNS, JOSEPH, alias JOSIAH. Private, Capt. Fox s co.,Col. H. Jackson s regt.; 
Continental Army pay accounts for service from Aug. 2, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779. 

STERNS, JOSEPH. Private, Capt. Simon Larned s co., Col. "William Shepard s (4th) 
regt. ; muster roll for May, 1781, dated West Point ; enlisted March 3, 1781 ; 
enlistment, 3 years; also, muster roll for Aug., 1781, sworn to at Peokskill; 
also, muster roll for Sept., 1781, dated Camp Continental Village ; also, muster 
roll for Oct. and Nov., 1781, dated York Hutts. 

STERNS, JOSHUA, Easton. Private, Capt. Macey Williams s co., Col. Timothy 
Walker s regt. ; company return dated Oct. 6, 1775. 

STERNS, JOSHUA. List of 6 months men raised agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, 
returned as received of Maj. Joseph Hosrner, Superintendent for Middlesex 
Co., by Justin Ely, Commissioner, dated Springfield ; also, descriptive list of 
men raised to reinforce the Continental Army for the term of 6 months, agree 
able to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as received of Justin Ely, Commis 
sioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Springfield, July 14, 1780; age, 17 yrs. ; 
stature, 5 ft. 8 in. ; complexion, light; engaged for town of Concord ; marched 
to camp July 14, 1780, under command of Capt. Hancock. 

STERNS, JOSHUA. Drummer, Capt. William Treadwell s co., Col. John Crane s 
(Artillery) regt. ; muster roll for Aug. and Sept., 1781; reported on command 
at West Point ; enlistment, during war. 

STERNS, JOSIAH, alias JOSEPH, Billerica. Private, Capt. Fox s co., Col. Henry 
Jackson s regt. ; Continental Anny pay accounts for service from Aug. 2, 1777, 
to Dec. 31, 1779 ; residence, Billerica ; also, Capt. Lemuel Trescott s co. detached 
from Col. David Henley s regt. ; pay rolls for April and May, 1778, sworn to at 
Providence; also, Capt. Joseph Fox s co., Col. Henley s regt.; pay roll for 
Nov., 1778; also, Capt. Fox s co., Col. Jackson s regt. ; muster roll for April, 
1779, dated Pawtuxet ; enlisted Aug. 2, 1777 ; enlistment, 3 years ; also, Capt. 
Fox s (7th) co., Col. Jackson s regt. ; return dated Camp Providence, July 8, 
1779 ; also, same co. and regt. ; pay roll for July, 1779 : also, same co. and regt. ; 
pay roll for Oct., 1779, dated Camp Providence ; also, same co. and regt. ; regi 
mental return made up to Dec. 31, 1779, dated Camp at Providence.

STETSON, NATHAN. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental Army 
for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as

for town of Pembroke; arrived at Springfield July 8, 1780; marched to camp 
July 9, 1780, under command of Lieut. Jackson, of the artillery; also, payroll 
for 6 months men raised by the town of Pembroke for service in the Continen 
tal Army during 1780; marched July 4, 1780; discharged Dec. 19, 1780; ser 
vice, 5 mos. 26 days, including travel (200 miles) from camp home.

given name Joseph has been interpolated above the name John, evidently at

IX THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 955 

STEVENS, BIMSLEY, Andover. List of officers chosen by the several companies in 
4th Essex Co. regt. of Mass, militia, as returned by Samuel Johnson and others, 
field officers, dated Andover, March 26, 1776 ; said Stevens recommended for 
Adjutant of said regiment ; ordered in Council April 3, 1776, that said officers 
be commissioned; reported commissioned April 3, 1776; also, official record of 
a ballot by the House of Representatives, dated April 22, 1776 ; said Stevens 
chosen Adjutant, 4th Essex Co. regt. of Mass, militia ; appointment concurred 
in by Council April 23, 1776; also, Adjutant, Col. Samuel Johnson s regt.; 
engaged Aug. 14, 1777; discharged Nov. 30, 1777; service, 4 mos., in Northern 
department, including 13 days (260 miles) travel home ; also, return for rations 
allowed officers in Col. Samuel Johnson s regt., sworn to in Middlesex Co., 
June 5, 1778 ; rations allowed said Stevens from Aug. 14 [1777], to Dec. 12 [1777] ; 
credited with 240 rations. 

STEVENS, " CABINAH." Private, Capt. John Lane s co., Col. Foster s regt. ; entered 
service Jan. 15, 1776; discharged Feb. 15, 1776; service, 1 mo.; company 
stationed at Cape Ann for defence of seacoast ; also, Capt. Daniel Giddiugs s 
co., Col. Joseph Foster s regt. ; entered service Feb. 15, 1776; discharged June 
10, 1776; service, 3 mos. 24 days; company stationed at Gloucester for defence 
of seacoast; also, Seaman or Marine, sloop [brigantine] "Tyrannicide," com 
manded by Capt. John Fisk : engaged June 10, 1776 ; discharged Sept. 30, 1776 ;

30, 1776 ; discharged Jan. 1, 1777 ; roll sworn to at Boston ; also, same vessel 
and commander; engaged Jan. 1, 1777; discharged Feb. 17, 1777; roll sworn 
to at Boston.

IN THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 959 

STEVENS, EBENEZER, continued. 

regt., certified at Morristown, Jan. 29, 1780, by said Stevens, Lieutenant Colonel 
Commandant, and Brig. Gen. H. Knox ; also, communication addressed to the 
Board of War, dated Park of Artillery near New Windsor, Dec. 12, 1780, signed 
by said Stevens, Lieutenant Colonel of Artillery, stating tbat it had come under 
his observation that certain officers who had been granted furloughs had re 
ceived clothing from the State, while those officers who had remained in the 
field attending to their duties had been neglected in this particular respect, 
and inasmuch as Col. Crane, Lieut. Col. Hopkins, Maj. Eustis, and other artil 
lery officers who had been furloughed had received clothing and linen, while 
he, the said Stevens, had received nothing of the sort from the State since 1778, 
requesting that he might be granted a quantity of clothing equal to what had 
been allowed the officers referred to; also, return of officers and men belonging 
to Massachusetts in Col. Lamb s (2d Artillery) regt., dated Park of Artillery, 
Jan. 10, 1781, and signed by said Stevens, Lieutenant Colonel of said regiment.

STEVENS, JABEZ, Fitchburg. Private, Capt. Josiah Sterns s co., Col. Ephraim 
Doolittle s regt. ; nmster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted July 27, 1775; ser

Island and sworn to in Camp at Stillwater ; enlisted Feb. 27, 1777 ; enlistment, 
3 years (also given during war) ; also, muster roll for Nov., 1777, sworn to at 
Camp near " the Gulf ; " also, return dated Feb. 2, 1778 ; residence, Fitchburg ; 
enlisted for town of Fitchburg ; mustered by Middlesex Co. Muster Master ; also, 
muster rolls for Dec., 1777-May, 1778, dated Valley Forge; also, muster roll 
for June, 1778, dated Camp Greenwich ; also, muster rolls for July, 1778-June, 
1779, dated Providence; reported sick at Fitchburg in Jan., 1779, sick and 
absent in Feb., 1779, absent with leave in March and April, 1779, on command 
at Warwick in June, 1779; also, muster roll for July, 1779; reported on com 
mand at Pound Ridge ; also, muster roll for Aug., 1779, dated Camp at Salem; 
reported on command at Pound Ridge ; also, muster roll for Sept., 1779, dated 
Bedford; also, muster roll for Oct., 1779, sworn to at Camp Peekskill; also, 
muster roll for Nov. and Dec., 1779, dated Highlands; also, muster roll for 
Jan.-June, 1780, dated Camp Robinson s Farms ; reported discharged Feb. 27, 
1780.

shire Co.) regt. ; enlisted July 18, 1780; discharged Oct. 19, 1780; service, 3 
mos. 1 day, at Stone Arabia, X. Y. 

STEVENS, JOHN. Pay roll for 6 months men raised by the town of Rochester for

home. 

STEVENS, JOHN. Private, Capt. Daniel Bowker s co., Col. Webb s regt.; enlisted 
Aug. 18, 1781 ; discharged Nov. 30, 1781 ; service, 3 mos. 22 days, including 
10 days (208 miles) travel home ; regiment raised to reinforce Continental 
Army for 3 months. 

STEVENS, JOHN. Receipt dated Groton, April 5, 1781, for bounty paid said Stevens

Day s co., Lieut. Col. John Brooks s (7th) regt.; muster roll for May, 1781,

command at the Lines ; also, muster rolls for June and July, 1781 ; also, mus 
ter rolls for Oct., Nov., and Dec., 1781, dated York Hutts; also, muster roll 
for Feb., 1782, dated Hutts. 

STEVENS, JOHN. Private, in a company commanded by Lieut. Stephen Farington ; 
entered service Aug. 8, 1782; discharged Nov. 22, 1782; service, 3 mos. 14 
days ; company raised in and for defence of York and Cumberland counties 
and stationed at " Sudbury-Canada." Roll dated Fryeburg. 

STEVENS, JOHN. Receipt dated July 10, 1784, signed by Peter Stevens, for wages 
due said John Stevens for service to May 10, 1783, on board the frigate " Hague," 
commanded by Capt. John Manley. 

STEVENS, JOHN, Jr., Salisbury. Private, Capt. Jonathan Evans s co. of Minute-

1775; also, return of men who lost articles at the battle of Bunker Hill, June

including 10 days (200 miles) travel home ; regiment raised in Worcester Co. 
to reinforce Continental Army for 3 months ; also, order on Henry Gardner, 
Treasurer, payable to Capt. Ephraim Stearns, dated Petersham, May 16, 1782, 
signed by said Stevens and others, for wages for 3 mos. service in Col. Rand s 
regt. at West Point in 1780.

Prescott s regt., who had been taken captive at the Charlestown fight and had 
later died ; money in lieu of coat reported as having been paid to Mr. John 
Boynton.

travel (60 miles) home.

STEVENS, SIMEON, Methuen. Abstract sworn to in Suffolk Co., Sept. 26, 1776, for 
advance pay for 1 month, etc., due said Smith and Ebenezer Forest, soldiers 
belonging to Capt. Josiah Smith s co., Col. Whitney s regt. ; order on David 
Jeffries, payable to Capt. Smith, dated Camp at Hull, Sept. 26, 1776, signed 
by said Stevens and Ebenezer Forest, for amounts due, appears on reverse of 
abstract ; also, Private, same co. and regt. ; service between Aug. 1, 1776, and 
Nov. 1, 1776, 2 mos. 6 days; also, same co. and regt. ; pay roll for Nov., 1776; 
service, 1 mo. 3 days, including travel (60 miles) home. 

STEVENS, SIMEON. Private, Capt. Samuel Johnson s co., Col. Johnson s regt. ; en 
listed Aug. 14, 1777; discharged Nov. 30, 1777; service, 4 mos., with Northern 
army, including 13 days (265 miles) travel home. Roll sworn to at Andover. 

STEVENS, SIMEON. Private, Capt. John Abbot s co., Col. Nathaniel Wade s regt. ; 
entered service July 10, 1780, 3 days preceding march ; discharged Oct. 10, 
1780 ; service, 3 mos. 11 days, at West Point, including travel (225 miles) home ; 
regiment raised for 3 months. 

STEVENS, SIMEON. Return for Feb., 1783, of the sick belonging to 1st Mass, brigade 
in hospital at New Windsor ; 7th Mass. regt. 

STEVENS, SIMON. Captain; return of Col. J. Brewer s regt., dated Cambridge, May 
18, 1775 ; reported recruiting and not joined ; also, recommendation addressed 
to His Excellency Gen. Washington, dated Nov. 4, 1775, signed by James Otis, 
on behalf of the Council, recommending said Stevens and two others for any 
vacancies that might occur in the Continental Army as they had served con 
tinuously with the forces of the Province of Mass. Bay from 1755 to the time 
of the reduction of Canada, attaining the rank of Captains, and being desirous 
of entering the service of the United Colonies. 

STEVENS, SOLOMON (also given SOLON), Springfield. Certificate dated Camp at 
Cambridge, June 18, 1775, signed by Lieut. Sylvanus Smith, in behalf of Capt. 
Robert Longley, certifying that said Stevens and others belonging to Capt. 
Longley s co., Col. Whitcomb s regt., were in need of cartridge boxes, for 
which said Smith promised to be accountable ; also, Private, Capt. Longley s 
co., Col. Asa Whitcomb s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May

STEVENS, SOLOMON (also given SOLON), continued. 

28, 1775; service, 2 mos. 9 days; also, company receipts for wages for Aug. 
and Sept., 1775, dated Prospect Hill; also, company return [probably Oct., 
1775] ; also, order for money in lieu of bounty coat dated Charlestown, Dec. 
21, 1775. 

STEVENS, SOLOMON. 1st Lieutenant, in command of a detachment from Capt. Silas 
Fowler s co., Col. John Mosley s (Hampshire Co.) regt. ; engaged Oct. 21, 
1776; returned Nov. 17, 1776; service, 28 days; detachment marched under 
command of Lieut. Col. Timothy Robinson to reinforce Northern army ; roll 
dated South wick ; also, petition addressed to the General Court, dated South- 
wick, April 1, 1779, signed by said Stevens, stating that he had been chosen 
1st Lieutenant in Capt. Fowler s (Southwick) co. at the beginning of the war 
and had served faithfully in that capacity whenever called upon, but as he 
was 54 years of age and infirm and unable to endure a campaign, requesting 
leave to resign his commission ; Col. John Mosely s approval of the request is 
annexed to petition ; ordered in Council April 8, 1779, that the resignation be 
accepted. 

STEVENS, SOLOMON, Jr. Private, Capt. Silas Fowler s co., Col. John Mosley s 
regt., Brig. Danielson s brigade; enlisted Sept. 21, 1777; discharged Oct. 17, 
1777 ; service, 1 mo. 3 days, including travel (120 miles) home ; company 
marched on expedition to Saratoga. 

STEVENS, STEPHEN. Private, Capt. Philip Ammidon s co., Col. Dean s regt. ; en 
listed March 4, 1781 ; discharged March 18, 1781 ; service, 14 days, at Rhode 
Island. 

STEVENS, THEODORE (also given THEODORUS), Lanesborough. List of men raised 
for the 6 months service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed 
muster in a return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780 ; also, pay roll for 6 
months men raised by the town of Lanesborough for service in the Continental 
Army during 1780; marched to camp Oct. 1, 1780; discharged March 1, 1781; 
service, 5 mos. 4 days, travel (80 miles) included. 

STEVENS, THOMAS, Andover. Private, Capt. Samuel Johnson s co., Col. Wiggles- 
worth s regt. ; pay abstract for travel allowance from Albany home, sworn to 
March 7, 1777 ; 210 miles travel allowed said Stevens. 

STEVENS, THOMAS, Boston. Private, Maj. Eayers s co., Col. Flower s regt, of 
Artillery artificers ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Sept. 1, 
1779, to Dec. 31, 1779; residence, Boston; also, Capt. William Hawes s corps 
of artificers; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, 
to Dec. 31, 1780; enlistment, 3 years; company stationed at Springfield. 

STEVENS, THOMAS, Boston. Private, Capt. Samuel Flowers s co., Col. John Grea- 
ton s regt. ; Continental Anny pay accounts for service from April 16, 1778, 
to Dec. 31, 1779; also, muster rolls dated Albany, April 16, and May 13, 1778; 
enlisted April 16 (also given April 11), 1778; enlistment, during war; also,

also, muster rolls dated White Plains, July 20, and Aug. 5, 1778; also, muster

service from Jan. 1, 1780, to Dec. 31, 1780; also, descriptive list dated West 
Point, Jan. 25, 1781 ; Col. John Greaton s (3d) regt. ; age, 28 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 
8 in. : complexion, dark; hair, dark; eyes, gray; residence, Boston ; enlisted 
Jan. 16, 1778, by Capt. Flower; enlistment, during war.

STEVENS, THOMAS, Danvers. Private, Capt. James Gray s co., Col. Thomas Mar 
shall s regt. ; abstract for advance pay, mileage to camp, etc., dated July 15, 
1776 ; also, same co. and regt. ; entered service July 1, 1776 ; service to Nov. 
1, 1776, 4 mos. ; also, same co. and regt.; pay roll for Nov., 1776; also, 
Corporal, Major s co., Col. Benjamin Tupper s regt.; Continental Army pay 
accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to Dec. 31, 1780; reported as serving 6 
mos. as Private, 6 mos. as Corporal ; also, Col. Benjamin Tupper s (10th) regt. ; 
service from Jan. 1, 1782, 12 mos. ; also, Capt. Benjamin Pike s co., Lieut. 
Col. Calvin Smith s regt. ; return for wages for the year 1782 ; reported received 
from 10th Mass. regt. 

STEVENS, THOMAS, Holden. Private, Capt. Seth Washburn s co., Col. Ward s regt. ; 
muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 10, 1775; service, 2 mos. 26 days; 
also, company return dated Oct. 8, 1775 ; also, list of men mustered by Thomas 
Newhall, Muster Master for Worcester Co. ; Capt. Treadwell s co., Col. Crane s 
regt. ; mustered June 27, 1777; term, 3 years ; reported received State bounty; 
also, Corporal, Capt. William Treadwell s co., Col. John Crane s (Artillery) 
regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from May 21, 1777, to May 
21, 1780; residence, Holden ; credited to town of Holden. 

STEVENS, THOMAS, Machias. List of men raised to serve in the Continental Army 
from 1st Duxbury co., Col. Theophilus Cotton s (Plymouth Co.) regt., as re 
turned by Capt. Joshua Hall, dated July 22, 1779 ; residence, Machias ; engaged 
for town of Duxbury; joined Capt. Allen s co., Col. Alden s regt. ; term, dur 
ing war. 

STEVENS, THOMAS, Taunton. Corporal, Capt. Peter Pitts s co., Col. Timothy 
Walker s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 2, 1775; service, 
3 mos. 6 days ; also, Private, Capt. Edward Blake s co., Col. George Williams s 
(Bristol Co.) regt. ; service, 25 days, on the alarm at Rhode Island of Dec. 8, 
1776; travel (54 miles) allowed to camp at Warren, R. I., via Rehoboth, and 
home; also, Capt. Josiah Crocker s (1st) co., Col. Thomas Carpenter s regt. ; 
service, 1 mo. 9 days ; company marched from Taunton to Rhode Island by 
order of Council of July -, 1778, to serve for 6 weeks. 

STEVENS, THOMAS. Private, Capt. Noah Moulton Littlefield s co. ; abstract for 
wages for 1 month and 4 weeks billeting; company stationed at Wells for 
defence of seacoast ; order for payment of amount of abstract dated Wells, 
Sept. 16, 1775, and signed by Capt. Littlefield; also, same co. ; enlisted July 
10, 1775 ; service, 6 mos. 6 days ; company stationed at Wells and Arundel for 
defence of seacoast. 

STEVENS, THOMAS. Petition dated Boston, April 29, 1777, signed by James Mug- 
ford, of Marblehead, asking that said Stevens be commissioned as commander 
of the brigantine " Velona" (privateer), designed to join the fleet at Boston 
under Commodore John Manly ; ordered in Council April 29, 1777, that a com 
mission be issued ; also, petition dated Boston, Nov. 2, 1777, signed by Margaret 
Ladd, stating that the sloop on which she and her husband had taken passage 
from Cork to Jamaica had been captured by a privateer from Marblehead, of 
which said Stevens was Captain, and the passengers made prisoners; that her 
husband had been separated from her and sent to some port in France, and 
begging leave to be sent in the cartel bound to New York whence she could re 
turn to her friends ; ordered in Council Nov. 3, 1777, that the petition be granted. 

STEVENS, THOMAS. Private, Capt. Caleb Keep s co., Col. Israel Chapen s regt.; 
enlisted Oct. 18, 1779; discharged Nov. 21, 1779; service, 1 mo. 10 days, at 
Claverack, including 6 days (120 miles) travel home ; regiment raised to rein 
force Continental Army for 3 months.

allowance from Dorchester Heights borne ; said Stevens credited with allow

Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to June 23, 17HO; residence, 
Falmouth ; reported died June 23, 1780. 

STEVENS, WILLIAM, Harvard. Receipt dated Hull, June 22, 1776, signed by said

by said Stevens and others, for mileage (180 miles) allowed on march from 
Harvard to Danbury.

poll in said precinct ; said Stevenson credited with 8^ mos. service.

Rathbum ; list of officers and men entitled to prize shares in the " Loyalty " 
and Wreck [year not given]. 

STEWART, LEMUEL. Captain ; engaged May 3, 1775 ; returned May 23, 1775 ; ser 
vice, 25^ days, on expedition against Ticonderoga and Crown Point ; also, 
Captain ; entered service June 27 [1775] ; service, 6 mos. 4 days ; also, billeting 
roll of said Stewart s co. ; credited with 55 days allowance ; amount of billeting 
for company paid on a warrant from Maj. Gen. Schuyler and receipted for by 
said Stewart at Albany Jan. 27, 1776. 

STEWART, MICHAEL, Gloucester. Fifer, Capt. Gideon Parker s co., Col. Moses 
Little s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted June 24, 1775; service, 
1 mo. 10 days; also, order for money in lieu of bounty coat dated Camp Pros 
pect Hill, Dec. 28, 1775. 

STEWART, MICHAEL. Private, Capt. Gideon Parker s co., Col. Moses Little s (12th) 
regt. ; enlisted Jan. 1, 1776 [service not given]. 

STEWART, MOSES. Private, Capt. David Mosely s co., Col. John Mosely s regt.; 
enlisted Sept. 21, 1777; discharged Oct. 17, 1777; service, 1 mo. 3 days, on 
expedition to Saratoga, including travel (120 miles) home ; also, return of 
3 and 6 months men raised in Hampshire Co. from (late) Col. Moseley s regt. 
by order of Brig. Gen. Danderson (Danielson), dated Hampshire Co., Oct. 26, 
1780; Capt. Sloper s co. ; engaged for town of Blandford ; term, 3 mos.; re 
ported mustered by Lieut. Col. Timothy Robinson ; also, Private, Capt. Levi 
Ely s co., Col. John Brown s regt.; entered service Aug. 9, 1780; discharged 
Oct. 22, 1780; service, 2 mos. 21 days, including 7 days (140 miles) travel 
home ; regiment raised for 3 months. 

STEWART, NATHANIEL, Lanesborough. Private, Capt. Asa Barns s co., Col. Benja 
min Ruggles Woodbridge s regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted 
May 25, 1775; service, 68 days; also, company return dated Sept. 28, 1775; 
also, order for money in lieu of bounty coat dated Cambridge, Nov. 13. 1775; 
also, Sergeant, Capt. David Wheler s co., Col. Benjamin Simonds s detachment 
of Berkshire Co. militia : muster roll dated Camp at Ticonderoga, Feb. 25, 
1777; term to expire March 15, 1777 ; also, Capt. Wheler s co.. Col. Simomls a 
regt.; entered service Dec. 16, 1776; discharged March 22. 1777: service, 1*5 
days, at Ticonderoga: also, Capt. Ebenezer Newell s co., Col. Symonds s 
regt. ; service, 6 days ; company marched from Lanesborough to Meloomseuyck 
Aug. 14, 1777, on an alarm. 

STEWART, PAUL, Winchendon. Private, Capt. Jonathan Sibley s co., Col. Luke 
Drury s regt. ; entered service Aug. &lt;&gt;, 1781 : marched Aug. 13. 1781 : arrived 
at camp Aug. 22, 1781: discharged Nov. 21, 1781: service, 3 mos. 23 days, 
including 10 days (200 miles) travel home: residence, Winchendon: engaged 
for town of Winchendon ; regiment raised for 3 months. 

STEWART, PAUL. Descriptive list of men raised in Worcester Co. to serve in the 
Continental Army, agreeable to resolve of Dec. 2, 1780, as returned by Seth 
Washburn, Superintendent for said county, June 12 [ ?], 1781 ; Capt. Hunter s 



1004 MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 

STEWART, PAUL, continued. 

co., Col. Keyes s regt. ; age, 17 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 4 in.; complexion, light; 
occupation, farmer; engaged for town of New Braintree; engaged March 10, 
1781 ; term, 3 years. 

STEWART, PELEQ, Rochester. Descriptive list of men in Continental service ; Capt. 
William Mills s co., Lieut. Col. John Brooks s (7th) regt. ; age, 16 (also given 
15) yrs.; stature, 4 ft. 11 (also given 4 ft. 9.^) in.; complexion, black; hair, 
wool (also given black) ; birthplace, Rochester ; residence, Rochester ; engaged 
for town of Rochester; engaged Dec. -, 1781; term, during war; reported a 
mulatto; also, Private, Capt. Mills s co., Lieut. Col. Brooks s regt.; muster 
rolls for Dec., 1781, Jan. and Feb., 1782, dated York Hutts; also, return of re 
cruits sent by the state of Massachusetts as portion of her quota of the Continen 
tal Army subsequent to Jan. 1, 1781, who were reported as unfit for duty; 7th 
Mass. regt. ; also, return of recruits belonging to 7th Mass. regt. who had been 
mustered out by the Inspector General, dated "West Point, May 26, 1782 ; age, 15 
yrs. 5 (also given 15 yrs. 4) mos. ; stature, 4 ft. 9^ in.; residence, Rochester; 
enlisted Dec. -, 1781 ; enlistment, during war ; also, return of men belonging 
to 7th Mass. regt. who were transferred to the regiment of invalids or assigned 
to other duties or to be discharged, dated West Point, June 23, 1782 ; said 
Stewart reported "for the Adj. Genl guard;" also, list of men discharged 
subsequent to Jan. 1, 1781; said Stewart discharged June 10, 1783, by Gen. 
Washington, term of enlistment having expired. 

STEWART, PETER, Falmouth. Capt. Samuel Noyes s co., Col. PhinnSy s (31st) 
regt. ; billeting allowed from date of enlistment, June 22, 1775, to date of 
marching from Falmouth to headquarters, July 13, 1775 ; credited with 3 weeks 
allowance ; also, Private, same co. and regt. ; company return dated Fort No. 
2, Cambridge [probably Oct., 1775]. 

STEWART, RICHARD, Leominster. Private, Capt. David Wilder s co. of Minute- 
men, Col. John Whetcomb s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 
1775 ; service, 10 days. 

STEWART, " REDIAT," Marlborough. Private, Capt. William Brigham s (Marl- 
borough) co. of militia, Col. Jonathan Ward s regt., which marched on the 
alarm of April 19, 1775, to Cambridge ; service, 5 days. 

STEWART, ROBERT, Colrain (also given Ipswich and New Salem). Private, Capt. 
John Wood s co., Col. Paul Dudley Sargent s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 
1775 ; enlisted May 15, 1775 ; service, 2 mos. 21 days ; also, company return 
[probably Oct., 1775] ; reported as having gone to Canada ; also, return of men 
raised to serve in the Continental Army from Capt. Endicott s co., Col. Ben 
jamin Gill s regt. ; residence, Colrain ; enlisted for town of Stoughton ; joined 
Capt. Child s co., Col. Greaton s regt.; enlistment, 3 years; also, return of 
men raised to serve in the Continental Army from 1st Cambridge co. ; residence, 
Ipswich; enlisted for town of Cambridge; joined Capt. Chiles s (Childs s) co., 
Col. Greaton s regt.; enlistment, during war; also, return of men raised to 
serve in the Continental Army from 1st Essex Co. regt., sworn to at Salem 
by John Flagg, 1st military officer of the town of Lynn ; residence, New 
Salem; engaged for town of Lynn; joined Capt. Cotton s co., Col. Greaton s 
regt. ; also, list of men returned by a committee for settling disputes between 
towns as to soldiers credited to them ; said Stewart claimed by Stoughton and 
Colrain ; allowed to Stoughton ; also, list of men mustered by Nathaniel Bar 
ber, Muster Master for Suffolk Co., dated Boston, Feb. 16, 1777 ; Capt. Childs s 
co., Col. Greaton s regt. ; reported received State bounty ; also, Sergeant, Capt. 
Abijah Childs s co., Col. John Greaton s (2d) regt. ; Continental Army pay 
accounts for service from Feb. 11, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; credited to town of 
Cambridge ; reported as serving 15 mos. 9 days as Sergeant, 19 mos. 11 days as
